ā

ā

prefix. intensifier; back; here ✓

Grammar prefix
Meaning intensifier; back; here
Sanskrit ā

pa, parā, ni, nī, u, du, saṃ, vi, ava, anu, pari, adhi, abhi, pati, su, ā, ati, api, apa, upa, pahāro, parābhavo, nihāro, nīhāro, uhāro, duhāro, saṃhāro, vihāro, avahāro, anuhāro, parihāro, adhihāro, abhihāro, patihāro, suhāro, āhāro, atihāro, apihāro, apahāro, upahāro, evaṃ vīsati upasaggehi ca.

kaccāyana nāmakappa 221
ākaṅkhati

pr. (+acc) wishes (for); wants; desires; aspires (for) [ā + √kaṅkh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning wishes (for); wants; desires; aspires (for)
Root Family ā √kaṅkh
Root √kaṅkh･1 a (wish for)
Base √kaṅkh + a > kaṅkha
Construction ā + kaṅkha + ti
Sanskrit ākāṅkṣati
Sanskrit Root √kāṅkṣ 1 (desire)

ākaṅkheyya ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu, sabrahmacārīnaṃ piyo ca assaṃ manāpo ca garu ca bhāvanīyo cā'ti, sīlesv'ev'assa paripūrakārī ajjhattaṃ cetosamatham'anuyutto anirākatajjhāno vipassanāya samannāgato brūhetā suññ'āgārānaṃ.

MN 6 ākaṅkheyyasuttaṃ

bhikkhu siyā jhāyī vimuttacitto,
ākaṅkhe ce hadayass'ānupattiṃ,
lokassa ñatvā udayabbayañ'ca,
sucetaso anissito tadānisaṃso'ti.

SN 2.2 dutiyakassapasuttaṃ
ākaṅkhanta

prp. (+acc) wishing (for); desiring; seeking; aspiring (for) [ā + √kaṅkh + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of ākaṅkhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning wishing (for); desiring; seeking; aspiring (for)
Root Family ā √kaṅkh
Root √kaṅkh･1 a (wish for)
Base √kaṅkh + a > kaṅkha
Construction ā + kaṅkha + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Variant ākaṅkhī
Commentary (DHPa) tasmā'ti yasmā tasiṇāya purakkhatā paliveṭhitā sattā, tasmā attano virāgaṃ rāg'ādivigamaṃ nibbānaṃ patthento ākaṅkamāno bhikkhu arahattamaggen'etaṃ tasiṇaṃ vinodaye panuditvā nīharitvā chaḍḍeyyā'ti attho.
Sanskrit ākāṅkṣat
Sanskrit Root √kāṅkṣ 1 (desire)

sace, bhante, aññatitthiyapubbā imasmiṃ dhammavinaye ākaṅkhantā pabbajjaṃ, ākaṅkhantā upasampadaṃ cattāro māse parivasanti, catunnaṃ māsānaṃ accayena āraddhacittā bhikkhū pabbājenti

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ

tasiṇāya purakkhatā pajā,
parisappanti saso'va bandhito.
tasmā tasiṇaṃ vinodaye,
bhikkhu ākaṅkha'virāgam'attano.

DHP 343 taṇhāvaggo
ākaṅkhamāna

prp. (+acc) wishing (for); desiring (for); seeking (for) [ā + √kaṅkh + a + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of ākaṅkhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning wishing (for); desiring (for); seeking (for)
Root Family ā √kaṅkh
Root √kaṅkh･1 a (wish for)
Base √kaṅkh + a > kaṅkha
Construction ā + kaṅkha + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Commentary (VIN 1.4.3.9) ākaṅkhamāno'ti icchamāno.
Sanskrit ākāṅkṣamāṇa
Sanskrit Root √kāṅkṣ 1 (desire)

bahū devā manussā ca,
maṅgalāni acintayuṃ,
ākaṅkhamānā sotthānaṃ,
brūhi maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.

KHP 5 maṅgalasuttaṃ

maccherā ca pamādā ca,
evaṃ dānaṃ na dīyati,
puññaṃ ākaṅkhamānena,
deyyaṃ hoti vijānatā'ti.

SN 1.32 maccharisuttaṃ
ākaṅkhavagga

masc. Chapter 8 of Dasakanipāta, Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.71-80 ✗
ākaṅkhasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.71 (AN10.71) ✗
ākaṅkhā

fem. longing, wish, desire [ā + √kaṅkh] ✗
ākaṅkhi

aor. wished for, desired [ā + √kaṅkh] ✗
ākaṅkhita

pp. wished for; desired [ā + √kaṅkh] ✗
ākaṅkhiya

ptp. desirable; sought-after; lit. to be wished for [ā + √kaṅkh + iya] ~

Grammar ptp of ākaṅkhati
Meaning desirable; sought-after; lit. to be wished for
Root Family ā √kaṅkh
Root √kaṅkh･1 a (wish for)
Construction ā + √kaṅkh + iya
Derivative kicca (iya)
Sanskrit ākāṅkṣya
Sanskrit Root √kāṅkṣ 1 (desire)
ākaṅkhī

adj. (+acc) wanting; wishing (for); hoping (for) [ā + √kaṅkh + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, from ākaṅkhati (+acc)
Meaning wanting; wishing (for); hoping (for)
Root Family ā √kaṅkh
Root √kaṅkh･1 a (wish for)
Construction ā + √kaṅkh + ī
Derivative kita (ī)
Sanskrit ākāṅkṣin
Sanskrit Root √kāṅkṣ 1 (desire)

tasmā sampadam'ākaṅkhī,
sampann'atthū'dha puggalo,
sampannapaññe sevetha,
evaṃ ijjhanti sampadā.

AN 8.34 khettasuttaṃ
ākaṅkheyya

ptp. desirable; should be sought after; lit. to be wished for [ā + √kaṅkh + a + eyya] ~

Grammar ptp of ākaṅkhati
Meaning desirable; should be sought after; lit. to be wished for
Root Family ā √kaṅkh
Root √kaṅkh･1 a (wish for)
Base √kaṅkh + a > kaṅkha
Construction ā + kaṅkha + eyya
Derivative kicca (eyya)
Sanskrit Root √kāṅkṣ 1 (desire)
ākaṅkheyyasutta

nt. Majjhima Nikāya 6 (MN6) [ākaṅkheyya + sutta] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning Majjhima Nikāya 6 (MN6)
Construction ākaṅkheyya + sutta
ākaḍḍhati 1

pr. (+acc) drags out; pulls away [ā + √kaḍḍh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning drags out; pulls away
Root Family ā √kaḍḍh
Root √kaḍḍh･1 a (drag, plough)
Base √kaḍḍh + a > kaḍḍha
Construction ā + kaḍḍha + ti
Sanskrit ākarṣati
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)

tāsaṃ ce, āvuso, naḷakalāpīnaṃ ekaṃ ākaḍḍheyya, ekā papateyya, aparaṃ ce ākaḍḍheyya, aparā papateyya. evam'eva kho, āvuso, nāmarūpanirodhā viññāṇanirodho, viññāṇanirodhā nāmarūpanirodho

SN 12.67 naḷakalāpīsuttaṃ
ākaḍḍhati 2

pr. (+acc) drags; pulls towards [ā + √kaḍḍh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning drags; pulls towards
Root Family ā √kaḍḍh
Root √kaḍḍh･1 a (drag, plough)
Base √kaḍḍh + a > kaḍḍha
Construction ā + kaḍḍha + ti
Commentary (MNa) ākaḍḍheyyā'ti attano abhimukhaṃ kaḍḍheyya.
Sanskrit ākarṣati
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)

seyyathā'pi nāma balavā puriso dīghalomikaṃ eḷakaṃ lomesu gahetvā ākaḍḍheyya parikaḍḍheyya samparikaḍḍheyya, evam'ev'āhaṃ samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ vādena vādaṃ ākaḍḍhissāmi parikaḍḍhissāmi samparikaḍḍhissāmi.

MN 35 cūḷasaccakasuttaṃ
ākaḍḍhana

nt. pulling out, dragging [ā + √kaḍḍh] ✗
ākaḍḍhanta

prp. (+acc) dragging; pulling [ā + √kaḍḍh + a + nta] ~

Grammar prp of ākaḍḍhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning dragging; pulling
Root Family ā √kaḍḍh
Root √kaḍḍh･1 a (drag, plough)
Base √kaḍḍh + a > kaḍḍha
Construction ā + kaḍḍha + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Sanskrit ākarṣat
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)
ākaḍḍhitvā 1

abs. (+acc) having dragged (to); having pulled (to); having escorted (to) [ā + √kaḍḍh + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of ākaḍḍhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning having dragged (to); having pulled (to); having escorted (to)
Root Family ā √kaḍḍh
Root √kaḍḍh･1 a (drag, plough)
Construction ā + √kaḍḍh + itvā
Sanskrit ākṛṣṭvā
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)

so bhikkhu saṅghamajjham'pi ākaḍḍhitvā vattabbo, m'āyasmā evaṃ avaca, mā bhagavantaṃ abbhācikkhi, na hi sādhu bhagavato abbhakkhānaṃ, na hi bhagavā evaṃ vadeyya

VIN 2.5.7.8 ariṭṭhasikkhāpadaṃ
ākaḍḍhitvā 2

abs. (+acc) (of a sword) having drawn; having pulled out [ā + √kaḍḍh + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of ākaḍḍhati, trans (+acc)
Meaning (of a sword) having drawn; having pulled out
Root Family ā √kaḍḍh
Root √kaḍḍh･1 a (drag, plough)
Construction ā + √kaḍḍh + itvā
Sanskrit ākṛṣṭvā
Sanskrit Root √kṛṣ 1, 6 (drag, plough)

brāhmaṇassa asiṃ ākaḍḍhitvā upasiṅghantassa maricacuṇṇāni nāsaṃ pavisitvā khipitu'kāmataṃ uppādesuṃ. tassa khipantassa nāsikā asidhārāya paṭihatā dvidhā chijji.

JAa 126 asilakkhaṇa jātakavaṇṇanā
ākaḍḍhīyamāna

ākaḍḍheti

pr. (+acc) slurps, lit. causes to drag [ā + √kaḍḍh] ✗
ākappa

masc. deportment; conduct; behaviour [ā + √kapp + a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning deportment; conduct; behaviour
Root Family ā √kapp
Root √kapp･1 a (be fit, be suitable)
Construction ā + √kapp + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit ākalpa
Sanskrit Root √kḷp 1 (be adapted)

añño me ākappo karaṇīyo'ti pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ

AN 10.48 dasadhammasuttaṃ
ākappasampadā

fem. good manners; good deportment; lit. accomplishment in behaviour [ākappa + sampadā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning good manners; good deportment; lit. accomplishment in behaviour
Construction ākappa + sampadā
Commentary (ANa) ākappasampadā'ti cīvaraggahaṇ'ādino ākappassa sampatti.
ākappasampanna

adj. who carries oneself properly; with good deportment; with suitable behaviour; (comm) with monk-like behaviour [ākappa + sampanna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who carries oneself properly; with good deportment; with suitable behaviour; (comm) with monk-like behaviour
Construction ākappa + sampanna
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (ākappena + sampanna)
Commentary (ANa) ākappasampanno'ti samaṇ'ākappena sampanno.
Sanskrit ākalpa + sampanna

dullabho, bhikkhave, vuḍḍhapabbajito nipuṇo, dullabho ākappasampanno, dullabho bahussuto, dullabho dhammakathiko, dullabho vinayadharo.

AN 5.59 paṭhamavuḍḍhapabbajitasuttaṃ
ākara 1

masc. mine, place of production ✗
ākara 2

masc. store ✗
ākāra 1

masc. way; manner; method; lit. way of making [ā + √kar + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ākaroti
Meaning way; manner; method; lit. way of making
Root Family ā √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction ā + √kar > kār + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym upāya
Commentary (VINa) ucc'āvacehi ākārehī'ti mahant'āmahantehi upāyehi.
Sanskrit ākāra
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

tesaṃ no, bhante, āyasmatā mahākaccānena imehi ākārehi imehi padehi imehi byañjanehi attho vibhatto'ti

MN 18 madhupiṇḍikasuttaṃ

imehi kho, bhikkhave, dasahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu samantapāsādiko ca hoti sabb'ākāraparipūro cā'ti.

AN 10.8 jhānasuttaṃ
ākāra 2

masc. aspect; facet; detail; property; quality; attribute [ā + √kar + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ākaroti
Meaning aspect; facet; detail; property; quality; attribute
Root Family ā √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction ā + √kar > kār + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit ākāra
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

yehi, ānanda, ākārehi yehi liṅgehi yehi nimittehi yehi uddesehi nāmakāyassa paññatti hoti, tesu ākāresu tesu liṅgesu tesu nimittesu tesu uddesesu asati api nu kho rūpakāye adhivacanasamphasso paññāyethā'ti? no h'etaṃ, bhante.

DN 15.1 mahānidānasuttaṃ, paṭiccasamuppādo

soḷas'ākārasampannā,
aṭṭh'aṅgasusamāgatā,
t'ādisī sīlavatī upāsikā,
upapajjati devalokaṃ manāpan'ti.

ākāra 4

masc. reason; evidence; clue [ā + √kar + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ākaroti
Meaning reason; evidence; clue
Root Family ā √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction ā + √kar > kār + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Commentary (MNa) ākārā'ti kāraṇāni.
Sanskrit ākāra
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

tañ'ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhuṃ pare evaṃ puccheyyuṃ, ke pan'āyasmato ākārā, ke anvayā, yen'āyasmā evaṃ vadesi, abhay'ūparato ayam'āyasmā, n'āyam'āyasmā bhay'ūparato, vītarāgattā kāme na sevati khayā rāgassā'ti.

MN 47 vīmaṃsakasuttaṃ
ākāra 5

masc. form, mode, condition, state, appearance [ā + √kar] ✗
ākāra 7

masc. (gram) the prefix ā- ✗
ākāra 8

masc. (gram) derivative verbal noun ending in -ana ✗
ākāraparivitakka

masc. method of thinking; mode of reasoning; way of examination [ākāra + parivitakka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning method of thinking; mode of reasoning; way of examination
Construction ākāra + parivitakka
Compound kammadhāraya (ākāra + parivitakka)
Commentary (ANa) mā ākāraparivitakkenā'ti sundaram'idaṃ kāraṇan'ti evaṃ kāraṇaparivitakkena'pi mā gaṇhittha.
Sanskrit ākāra + parivitarka

etha tumhe, kālāmā, mā anussavena, mā paramparāya, mā itikirāya, mā piṭakasampadānena, mā takkahetu, mā nayahetu, mā ākāraparivitakkena, mā diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā, mā bhabbarūpatāya, mā samaṇo no garū'ti.

AN 3.66 kesamuttisuttaṃ
ākārava

adj. having a form; having a cause; grounded ✗
ākāravant 1

adj. having good reasons; supported by evidence; grounded [ā + √kar + *a + vant] ✓

Grammar adj, from ākāra
Meaning having good reasons; supported by evidence; grounded
Root Family ā √kar
Root √kar･7 o (do, make)
Construction ā + √kar > kār + *a + vant
ākāra + vant
Derivative taddhita (vant)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Commentary (MNa) ākāravatī'ti kāraṇaṃ pariyesitvā gahitattā sakāraṇā (MNa) ākāravatī'ti kāraṇavatī sahetukā.
Sanskrit ākāravat
Sanskrit Root √kṛ 1, 2, 5, 8 (make)

yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, imehi ākārehi imehi padehi imehi byañjanehi tathāgate saddhā niviṭṭhā hoti mūlajātā patiṭṭhitā, ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, ākāravatī saddhā dassanamūlikā

MN 47 vīmaṃsakasuttaṃ

n'atthi kho no, bhante, koci manāpo satthā yasmiṃ no ākāravatī saddhā paṭiladdhā'ti. manāpaṃ vo, gahapatayo, satthāraṃ alabhantehi ayaṃ apaṇṇako dhammo samādāya vattitabbo.

MN 60 apaṇṇakasuttaṃ
ākāravant 2

adj. having a form; having a cause [ā + √kar] ✗
ākāsa 1

masc. open space; vacuity [ā + √kās + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ākāsati
Meaning open space; vacuity
Root Family ā √kās
Root √kās･1 a (shine, be visible)
Construction ā + √kās + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit ākāśa
Sanskrit Root √kāś 1 (appear, make a show)

seyyathā'pi, āvuso, kaṭṭhañ'ca paṭicca valliñ'ca paṭicca tiṇañ'ca paṭicca mattikañ'ca paṭicca ākāso parivārito agāraṃ tv'eva saṅkhaṃ gacchati, evam'eva kho, āvuso, aṭṭhiñ'ca paṭicca nhāruñ'ca paṭicca maṃsañ'ca paṭicca cammañ'ca paṭicca ākāso parivārito rūpaṃ tv'eva saṅkhaṃ gacchati.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ

yaṃ ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ ākāsaṃ ākāsagataṃ upādinnaṃ, seyyath'idaṃ, kaṇṇacchiddaṃ nāsacchiddaṃ mukhadvāraṃ, yena ca asitapītakhāyitasāyitaṃ ajjhoharati … ayaṃ vuccati, rāhula, ajjhattikā ākāsadhātu.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ
ākāsa 2

Sanskrit ākāśa
Sanskrit Root √kāś 1 (appear, make a show)

ahi āviñcheyya, vammikaṃ pavekkhāmī'ti, susumāro āviñcheyya, udakaṃ pavekkhāmī'ti, pakkhī āviñcheyya, ākāsaṃ ḍessāmī'ti

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ

sā pattaṃ gahetvā ākāse khipi. patto ākāse aṭṭhāsi

DNa 16.4 mahāparinibbāna suttavaṇṇanā

Root √kās･1 a (shine, be visible)

Sanskrit ākāśa
Sanskrit Root √kāś 1 (appear, make a show)

ākāsaṃ ce nissāya tiṭṭheyya, ye ākāsanissitā pāṇā te naṃ khādeyyuṃ

SN 12.63 puttamaṃsūpamasuttaṃ
ākāsa 4

masc. space [ā + √kās + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ākāsati
Meaning space
Root Family ā √kās
Root √kās･1 a (shine, be visible)
Construction ā + √kās + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit ākāśa
Sanskrit Root √kāś 1 (appear, make a show)

idha mayaṃ, bhante, yāva'd'eva ākaṅkhāma sabbaso rūpasaññānaṃ samatikkamā paṭighasaññānaṃ atthaṅ'gamā nānattasaññānaṃ amanasikārā, ananto ākāso'ti ākās'ānañc'āyatanaṃ upasampajja viharāma

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ

anusāsa brahme karuṇāyamāno,
vivekadhammaṃ yam'ahaṃ vijaññaṃ,
yath'āhaṃ ākāso'va abyāpajjamāno,
idh'eva santo asito careyyaṃ.

SNP 60 dhotaka māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 5
ākāsa 5

masc. environment; atmosphere; (comm) craving [ā + √kās + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ākāsati
Meaning environment; atmosphere; (comm) craving
Root Family ā √kās
Root √kās･1 a (shine, be visible)
Construction ā + √kās + a
Derivative kita (a)
Commentary (SNPa) ākāsaṃ na sito siyā'ti taṇhānissito na bhaveyya. taṇhā hi rūp'ādīnaṃ ākāsanato, ākāso'ti vuccati.
Notes see sk ākarṣana
Sanskrit ākāśa
Sanskrit Root √kāś 1 (appear, make a show)

purāṇaṃ n'ābhinandeyya,
nave khantiṃ na kubbaye,
hiyyamāne na soceyya,
ākāsaṃ na sito siyā.

SNP 53 attadaṇḍasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 15
ākāsakasiṇa

nt. space kasina; total space [ākāsa + kasiṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning space kasina; total space
Construction ākāsa + kasiṇa
Compound kammadhāraya (ākāsa + kasiṇa)
Sanskrit ākāśa + kṛtsna

odātakasiṇam'eko sañjānāti uddhaṃ adho tiriyaṃ advayaṃ appamāṇaṃ. ākāsakasiṇam'eko sañjānāti uddhaṃ adho tiriyaṃ advayaṃ appamāṇaṃ.

AN 10.29 paṭhamakosalasuttaṃ
ākāsakasiṇasamāpattiparama

adj. regarding the attainment of space kasina as the ultimate [ākāsakasiṇa + samāpatti + parama] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning regarding the attainment of space kasina as the ultimate
Construction ākāsakasiṇa + samāpatti + parama
Compound kammadhāraya (ākāsakasiṇasamāpatti + parama)
Sanskrit ākāśa + kṛtsna + samāpatti + parama

ākāsakasiṇasamāpattiparamā kho, bhagini… viññāṇakasiṇasamāpattiparamā kho, bhagini, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā attho'ti abhinibbattesuṃ. yāvatā kho, bhagini, viññāṇakasiṇasamāpattiparamatā, tadabhiññāsi bhagavā.

AN 10.26 kāḷīsuttaṃ
ākāsagata 1

adj. empty; hollow; vacuous; spacious; lit. space state [ākāsa + gata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning empty; hollow; vacuous; spacious; lit. space state
Construction ākāsa + gata
Compound kammadhāraya (ākāsa + gata)
Commentary (MNa) ākāsagatan'ti ākāsabhāvaṃ gataṃ.
Sanskrit ākāśa + gata

yaṃ vā pan'aññam'pi kiñci ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ ākāsaṃ ākāsagataṃ, aghaṃ aghagataṃ, vivaraṃ vivaragataṃ, asamphuṭṭhaṃ maṃsalohitehi upādinnaṃ, ayaṃ vuccati, rāhula, ajjhattikā ākāsadhātu.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ
ākāsagata 2

adj. atmospheric; relating to sky [ākāsa + gata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning atmospheric; relating to sky
Construction ākāsa + gata
Compound sattamī tappurisa (ākāse + gata)
Sanskrit ākāśagati

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, saradasamaye viddhe vigatavalāhake deve ādicco nabhaṃ abbhussakkamāno sabbaṃ ākāsagataṃ tamagataṃ abhivihacca bhāsate ca tapate ca virocati ca

AN 10.15 appamādasuttaṃ
ākāsagata 3

adj. travelling by air [ākāsa + gata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning travelling by air
Construction ākāsa + gata
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (ākāsena + gata)
Synonym vihaga
Sanskrit ākāśagati

yassa yassa hi raññā saddhiṃ gantu'kāmatācittaṃ uppajjati, so so ākāsagato'va hoti

DNa 2.4.2 mahāsudassanasutta vaṇṇanā

adj. resting on space; lit. standing in space [ākāsa + ṭha] ~

Meaning resting on space; lit. standing in space
Construction ākāsa + ṭha
Compound sattamī tappurisa (ākāse + ṭha)
Sanskrit ākāśastha
ākāsaṭṭha 2

adj. in the air; lit. standing in space [ākāsa + ṭha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning in the air; lit. standing in space
Construction ākāsa + ṭha
Compound sattamī tappurisa (ākāse + ṭha)
Sanskrit ākāśastha

ākāsaṭṭhaṃ nāma bhaṇḍaṃ ākāsagataṃ hoti. moro vā kapiñjaro vā tittiro vā vaṭṭako vā, sāṭakaṃ vā veṭhanaṃ vā hiraññaṃ vā suvaṇṇaṃ vā chijjamānaṃ patati.

VIN 1.1.2 dutiyapārājikaṃ
ākāsati

pr. shines; is visible [ā + √kās] ✗
ākāsadhātu

fem. space; space element; lit. space state [ākāsa + dhātu] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning space; space element; lit. space state
Construction ākāsa + dhātu
Compound kammadhāraya (ākāsa + dhātu)
Commentary (DNa) ākāsadhātū'ti asamphuṭṭhadhātu.
Sanskrit ākāśa + dhātu

cha'y'imā, āvuso, dhātuyo tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena samma'd'akkhātā. katamā cha? pathavīdhātu, āpodhātu, tejodhātu, vāyodhātu, ākāsadhātu, viññāṇadhātu

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ

yaṃ ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ ākāsaṃ ākāsagataṃ upādinnaṃ, seyyath'idaṃ … yena ca asitapītakhāyitasāyitaṃ adhobhāgaṃ nikkhamati … ayaṃ vuccati, rāhula, ajjhattikā ākāsadhātu.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ

Meaning living in the air; lit. dependent on the space
Construction ākāsa + nissita
Commentary (SNa) ākāsanissitā'ti ḍaṃsa-makasa-kāka-kulal'ādayo. (SNt) ākāsanissitā'ti ākāsacārino.
ākāsasama

adj. like open space; like empty space [ākāsa + sama] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like open space; like empty space
Construction ākāsa + sama
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (ākāsena + sama)
Sanskrit ākāśa + sama

ākāsasamaṃ, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvehi. ākāsasamañ'hi te, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvayato uppannā manāp'āmanāpā phassā cittaṃ na pariyādāya ṭhassanti.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ
ākāsasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 45.155 (SN45.155) ✗
ākāsānañcāyatana

nt. dimension of infinite space; base of infinity of space [ākāsa + na + anta + āyatana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning dimension of infinite space; base of infinity of space
Construction ākāsa + na + anta + āyatana
Compound kammadhāraya (ākāsānañca + āyatana)
Sanskrit ākāśānantyāyatana

nissaṭṭhena āvuso, pañcahi indriyehi parisuddhena manoviññāṇena ananto ākāso'ti ākās'ānañc'āyatanaṃ neyyaṃ, anantaṃ viññāṇan'ti viññāṇ'añc'āyatanaṃ neyyaṃ, n'atthi kiñcī'ti ākiñcaññ'āyatanaṃ neyyan'ti.

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ

idha mayaṃ, bhante, yāva'd'eva ākaṅkhāma sabbaso rūpasaññānaṃ samatikkamā paṭighasaññānaṃ atthaṅ'gamā nānattasaññānaṃ amanasikārā, ananto ākāso'ti ākās'ānañc'āyatanaṃ upasampajja viharāma

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ
ākāsānañcāyatanadhātu

fem. state of the dimension of infinite space; element of the base of infinity of space [ākāsānañcāyatana + dhātu] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning state of the dimension of infinite space; element of the base of infinity of space
Construction ākāsānañcāyatana + dhātu
Commentary (SNa) ākās'ānañc'āyatanam'eva ākāsānañcāyatanadhātu.
ākāsānañcāyatananissita

adj. dependent on to the dimension of infinite space; based on the dimension of infinite space [ākāsānañcāyatana + nissita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning dependent on to the dimension of infinite space; based on the dimension of infinite space
Construction ākāsānañcāyatana + nissita
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (ākāsānañcāyatanaṃ + nissita)
Sanskrit ākāśānantyāyatana + niśrita

atthi, bhikkhave, upekkhā ākāsānañc'āyatananissitā, atthi viññāṇañc'āyatananissitā, atthi ākiñcaññ'āyatananissitā, atthi n'evasaññān'āsaññ'āyatananissitā, ayaṃ, bhikkhave, upekkhā ekattā ekattasitā.

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
ākāsānañcāyatanapañhāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 40.5 (SN40.5) ✗
ākāsānañcāyatanaparama

adj. having the dimension of infinite space as peak; with the base of infinity of space as apex [ākāsānañcāyatana + parama] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having the dimension of infinite space as peak; with the base of infinity of space as apex
Construction ākāsānañcāyatana + parama
Commentary (SNa) karuṇāvihārissa uṇhābhighātādirūpanimittaṃ sattadukkhaṃ samanupassantassa karuṇāya pavattisambhavato rūpe ādīnavo parividito hoti, ath'assa parividitarūp'ādīnavattā pathavīkasiṇ'ādīsu aññataraṃ ugghāṭetvā rūpanissaraṇe ākāse cittaṃ upasaṃharato appakasiren'eva tattha cittaṃ pakkhandati. iti karuṇā ākās'ānañc'āyatanassa upanissayo hoti, na tato paraṃ, tasmā ākās'ānañc'āyatanaparamā'ti vuttā.
ākāsānañcāyatanasaññā

fem. (+loc) recognition of dimension of infinite space (in); perception of dimension of infinite space (in) [ākāsānañcāyatana + saññā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp (+loc)
Meaning recognition of dimension of infinite space (in); perception of dimension of infinite space (in)
Construction ākāsānañcāyatana + saññā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ākāsānañcāyatanassa + saññā)
Sanskrit ākāśānantyāyatana + saṃjñā

idha, sandha, bhadrassa puris'ājānīyassa ... ākāsānañc'āyatane ākāsānañc'āyatanasaññā vibhūtā hoti, viññāṇañc'āyatane viññāṇañc'āyatanasaññā vibhūtā hoti

AN 11.9 saddhasuttaṃ
ākāsānañcāyatanasaññī

adj. (+loc) aware of dimension of infinite space (in); percipient of dimension of infinite space (in) [ākāsānañcāyatana + saññī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning aware of dimension of infinite space (in); percipient of dimension of infinite space (in)
Construction ākāsānañcāyatana + saññī
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ākāsānañcāyatanassa + saññī)
Sanskrit ākāśānantyāyatana + saṃjñin

siyā nu kho, bhante, bhikkhuno tathārūpo samādhipaṭilābho yathā ... na ākāsānañc'āyatane ākāsānañc'āyatanasaññī assa, na viññāṇañc'āyatane viññāṇañc'āyatanasaññī assa

AN 10.6 samādhisuttaṃ
ākāsānañcāyatanasamāpatti

fem. attainment of the dimension of infinite space [ākāsānañcāyatana + samāpatti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning attainment of the dimension of infinite space
Construction ākāsānañcāyatana + samāpatti
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ākāsānañcāyatanassa + samāpatti)
Sanskrit ākāśānantyāyatana + samāpatti

so iti paṭisañcikkhati, ahaṃ kho'mhi ākāsānañc'āyatanasamāpattiyā lābhī, ime pan'aññe bhikkhū ākāsānañc'āyatanasamāpattiyā na lābhino'ti. so tāya ākāsānañc'āyatanasamāpattiyā attān'ukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti.

MN 113 sappurisasuttaṃ

so iti paṭisañcikkhati, ayam'pi kho ākāsānañc'āyatanasamāpatti abhisaṅkhatā abhisañcetayitā. yaṃ kho pana kiñci abhisaṅkhataṃ abhisañcetayitaṃ tadaniccaṃ nirodhadhamman'ti pajānāti.

MN 52 aṭṭhakanāgarasuttaṃ
ākāsānañcāyatanasahagata

Construction ākāsānañcāyatana + sahagata

ākāsānañcāyatanasukhumasaccasaññā

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning refined and true perception of the dimension of infinite space
Construction ākāsānañcāyatana + sukhuma + sacca + saññā
ākāsānañcāyatanasukhumasaccasaññī

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with a refined and true perception of the dimension of infinite space
Construction ākāsānañcāyatana + sukhuma + sacca + saññī
ākāsānañcāyatanasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 28.5 (SN28.5) ✗
ākāsānañcāyatanūpaga

adj. gone to the dimension of infinite space; epithet of a class of devas [ākāsānañcāyatana + upaga] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning gone to the dimension of infinite space; epithet of a class of devas
Construction ākāsānañcāyatana + upaga
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (ākāsānañcāyatanaṃ + upaga)
Commentary (DNa) ākāsānañcāyatan'ūpago'tiādīsu pana ākāsānañcāyatanabhavaṃ upagato'ti, evam'attho veditabbo.
Sanskrit ākāśānantyāyatana + upaga

ākaṅkheyya ce, gahapatayo, dhammacārī samacārī, aho vat'āhaṃ kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā ākāsānañcāyatan'ūpagānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjeyyan'ti, ṭhānaṃ kho pan'etaṃ vijjati, yaṃ so kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā ākāsānañcāyatan'ūpagānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjeyya.

MN 41 sāleyyakasuttaṃ
ākiñca

nt. nothingness; emptiness [na + kiñci + *ya] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, from na kiñci, neg
Meaning nothingness; emptiness
Construction na > a > ā + kiñci + *ya
akiñci + *ya
Derivative taddhita (*ya)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym ākiñcañña
Sanskrit akiñcana +
ākiñcañña 1

adj. with nothingness; empty; void [na + kiñci + ana + *ya] ✓

Grammar adj, from na kiñcana, neg
Meaning with nothingness; empty; void
Construction na > a > ā + kiñci + ana + *ya
akiñcana + *ya
Derivative taddhita (*ya)
Phonetic Change ny > ññ
a > ā
Commentary (MNa) ākiñcaññā'ti ārammaṇ'akiñcanassa abhāvato ākiñcaññā.
Sanskrit akiñcana +

yā c'āyaṃ, āvuso, appamāṇā cetovimutti, yā ca ākiñcaññā cetovimutti, yā ca suññatā cetovimutti, yā ca animittā cetovimutti, ime dhammā nān'ātthā c'eva nānābyañjanā ca udāhu ek'atthā byañjanam'eva nānan'ti?

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ

katamā c'āvuso, ākiñcaññā cetovimutti? idh'āvuso, bhikkhu sabbaso viññāṇ'añc'āyatanaṃ samatikkamma n'atthi kiñcī'ti ākiñcaññ'āyatanaṃ upasampajja viharati. ayaṃ vuccat'āvuso, ākiñcaññā cetovimutti.

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ
ākiñcañña 2

nt. nothingness; emptiness [na + kiñci + ana + *ya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from na kiñcana, neg
Meaning nothingness; emptiness
Construction na > a > ā + kiñci + ana + *ya
akiñcana + *ya
Derivative taddhita (*ya)
Phonetic Change ny > ññ
a > ā
Synonym ākiñca
Sanskrit akiñcana +

idha mayaṃ, bhante, yāva'd'eva ākaṅkhāma sabbaso viññāṇ'añc'āyatanaṃ samatikkamma, n'atthi kiñcī'ti ākiñcañña-āyatanaṃ upasampajja viharāma

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ

ākiñcaññaṃ pekkhamāno satimā,
n'atthī'ti nissāya tarassu oghaṃ,
kāme pahāya virato kathāhi,
taṇhakkhayaṃ nattam'ah'ābhipassa.

SNP 61 upasīva māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 6
ākiñcaññābhinivesa

adj. insisting on emptiness; adhering to nothingness [ākiñcañña + abhinivesa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning insisting on emptiness; adhering to nothingness
Construction ākiñcañña + abhinivesa
Variant akiñcanābhinivesa
Commentary (ANa) akiñcanabhāve niggahaṇabhāve cittaṃ etesaṃ abhinivisatī'ti ākiñcaññ'ābhinivesā.
ākiñcaññāyatana

nt. dimension of nothingness; sphere of emptiness; base of nothingness [ākiñcañña + āyatana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning dimension of nothingness; sphere of emptiness; base of nothingness
Construction ākiñcañña + āyatana
Compound kammadhāraya (ākiñcañña + āyatana)
Sanskrit ākiṃcanyāyatana

idha mayaṃ, bhante, yāva'd'eva ākaṅkhāma sabbaso viññāṇ'añc'āyatanaṃ samatikkamma, n'atthi kiñcī'ti ākiñcaññ'āyatanaṃ upasampajja viharāma

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ

ṭhānaṃ kho pan'etaṃ, sunakkhatta, vijjati yaṃ idh'ekacco purisapuggalo ākiñcaññ'āyatana-adhimutto assa.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
ākiñcaññāyatanadhātu

fem. state of the dimension of nothingness; element of the sphere of emptiness [ākiñcaññāyatana + dhātu] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning state of the dimension of nothingness; element of the sphere of emptiness
Construction ākiñcaññāyatana + dhātu
ākiñcaññāyatananissita

adj. dependent on the dimension of nothingness; based on the sphere of emptiness [ākiñcaññāyatana + nissita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning dependent on the dimension of nothingness; based on the sphere of emptiness
Construction ākiñcaññāyatana + nissita
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (ākiñcaññāyatanaṃ + nissita)
Sanskrit ākiṃcanyāyatana + niśrita

atthi, bhikkhave, upekkhā ākāsānañc'āyatananissitā, atthi viññāṇañc'āyatananissitā, atthi ākiñcaññ'āyatananissitā, atthi n'evasaññān'āsaññ'āyatananissitā, ayaṃ, bhikkhave, upekkhā ekattā ekattasitā.

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
ākiñcaññāyatanapañhāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 40.7 (SN40.7) ✗
ākiñcaññāyatanapaṭisaṃyutta

adj. connected with the dimension of nothingness; concerned with the base of nothingness [ākiñcaññāyatana + paṭisaṃyutta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning connected with the dimension of nothingness; concerned with the base of nothingness
Construction ākiñcaññāyatana + paṭisaṃyutta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (ākiñcaññāyatanena + paṭisaṃyutta)
ākiñcaññāyatanaparama

adj. having the dimension of nothingness as peak; with the sphere of emptiness as apex [ākiñcaññāyatana + parama] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having the dimension of nothingness as peak; with the sphere of emptiness as apex
Construction ākiñcaññāyatana + parama
Commentary (VISM) upekkhāvihārissa pana, sattā sukhitā vā hontu dukkhato vā vimuccantu, sampattasukhato vā mā vimuccantū'ti ābhogābhāvato sukhadukkh'ādiparamatthagāhavimukhabhāvato avijjamānaggahaṇadukkhaṃ cittaṃ hoti. ath'assa paramatthagāhato vimukhabhāvaparicitacittassa paramatthato avijjamānaggahaṇadukkhacittassa ca anukkamādhigataṃ viññāṇ'añc'āyatanaṃ samatikkamma sabhāvato avijjamāne paramatthabhūtassa viññāṇassa abhāve cittaṃ upasaṃharato appakasiren'eva tattha cittaṃ pakkhandati. iti upekkhā ākiñcaññ'āyatanassa upanissayo hoti, na tato paraṃ, tasmā ākiñcaññāyatanaparamā'ti vuttāti.
ākiñcaññāyatanasaññā

fem. (+loc) recognition of dimension of nothingness (in); perception of dimension of nothingness (in) [ākiñcaññāyatana + saññā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp (+loc)
Meaning recognition of dimension of nothingness (in); perception of dimension of nothingness (in)
Construction ākiñcaññāyatana + saññā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ākiñcaññāyatanassa + saññā)
Sanskrit ākiṃcanyāyatana + saṃjñā

idha, sandha, bhadrassa puris'ājānīyassa ... ākiñcaññ'āyatane ākiñcaññ'āyatanasaññā vibhūtā hoti, n'evasaññān'āsaññ'āyatane n'evasaññān'āsaññ'āyatanasaññā vibhūtā hoti

AN 11.9 saddhasuttaṃ
ākiñcaññāyatanasaññī

adj. (+loc) aware of dimension of nothingness (in); percipient of dimension of nothingness (in) [ākiñcaññāyatana + saññī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning aware of dimension of nothingness (in); percipient of dimension of nothingness (in)
Construction ākiñcaññāyatana + saññī
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ākiñcaññāyatanassa + saññī)
Sanskrit ākiṃcanyāyatana + saṃjñin

siyā nu kho, bhante, bhikkhuno tathārūpo samādhipaṭilābho yathā ... na ākiñcaññ'āyatane ākiñcaññ'āyatanasaññī assa, na n'evasaññān'āsaññ'āyatane n'evasaññān'āsaññ'āyatanasaññī assa

AN 10.6 samādhisuttaṃ
ākiñcaññāyatanasappāya

adj. beneficial for the dimension of nothingness; supportive for the base of nothingness [ākiñcaññāyatana + sappāya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning beneficial for the dimension of nothingness; supportive for the base of nothingness
Construction ākiñcaññāyatana + sappāya
ākiñcaññāyatanasamāpatti

fem. attainment of the dimension of nothingness; attainment of the sphere of emptiness [ākiñcaññāyatana + samāpatti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning attainment of the dimension of nothingness; attainment of the sphere of emptiness
Construction ākiñcaññāyatana + samāpatti
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ākiñcaññāyatanassa + samāpatti)
Sanskrit ākiṃcanyāyatana + samāpatti

so iti paṭisañcikkhati, ahaṃ kho'mhi ākiñcaññ'āyatanasamāpattiyā lābhī, ime pan'aññe bhikkhū ākiñcaññ'āyatanasamāpattiyā na lābhino'ti. so tāya ākiñcaññ'āyatanasamāpattiyā attān'ukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti.

MN 113 sappurisasuttaṃ

so iti paṭisañcikkhati, ayam'pi kho ākiñcaññ'āyatanasamāpatti abhisaṅkhatā abhisañcetayitā. yaṃ kho pana kiñci abhisaṅkhataṃ abhisañcetayitaṃ tadaniccaṃ nirodhadhamman'ti pajānāti.

MN 52 aṭṭhakanāgarasuttaṃ

ākiñcaññāyatanasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 28.7 (SN28.7) ✗

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning gone to the dimension of nothingness; epithet of a class of devas
Construction ākiñcaññāyatana + upaga
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (ākiñcaññāyatanaṃ + upaga)
Sanskrit ākiṃcanyāyatana + upaga

ākaṅkheyya ce, gahapatayo, dhammacārī samacārī, aho vat'āhaṃ kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā ākiñcaññāyatan'ūpagānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjeyyan'ti, ṭhānaṃ kho pan'etaṃ vijjati, yaṃ so kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā ākiñcaññāyatan'ūpagānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjeyya.

MN 41 sāleyyakasuttaṃ
ākiñcaññāyatanūpapatti

fem. rebirth into dimension of nothingness; reappearance in the sphere of emptiness [ākiñcaññāyatana + upapatti] ✓

Meaning rebirth into dimension of nothingness; reappearance in the sphere of emptiness
Construction ākiñcaññāyatana + upapatti
Compound sattamī tappurisa (ākiñcaññāyatane + upapatti)
Commentary (MNa) yāva'd'eva ākiñcaññ'āyatan'ūpapattiyā'ti yāva saṭṭhikappasahass'āyuparimāṇe ākiñcaññ'āyatanabhave upapatti, tāva'd'eva saṃvattati, na tato uddhaṃ.
Sanskrit ākiṃcanyāyatana + upapatti

tassa mayhaṃ, aggivessana, etadahosi, n'āyaṃ dhammo nibbidāya na virāgāya na nirodhāya na upasamāya na abhiññāya na sambodhāya na nibbānāya saṃvattati, yāvadeva ākiñcaññ'āyatan'ūpapattiyā'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
ākiṇṇa

pp. (+instr) crowded (with); hemmed in (with); surrounded (by); lit. strewn [ā + √kir + na] ✓

Root Family ā √kir
Root √kir･1 a (scatter, sprinkle)
Construction ā + √kir + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change rn > ṇṇ
Sanskrit ākīrṇa
Sanskrit Root √kṝ √kṛ 6 (scatter)

yaṃnūna mayaṃ yena gosiṅgasālavanadāyo ten'upasaṅkameyyāma. tattha mayaṃ appasaddā app'ākiṇṇā phāsuṃ vihareyyāmā'ti.

AN 10.72 kaṇṭakasuttaṃ
ākiṇṇakammanta

adj. rough in action; acting impurely ✗

Sanskrit ākīrṇa + manuṣya

ekam'antaṃ nisinno kho mahānāmo sakko bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, idaṃ, bhante, kapilavatthu iddhañ'c'eva phītañ'ca bāhujaññaṃ ākiṇṇamanussaṃ sambādhabyūhaṃ.

SN 55.21 paṭhamamahānāmasuttaṃ

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gahapati, ayaṃ nāḷandā iddhā c'eva phītā ca bahujanā ākiṇṇamanussā'ti? evaṃ, bhante, ayaṃ nāḷandā iddhā c'eva phītā ca bahujanā ākiṇṇamanussā'ti.

atha kho sambahulā nānātitthiyasāvakā devaputtā asamo ca sahali ca nīko ca ākoṭako ca vegabbhari ca māṇavagāmiyo ca abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ veḷuvanaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu

SN 2.30 nānātitthiyasāvakasuttaṃ

atha kho ākoṭako devaputto nānātitthiye ārabbha bhagavato santike imaṃ gāthaṃ abhāsi

SN 2.30 nānātitthiyasāvakasuttaṃ

evaṃ vutte, bhante, rattapāṇi rajakaputto taṃ brāhmaṇaṃ etadavoca, ayaṃ kho te, makkaṭacchāpako raṅgakkhamo hi kho, no ākoṭanakkhamo, no vimajjanakkhamo'ti.

evaṃ vutte, bhante, rattapāṇi rajakaputto taṃ brāhmaṇaṃ etadavoca, ayaṃ kho te, makkaṭacchāpako raṅgakkhamo hi kho, no ākoṭanakkhamo, no vimajjanakkhamo'ti.

sappaṭibhayaṃ nāma ārāme ārām'ūpacāre corehi manussā hatā dissanti, viluttā dissanti, ākoṭitā dissanti.

upasaṅkamitvā rattapāṇiṃ rajakaputtaṃ evaṃ vadehi, icchām'ahaṃ, samma rattapāṇi, imaṃ makkaṭacchāpakaṃ pīt'āvalepanaṃ nāma raṅgajātaṃ rajitaṃ ākoṭitapaccākoṭitaṃ ubhatobhāgavimaṭṭhan'ti.

DN 3.3 ambaṭṭhasuttaṃ

atha kho bhagavā kathāpariyosānaṃ viditvā ukkāsitvā aggaḷaṃ ākoṭesi.

ākhu

SN 12.63 puttamaṃsūpamasuttaṃ

sā ce tato cutā itthattaṃ āgacchati, sā yattha yattha paccājāyati dubbaṇṇā ca hoti durūpā supāpikā dassanāya, daliddā ca hoti appassakā appabhogā appesakkhā ca.

Sanskrit āgacchati
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, same bhūmibhāge pokkharaṇī caturaṃsā ālibaddhā pūrā udakassa samatittikā kākapeyyā. tam'enaṃ balavā puriso yato yato āliṃ muñceyya, āgaccheyya udakan'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

AN 5.28 paṭhamadhammavihārīsuttaṃ
āgacchati 5

pr. (+acc) happens (to); befalls; occurs (to); lit. arrives [ā + √gam + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning happens (to); befalls; occurs (to); lit. arrives
Root Family ā √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Base √gam + a > gama > gaccha (irreg)
Construction ā + gaccha + ti
Sanskrit āgacchati
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

satt'ime, bhikkhave, dhammā sapattakantā sapattakaraṇā kodhanaṃ āgacchanti itthiṃ vā purisaṃ vā. katame satta?

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ

kathaṃ byākaramānā ... dhammassa c'ānudhammaṃ byākareyyāma, na ca koci sahadhammiko vād'ānupāto gārayhaṃ ṭhānaṃ āgaccheyyā'ti?

SN 12.25 bhūmijasuttaṃ
āgacchanta

prp. (+acc) coming; approaching; arriving [ā + √gam + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of āgacchati, trans (+acc)
Meaning coming; approaching; arriving
Root Family ā √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Base √gam + a > gama > gaccha (irreg)
Construction ā + gaccha + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Antonym gacchanta
Sanskrit āgacchat
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

addasā kho aggikabhāradvājo brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṃ dūrato'va āgacchantaṃ.

SNP 7 vasalasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 7

so araññato āgacchante mālākāre disvā thokaṃ thokaṃ phāṇitakhaṇḍaṃ datvā uḷuṅkena pānīyaṃ adāsi, te c'assa ek'ekaṃ pupphamuṭṭhiṃ adaṃsu.

āgacchi

DHP 219 piyavaggo

idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu gilāno hoti. so ce bhikkhūnaṃ santike dūtaṃ pahiṇeyya, ahañ'hi gilāno, āgacchantu bhikkhū, icchāmi bhikkhūnaṃ āgatan'ti.

taṃ buddhaṃ asitaṃ tādiṃ,
akuhaṃ gaṇim'āgataṃ,
bahūnam'idha baddhānaṃ,
atthi pañhena āgamaṃ.

āgatāni kho, tāta uttara, amhākaṃ mantesu dvattiṃsamahāpurisalakkhaṇāni, yehi samannāgatassa mahāpurisassa dve'y'eva gatiyo bhavanti anaññā.

āgatapubba

adj. visited before ✗

mahāsamayo pavanasmiṃ,
devakāyā samāgatā,
āgat'amha imaṃ dhammasamayaṃ,
dakkhitāye aparājitasaṅghan'ti.

fem. coming; arrival [ā + √gam + ti] ✓

Antonym gati
Sanskrit āgati
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

tatr'āp'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, n'eva āgatiṃ vadāmi, na gatiṃ, na ṭhitiṃ, na cutiṃ, na upapattiṃ. appatiṭṭhaṃ, appavattaṃ, anārammaṇam'ev'etaṃ. es'ev'anto dukkhassā'ti.

UD 71 paṭhamanibbānapaṭisaṃyuttasuttaṃ

sa kho so, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako iti paṭisañcikkhati, na kho ahaññ'ev'eko jarādhammo jaraṃ anatīto, atha kho yāvatā sattānaṃ āgati gati cuti upapatti sabbe sattā jarādhammā jaraṃ anatītā'ti.

AN 5.57 abhiṇhapaccavekkhitabbaṭhānasuttaṃ
āgatigati

fem. coming and going; arriving and departing [āgati + gati] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning coming and going; arriving and departing
Construction āgati + gati
Compound dvanda (āgati ca gati ca)
Sanskrit āgati + gati

nissitassa calitaṃ, anissitassa calitaṃ n'atthi. calite asati passaddhi, passaddhiyā sati nati na hoti. natiyā asati āgatigati na hoti. āgatigatiyā asati cut'ūpapāto na hoti. cut'ūpapāte asati n'ev'idha na huraṃ na ubhayam'antarena. es'ev'anto dukkhassā'ti.

pañhe pucchituṃ abhikaṅkhamāno,
tes'antakaro bhavāmi pañhe te puṭṭho,
anupubbaṃ anudhammaṃ byākaromi te.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 327
āgantukasutta

Meaning having arrived; having come to; having returned

puratthimāya disāya āgantvā sīghaṃ dūtayugaṃ taṃ dovārikaṃ evaṃ vadeyya, kahaṃ, bho purisa, imassa nagarassa nagarassāmī'ti? so evaṃ vadeyya, eso, bhante, majjhe siṅghāṭake nisinno'ti.

SN 35.245 kiṃsukopamasuttaṃ

bhikkhussa ṭhit'okāsaṃ vā nisinn'okāsaṃ vā nipann'okāsaṃ vā āgantvā mantentaṃ ukkāsitabbaṃ, vijānāpetabbaṃ, no ce ukkāseyya vā vijānāpeyya vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.8.8 upassutisikkhāpadaṃ
āgantvāna

Phonetic Change m > n
Antonym anāgantvā
Commentary (KPa) āgantvāna sakaṃ gharan'ti ettha sakaṃ gharaṃ nāma pubbañātigharam'pi attanā sāmikabhāvena ajjhāvutthapubbagharam'pi. tadubhayam'pi yasmā te sakagharasaññāya āgacchan'ti, tasmā āgantvāna sakaṃ gharan'ti āha.
Sanskrit āgantvā
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

tirokuṭṭesu tiṭṭhanti,
sandhisiṅghāṭakesu ca,
dvārabāhāsu tiṭṭhanti,
āgantvāna sakaṃ gharaṃ.

idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya, asukasmiṃ nāma āvāse sambahulā therā bhikkhū viharanti bahussutā āgat'āgamā dhammadharā vinayadharā mātikādharā. tesaṃ me therānaṃ sammukhā sutaṃ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṃ

Sanskrit āgama
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

khurapariyantena ce'pi cakkena yo imissā pathaviyā pāṇe ekaṃ maṃsakhalaṃ ekaṃ maṃsapuñjaṃ kareyya, n'atthi tatonidānaṃ pāpaṃ, n'atthi pāpassa āgamo.

MN 60 apaṇṇakasuttaṃ
āgama 3

masc. (gram) insertion; inserted consonant; augment; lit. arrival [ā + √gam + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from āgacchati
Meaning (gram) insertion; inserted consonant; augment; lit. arrival
Root Family ā √gam
Root √gam･1 a (go)
Construction ā + √gam + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit āgama
Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

tesaṃgahaṇena samāsataddhit'ākhyātakitakānaṃ vibhattipaccayapad'akkhar'āgamā ca lopā honti. vāsiṭṭho, venateyyo

kaccāyana samāsakappa 317

ākhyātasāgaram'ath'ajjatanītaraṅgaṃ,
dhātujjalaṃ vikaraṇ'āgamakālamīnaṃ,
lop'ānubandh'ariyam'atthavibhāgatīraṃ,
dhīrā taranti kavino puthubuddhināvā.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa, paṭhamakaṇḍa
āgama 4

masc. coming, approach [ā + √gam] ✗
āgamana 1

etu kho, bhante, bhagavā. svāgataṃ, bhante, bhagavato. cirassaṃ kho, bhante, bhagavā imaṃ pariyāyam'akāsi, yadidaṃ idh'āgamanāya

DN 9.1 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ

ehi kho, mārisa, svāgataṃ, mārisa! cirassaṃ kho, mārisa, imaṃ pariyāyam'akāsi yadidaṃ idh'āgamanāya.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

yassa darathajā na santi keci,
oraṃ āgamanāya paccayāse,
so bhikkhu jahāti orapāraṃ,
urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.

SNP 1 uragasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 1

te upakaṭṭhāya vass'ūpanāyikāya pañcasatatāpase himavantato āgantvā nagare bhikkhāya carante disvā pasīditvā nisīdāpetvā bhojetvā paṭiññaṃ gahetvā cattāro māse attano santike vasāpetvā puna vass'āratte āgaman'atthāya paṭijānāpetvā uyyojesuṃ.

Commentary (MNa) āgamayamāno'ti olokayamāno. ahaṃ buddho'ti sahasā appavisitvā yāva sā kathā niṭṭhāti, tāva aṭṭhāsī'ti attho.

Sanskrit Root √gam 1 (go)

tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū rammakassa brāhmaṇassa assame dhammiyā kathāya sannisinnā honti. atha kho bhagavā bahidvārakoṭṭhake aṭṭhāsi kathāpariyosānaṃ āgamayamāno.

kathaṃ lokaṃ avekkhantaṃ,
maccurājā na passati.

SNP 70 mogharāja māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 15

anejaṃ mūladassāviṃ,
atthi pañhena āgamaṃ,
kiṃ nissitā isayo manujā,
khattiyā brāhmaṇā devatānaṃ,
yaññam'akappayiṃsu puthū'dha loke,
pucchāmi taṃ bhagavā brūhi me taṃ.

gāthā'c'imā atthavatī abhāsi.

sabbe sattā sabbe pāṇā,
sabbe bhūtā ca kevalā,
sabbe bhadrāni passantu,
mā kañci pāpam'āgamā.

Commentary (MNa) piṭṭhi me āgilāyatī'ti kasmā āgilāyati? bhagavato hi chabbassāni padhānaṃ padahantassa mahantaṃ kāyadukkhaṃ ahosi, athassa aparabhāge mahallakakāle piṭṭhivāto uppajji.

paṭibhātu taṃ, ānanda, kāpilavatthavānaṃ sakyānaṃ sekho pāṭipado. piṭṭhi me āgilāyati, tam'ahaṃ āyamissāmī'ti.

nāgo tādi pavuccate tathattā'ti.

ṭ > t

tass'eva kho pana pubbe aviddasuno āghāto hoti byāpādo sampadoso. sv'āssa pahīno hoti ucchinnamūlo tāl'āvatthukato anabhāvaṃkato āyatiṃ anuppādadhammo.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ

nava'y'ime, bhikkhave, āghātapaṭivinayā. katame nava? anatthaṃ me acari, taṃ kut'ettha labbhā'ti āghātaṃ paṭivineti.

katakicco anāsavo,

mutto āghātanā yathā.

TH 248 adhimuttattheragāthā

seyyathā'pi saha bhaṇḍena gahitacoraṃ, vadhetha nan'ti rañño āṇāya rājapurisā bandhitvā catukke catukke pahārasatāni dentā āghātanaṃ nenti.

sārambhaṃ nāma ... pubb'aṇṇanissitaṃ vā hoti, apar'aṇṇanissitaṃ vā hoti, abbhāghātanissitaṃ vā hoti, āghātananissitaṃ vā hoti, susānanissitaṃ vā hoti, uyyānanissitaṃ vā hoti

VIN 1.2.6 kuṭikārasikkhāpadaṃ
āghātapaṭivinaya

masc. removal of annoyance; dispelling irritation; lit. leading out anger [āghāta + paṭivinaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning removal of annoyance; dispelling irritation; lit. leading out anger
Construction āghāta + paṭivinaya
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (āghātaṃ + paṭivinaya)
Commentary (ANa) āghātapaṭivinayā'ti āghātassa paṭivinayakāraṇāni. (ANa) āghātaṃ paṭivinenti vūpasamentī'ti āghātapaṭivinayā.
Sanskrit āghāta + prati + vinaya

pañc'ime, āvuso, āghātapaṭivinayā yattha bhikkhuno uppanno āghāto sabbaso paṭivinetabbo. katame pañca? idh'āvuso, ekacco puggalo aparisuddhakāyasamācāro hoti parisuddhavacīsamācāro.

AN 5.162 dutiyaāghātapaṭivinayasuttaṃ

nava'y'ime, bhikkhave, āghātapaṭivinayā. katame nava? anatthaṃ me acari, taṃ kut'ettha labbhā'ti āghātaṃ paṭivineti.

āghātapaṭivinayasutta 1

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 9.30 (AN9.30) ✗

ācama

masc. sipping; rinsing ✗
ācamati

pr. sips (water, for purification); rinses (one's mouth or one's body) [ā + √cam] ✗
ācamana

nt. washing; rinsing [ā + √cam + ana] ~

Meaning washing; rinsing
Root Family ā √cam
Root √cam･1 a (wash, rinse)
Construction ā + √cam + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Synonym vikkhālana
Commentary (SNa) udak'ācamanāni cā'ti udakena mukhaparimajjanāni.

kim'idaṃ kusalaṃ kim'ācarema,
icc'eke hi samecca mantayanti,
te mayaṃ puna'r'eva laddha mānusattaṃ,
paṭipannā viharemu sīlavanto.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
ācariyadhana

nt. payment for a teacher; teacher's fee; lit. teacher's wealth [ācariya + dhana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning payment for a teacher; teacher's fee; lit. teacher's wealth
Construction ācariya + dhana

Commentary (MNa) ācariyadhanaṃ pariyesissantī'ti aññatitthiyā hi yassa santike sippaṃ uggaṇhanti, tassa sipp'uggahaṇato pure vā pacchā vā antar'antare vā gehato nīharitvā dhanaṃ denti. yesaṃ gehe n'atthi, te ñātisabhāgato pariyesanti, tathā alabhamānā bhikkham'pi caritvā denti'y'eva. taṃ sandhāy'etaṃ vuttaṃ.
Sanskrit ācārya + dhana

imehi nāma, bhante, aññatitthiyā ācariyassa ācariyadhanaṃ pariyesissanti, kim'aṅgaṃ pan'āhaṃ āyasmato ānandassa pūjaṃ na karissāmī'ti!

Sanskrit ācārya + leśa

Commentary (VINa) buddhavevacanāni vā'ti buddhassa vā pariyāyanāmāni ... asakyaputtiyassa vā. tattha vaṇṇapaṭṭhāne āgataṃ nāmasahassaṃ upāligāthāsu (ma ni 2.76) nāmasataṃ aññāni ca guṇato labbhamānāni nāmāni buddhavevacanānī'ti veditabbāni. sabbāni'pi dhammassa nāmāni dhammavevacanānī'ti veditabbāni. esa nayo sabbattha.

Sanskrit ācāma
Sanskrit Root √cam 1, 5 (sip)

so sākabhakkho'pi hoti sāmākabhakkho'pi hoti nīvārabhakkho'pi hoti daddulabhakkho'pi hoti haṭabhakkho'pi hoti kaṇabhakkho'pi hoti ācāmabhakkho'pi hoti piññākabhakkho'pi hoti tiṇabhakkho'pi hoti gomayabhakkho'pi hoti, vanamūlaphal'āhāro'pi yāpeti pavattaphalabhojī.

Meaning feeding on rice water; eating pot scum
Construction ācāma + bhakkha
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (ācāmaṃ + bhakkha)
Commentary (MNa) ācāmo'ti bhattaukkhalikāya laggo jhāmaodano, taṃ chaḍḍitaṭṭhāne gahetvā khādati. odanakañjiyan'ti'pi vadanti.
Sanskrit ācāma + bhakṣa

so sākabhakkho'pi hoti sāmākabhakkho'pi hoti nīvārabhakkho'pi hoti daddulabhakkho'pi hoti haṭabhakkho'pi hoti kaṇabhakkho'pi hoti ācāmabhakkho'pi hoti piññākabhakkho'pi hoti tiṇabhakkho'pi hoti gomayabhakkho'pi hoti, vanamūlaphal'āhāro'pi yāpeti pavattaphalabhojī.

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ

te tattha sākabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, sāmākabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, nīvārabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, daddulabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, haṭabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, kaṇabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, ācāmabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, piññākabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, tiṇabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, gomayabhakkhā'pi ahesuṃ, vanamūlaphal'āhārā yāpesuṃ pavattaphalabhojī.

MN 25 nivāpasuttaṃ
ācāmeti

pr. helps sip; helps wash [ā + √cam] ✗
ācāra 1

masc. behaviour; conduct; action [ā + √car + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ācarati
Meaning behaviour; conduct; action
Root Family ā √car
Root √car･1 a (act, behave)
Construction ā + √car > cār + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym anācāra
Sanskrit ācāra
Sanskrit Root √car 1 (move)

ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī samādāya sikkhassu sikkhāpadesū'ti

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sīlavā hoti, pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvuto viharati ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu.

seyyath'idaṃ, nando vaccho, kiso saṃkicco, makkhali gosālo, etehi, bho gotama, acelakā mutt'ācārā hatth'āpalekhanā naehibhaddantikā natiṭṭhabhaddantikā na abhihaṭaṃ na uddissakataṃ na nimantanaṃ sādiyanti

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning well mannered; well behaved; lit. skilled in behaviour
Construction ācāra + kusala
Compound sattamī tappurisa (ācāre + kusala)
Commentary (DHPa) ācārakusalo'ti sīlam'pi ācāro, vattapaṭivattam'pi ācāro. tattha kusalo siyā, cheko bhaveyyā'ti attho.
Sanskrit ācāra + kuśala

mitte bhajassu kalyāṇe,
suddhājīve atandite,
paṭisanthāravuty'assa,
ācārakusalo siyā,
tato pāmojjabahulo,
dukkhass'antaṃ karissati.

DHP 376 bhikkhuvaggo
ācāragocara

masc. good behaviour and associations ✗
ācāragocarasampanna

adj. who knows how to behave and keep to suitable places; well behaved and restrained; lit. successful in behaviour and pasture [ācāragocara + sampanna] ✓

Meaning who knows how to behave and keep to suitable places; well behaved and restrained; lit. successful in behaviour and pasture

Commentary (SNa) ācāragocarasampanno'ti ācārena ca gocarena ca sampanno.
Sanskrit ācāra + gocara + sampanna

etha tumhe, āvuso, sīlavā hotha, pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvutā viharatha ācāragocarasampannā aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvino, samādāya sikkhatha sikkhāpadesū'ti

AN 5.114 andhakavindasuttaṃ

sīlavā hoti, pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvuto viharati ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu.

Meaning failure in moral conduct
Construction ācāra + vipatti
Commentary (VSa) tattha garukānaṃ dvinnaṃ āpattikkhandhānaṃ vasena sīlavipatticodanā veditabbā, avasesānaṃ vasena ācāravipatticodanā, micchādiṭṭhi-antaggāhikadiṭṭhivasena diṭṭhivipatticodanā, ājīvahetu paññattānaṃ channaṃ sikkhāpadānaṃ vasena ājīvavipatticodanā veditabbā.

Sanskrit Root √khyā √cakṣ 2 (see)
ācikkhati 1

Meaning informs; tells (to); talks about

Construction ā + cikkha + ti
Commentary (SNa) ācikkhatī'ti katheti.
Sanskrit ākhyāti
Sanskrit Root √khyā √cakṣ 2 (see)

amutra mayā dvattipattapūrā paṭiggahitā, mā kho tattha paṭiggaṇhī'ti. sace passitvā na ācikkhati, āpatti dukkaṭassa. sace ācikkhite paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

VIN 2.5.4.4 kāṇamātusikkhāpadaṃ

atthi, bhikkhave, loke lokadhammo, taṃ tathāgato abhisambujjhati abhisameti, abhisambujjhitvā abhisametvā taṃ ācikkhati deseti paññapeti paṭṭhapeti vivarati vibhajati uttānīkaroti.

SN 22.94 pupphasuttaṃ

Construction ā + cikkha + ti
Commentary (SNa) maggaṃ ācikkheyyā'ti hatthe gahetvā, esa maggo'ti vadeyya.
Sanskrit ākhyāti
Sanskrit Root √khyā √cakṣ 2 (see)

pāpā nivāreti kalyāṇe niveseti assutaṃ sāveti saggassa maggaṃ ācikkhati

DN 31.13 siṅgālasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṃ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṃ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṃ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṃ dhāreyya, cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhintī'ti.

VIN PAT PK saṅghuposatha pubbakaraṇādi vidhi

jegucchī nipako bhikkhu,
cātuyāmasusaṃvuto,
diṭṭhaṃ sutañ'ca ācikkhaṃ,
na hi nūna kibbisī siyā'ti.

hatajānīsu kassapo,
na pāpaṃ samanupassati,
puññaṃ vā pana attano,
sa ve vissāsam'ācikkhi,
satthā arahati mānanan'ti.

rūpena vā nimittena vā saññāṇaṃ katvā nikkhipitvā ācikkhitabbaṃ, yassa bhaṇḍaṃ naṭṭhaṃ so āgacchatū'ti.

SN 35.234 udāyīsuttaṃ

ahaṃ kho, āvuso, navo acirapabbajito adhun'āgato imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ. na t'āhaṃ sakkomi vitthārena ācikkhituṃ.

DHPa 1.1.3 tissatthera vatthu

na kho, āvuso gotama, āciṇṇaṃ nigaṇṭhassa nāṭaputtassa kammaṃ, kamman'ti paññapetuṃ. daṇḍaṃ, daṇḍan'ti kho, āvuso gotama, āciṇṇaṃ nigaṇṭhassa nāṭaputtassa paññapetun'ti.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
āciṇṇa 2

pp. practised; performed; observed [ā + √car] ✗

masc. customary practice ✗
ācinanta

Construction ā + cinā + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Sanskrit ācinvat
Sanskrit Root √ci 1, 2, 5 (gather)

m'āvamaññetha pāpassa,
na man'taṃ āgamissati,
udabindunipātena,
udakumbho'pi pūrati,
bālo pūrati pāpassa,
thokaṃ thokam'pi ācinaṃ.

DHP 121 pāpavaggo

tassa vaḍḍhanti vedanā,
anekā rūpasambhavā,
abhijjhā ca vihesā ca,
cittam'ass'ūpahaññati,
evaṃ ācinato dukkhaṃ,
ārā nibbānam'uccati.

SNP 53 attadaṇḍasuttaṃ

kull'ūpamaṃ vo, bhikkhave, dhammaṃ desitaṃ, ājānantehi dhammā'pi vo pahātabbā pag'eva adhammā.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ

acchariyaṃ, āvuso, abbhutaṃ, āvuso! yathā taṃ sutavatā sāvakena samma'd'eva satthusāsanaṃ ājānantena, evam'eva āyasmatā puṇṇena mantāṇiputtena gambhīrā gambhīrapañhā anumassa anumassa byākatā.

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ

Phonetic Change ñ > j
Variant abhijānamāna
Sanskrit ājānāna
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

n'āhaṃ sahissāmi pamocanāya,
kathaṃkathiṃ dhotaka kañci loke,
dhammañ'ca seṭṭhaṃ ājānamāno,
evaṃ tuvaṃ ogham'imaṃ taresi.

SNP 60 dhotaka māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 5
ājānāti 1

pr. (+acc) knows; understands [ā + √ñā + nā + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning knows; understands
Root Family ā √ñā
Root √ñā･5 nā (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Base √ñā + nā > jānā
Construction ā + jānā + ti
Phonetic Change ñ > j
Synonym jānāti, munāti
Sanskrit ājānāti
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

yathākathaṃ pana tvaṃ bhikkhu mayā saṃkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena atthaṃ ājānāsī'ti

SN 22.35 aññatarabhikkhusuttaṃ

tath'āhaṃ bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi yathā ye'me antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā te paṭisevato n'ālaṃ antarāyāyā'ti.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
ājānāti 2

pr. (+acc) finds out; learns [ā + √ñā + nā + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning finds out; learns
Root Family ā √ñā
Root √ñā･5 nā (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Base √ñā + nā > jānā
Construction ā + jānā + ti
Phonetic Change ñ > j
Sanskrit ājānāti
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

atha kho te bhikkhū tesaṃ aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ bhāsitaṃ n'eva abhinandiṃsu nappaṭikkosiṃsu, anabhinanditvā appaṭikkositvā uṭṭhāy'āsanā pakkamiṃsu, bhagavato santike etassa bhāsitassa atthaṃ ājānissāmā'ti.

SN 46.53 aggisuttaṃ
ājānāti 3

pr. acknowledges [ā + √ñā] ✗
ājāni

aor. knew, understood [ā + √ñā] ✗
ājānituṃ

inf. (+acc) to know; to understand [ā + √ñā + nā + ituṃ] ✓

Grammar inf of ājānāti, trans (+acc)
Meaning to know; to understand
Root Family ā √ñā
Root √ñā･5 nā (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Base √ñā + nā > jānā
Construction ā + jānā + ituṃ
Phonetic Change ñ > j
Synonym aññātuṃ, ñātuṃ
Sanskrit ājñātum
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

mātugāmo nāma manuss'itthī, na yakkhī, na petī, na tiracchānagatā. viññū paṭibalā subhāsitadubbhāsitaṃ duṭṭhull'āduṭṭhullaṃ ājānituṃ.

VIN 1.2.3 duṭṭhullavācāsikkhāpadaṃ
ājānitvā

abs. (+acc) having understood; having comprehended [ā + √ñā + nā + itvā] ~

Grammar abs of ājānāti, trans (+acc)
Meaning having understood; having comprehended
Root Family ā √ñā
Root √ñā･5 nā (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Base √ñā + nā > jānā
Construction ā + jānā + itvā
Phonetic Change ñ > j
Sanskrit ājñītvā
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)
ājāniya

adj. thoroughbred; well bred [ā + √jan + *iya] ✓

Grammar adj, from ājāyati
Meaning thoroughbred; well bred
Root Family ā √jan
Root √jan･3 ya (be born, produce)
Construction ā + √jan > jān + *iya
Derivative kita (*iya)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym khaḷuṅka
Variant ājāneyya, ājānīya, ājañña
Sanskrit ājāneyya, ājāneya
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

kiṃ pattinam'āhu vedaguṃ,
anuviditaṃ kena kathañ'ca vīriyavā'ti,
ājāniyo kin'ti nāma hoti,
puṭṭho me bhagavā byākarohi.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ

yass'assu lunāni bandhanāni,
ajjhattaṃ bahiddhā ca saṅgamūlaṃ,
sabbasaṅgamūlabandhanā pamutto,
ājāniyo tādi pavuccate tathattā'ti.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
ājānīya

adj. thoroughbred; well bred; of good breed; of high pedigree [ā + √jan + *īya] ✓

Grammar adj, from ājāyati
Meaning thoroughbred; well bred; of good breed; of high pedigree
Root Family ā √jan
Root √jan･3 ya (be born, produce)
Construction ā + √jan > jān + *īya
Derivative kita (*īya)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym khaḷuṅka, anājānīya
Variant ājāneyya, ājāniya, ājañña
Commentary (SNa) ājānīyo'ti hatthī vā hotu ass'ādīsu aññataro vā, yo kāraṇaṃ jānāti, ayaṃ ājānīyo'va catuppadānaṃ seṭṭho'ti attho.
Sanskrit ājāneyya, ājāneya
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

varam'assatarā dantā,
ājānīyā ca sindhavā,
kuñjarā ca mahānāgā,
attadanto tato varaṃ.

DHP 322 nāgavaggo

sambuddho dvipadaṃ seṭṭho,
ājānīyo catuppadaṃ,
sussūsā seṭṭhā bhariyānaṃ,
yo ca puttānam'assavo'ti.

SN 1.14 khattiyasuttaṃ
ājānīyajjhāyita

nt. thinking of a thoroughbred; contemplation of a thoroughbred; meditation of nobleman [ājānīya + jhāyita] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning thinking of a thoroughbred; contemplation of a thoroughbred; meditation of nobleman
Construction ājānīya + jhāyita
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ājānīyassa + jhāyita)
Antonym khaḷuṅkajhāyita
Variant ājānīyajhāyita
Sanskrit ājāneyya, ājāneya + dhīta

ājānīyajjhāyitaṃ kho, saddha, jhāyatha, mā khaḷuṅkajjhāyitaṃ. kathañ'ca, khaḷuṅkajjhāyitaṃ hoti?

AN 11.9 saddhasuttaṃ
ājānīyajhāyita

nt. thinking of a thoroughbred; contemplation of a thoroughbred; meditation of nobleman [ājānīya + jhāyita] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning thinking of a thoroughbred; contemplation of a thoroughbred; meditation of nobleman
Construction ājānīya + jhāyita
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ājānīyassa + jhāyita)
Antonym khaḷuṅkajhāyita
Variant ājānīyajjhāyita
Sanskrit ājāneya + dhyai

ājānīyajhāyitaṃ kho, sandha, jhāya, mā khaḷuṅkajhāyitaṃ. kathañ'ca, khaḷuṅkajhāyitaṃ hoti?

AN 11.9 saddhasuttaṃ
ājānīyaṭṭhāna 1

nt. position of a thoroughbred [ājānīya + ṭhāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning position of a thoroughbred
Construction ājānīya + ṭhāna
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ājānīyassa + ṭhāna)
Sanskrit ājāneyya, ājāneya + sthāna

seyyathā'pi bhikkhave, assakhaḷuṅkassa kiñ'c'āpi evaṃ icchā uppajjeyya, aho vata maṃ manussā ājānīyaṭṭhāne ṭhapeyyuṃ, ājānīyabhojanañ'ca bhojeyyuṃ, ājānīyaparimajjanañ'ca parimajjeyyun'ti

AN 10.87 nappiyasuttaṃ
ājānīyaṭṭhāna 2

nt. high position; exalted state; lit. place of a thoroughbred [ājānīya + ṭhāna] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning high position; exalted state; lit. place of a thoroughbred
Construction ājānīya + ṭhāna
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ājānīyassa + ṭhāna)
Sanskrit ājāneyya, ājāneya + sthāna
ājānīyaṭhāna

nt. place fit for thoroughbreds; position suitable for those of high pedigree [ājānīya + ṭhāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning place fit for thoroughbreds; position suitable for those of high pedigree
Construction ājānīya + ṭhāna
Compound kammadhāraya (ājānīya + ṭhāna)
Antonym anājānīyaṭhāna
Sanskrit ājāneyya + sthāna

mayañ'hi, bhante, pubbe aññatitthiye paribbājake anājānīy'eva samāne ājānīyā'ti amaññimha, anājānīy'eva samāne ājānīyabhojanaṃ bhojimha, anājānīy'eva samāne ājānīyaṭhāne ṭhapimha.

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ
ājānīyaparimajjana

nt. grooming fit for a thoroughbred [ājānīya + parimajjana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning grooming fit for a thoroughbred
Construction ājānīya + parimajjana
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ājānīyassa + parimajjana)
Sanskrit ājāneyya, ājāneya + parimārjana

seyyathā'pi bhikkhave, assakhaḷuṅkassa kiñ'c'āpi evaṃ icchā uppajjeyya, aho vata maṃ manussā ājānīyaṭṭhāne ṭhapeyyuṃ, ājānīyabhojanañ'ca bhojeyyuṃ, ājānīyaparimajjanañ'ca parimajjeyyun'ti atha kho naṃ manussā na c'eva ājānīyaṭṭhāne ṭhapenti na ca ājānīyabhojanaṃ bhojenti na ca ājānīyaparimajjanaṃ parimajjanti.

AN 10.87 nappiyasuttaṃ
ājānīyabhojana

nt. food fit for thoroughbreds; meals suitable for noble ones [ājānīya + bhojana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning food fit for thoroughbreds; meals suitable for noble ones
Construction ājānīya + bhojana
Compound catutthī tappurisa (ājānīyassa + bhojana)
Antonym anājānīyabhojana
Commentary (MNa) ājānīyabhojanan'ti kāraṇaṃ jānantehi bhuñjitabbaṃ bhojanaṃ.
Sanskrit ājāneyya + bhojana

mayañ'hi, bhante, pubbe aññatitthiye paribbājake anājānīy'eva samāne ājānīyā'ti amaññimha, anājānīy'eva samāne ājānīyabhojanaṃ bhojimha, anājānīy'eva samāne ājānīyaṭhāne ṭhapimha.

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi bhikkhave, assakhaḷuṅkassa kiñ'c'āpi evaṃ icchā uppajjeyya, aho vata maṃ manussā ājānīyaṭṭhāne ṭhapeyyuṃ, ājānīyabhojanañ'ca bhojeyyuṃ, ājānīyaparimajjanañ'ca parimajjeyyun'ti atha kho naṃ manussā na c'eva ājānīyaṭṭhāne ṭhapenti na ca ājānīyabhojanaṃ bhojenti na ca ājānīyaparimajjanaṃ parimajjanti. taṃ kissa hetu?

AN 10.87 nappiyasuttaṃ
ājānīyavant

masc. who has thoroughbred-like qualities; who has noble character; lit. having thoroughbred quality [ājānīya + vant] ✓

Grammar masc, from ājānīya
Meaning who has thoroughbred-like qualities; who has noble character; lit. having thoroughbred quality
Construction ājānīya + vant
Derivative taddhita (vant)
Sanskrit ājāneya + vat

ājānīyo vata, bho, samaṇo gotamo, ājānīyavatā ca samuppannā sārīrikā vedanā dukkhā tibbā kharā kaṭukā asātā amanāpā sato sampajāno adhivāseti avihaññamāno'ti.

SN 1.38 sakalikasuttaṃ
ājānīyasusūpama

adj. with the simile of the thoroughbred colt [ājānīya + susu + upama] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with the simile of the thoroughbred colt
Construction ājānīya + susu + upama

adj. thoroughbred; well bred [ā + √jan + *eyya] ~

Root √jan･3 ya (be born, produce)

Variant ājāniya, ājānīya, ājañña
Sanskrit ājāneyya, ājāneya
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)
ājāyati

pr. (+loc) is born (in) [ā + √jan + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass, intrans (+loc)
Meaning is born (in)
Root Family ā √jan
Root √jan･3 ya (be born, produce)
Base √jan + ya > janya > jāya (pass, irreg)
Construction ā + jāya + ti
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym vijāyati
Sanskrit ājāyate
Sanskrit Root √jan 4 (give birth, be born)

sace enti manussattaṃ,
aḍḍhe ājāyare kule,
coḷaṃ piṇḍo ratī khiḍḍā,
yatthākicchena labbhati.

SN 1.49 maccharisuttaṃ
ājīva

masc. livelihood; mode of living; way of life; way of earning a living [ā + √jīv + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ājīvati
Meaning livelihood; mode of living; way of life; way of earning a living
Root Family ā √jīv
Root √jīv･1 a (live)
Construction ā + √jīv + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit ājīva
Sanskrit Root √jīv 1 (live)

parisuddho no ājīvo bhavissati uttāno vivaṭo na ca chiddavā saṃvuto ca

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

siyā kho pana te, nigrodha, evam'assa, ājīvā no cāvetu'kāmo samaṇo gotamo evam'āhā'ti. na kho pan'etaṃ, nigrodha, evaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ. yo eva vo ājīvo, so eva vo ājīvo hotu.

DN 25 udumbarikasuttaṃ
ājīvaka

masc. Ājīvaka; ascetic; member of a renunciant sect; (comm) naked ascetic; lit. (following a specific code of) livelihood [ā + √jīv + aka] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from ājīva
Meaning Ājīvaka; ascetic; member of a renunciant sect; (comm) naked ascetic; lit. (following a specific code of) livelihood
Root Family ā √jīv
Root √jīv･1 a (live)
Construction ā + √jīv + aka
Derivative kita (aka)
Commentary (MNa) ājīvako'ti naggasamaṇako.
Sanskrit ājīvaka
Sanskrit Root √jīv 1 (live)

evaṃ vutte, bhikkhave, upako ājīvako hupeyya'p'āvuso'ti

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ

tatr'idaṃ, bhante, pūraṇena kassapena sukk'ābhijāti paññattā, ājīvakā ājīvakiniyo.

AN 6.57 chaḷabhijātisuttaṃ
ājīvakavatadīpakasutta

nt. discourse which illustrates the practices of Ājīvakas [ājīvaka + vata + dīpaka + sutta] ~

Meaning discourse which illustrates the practices of Ājīvakas
Construction ājīvaka + vata + dīpaka + sutta

nt. one hundred Ājīvaka ascetics; (comm) one hundred Ājīvaka lifestyles [ājīvaka + sata] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning one hundred Ājīvaka ascetics; (comm) one hundred Ājīvaka lifestyles
Construction ājīvaka + sata
Compound digu (ājīvakā + satāni)
Commentary (MNa) ekūnapaññāsa ājīvasate'ti ekūnapaññāsa ājīvavuttisatāni.
Notes see SCPN §10 (Eastern Forms)
Sanskrit ājīvaka + śataṃ

ek'ūnapaññāsa ājīvakasate, ek'ūnapaññāsa paribbājakasate, ek'ūnapaññāsa nāg'āvāsasate, vīse indriyasate, tiṃse nirayasate, chattiṃsa rajodhātuyo

AN 10.49 sarīraṭṭhadhammasuttaṃ
ājīvika

masc. ascetic; member of a renunciant sect; (comm) naked ascetic; lit. (following a specific code of) livelihood [ā + √jīv + ika] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from ājīva
Meaning ascetic; member of a renunciant sect; (comm) naked ascetic; lit. (following a specific code of) livelihood
Root Family ā √jīv
Root √jīv･1 a (live)
Construction ā + √jīv + ika
Derivative kita (ika)
Sanskrit ājīvaka
Sanskrit Root √jīv 1 (live)

addasā kho maṃ, bhikkhave, upako ājīviko antarā ca gayaṃ antarā ca bodhiṃ addhānamaggappaṭipannaṃ. disvāna maṃ etadavoca, vippasannāni kho te, āvuso, indriyāni, parisuddho chavivaṇṇo pariyodāto!

āṇa

āṇaka

āṇaṇya

nt. freedom from debt; being debt-free; being out of debt [na + iṇa + *ya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from na anaṇa, neg
Meaning freedom from debt; being debt-free; being out of debt
Construction na > an > ān + iṇa + *ya
anaṇa + *ya
Derivative taddhita (*ya)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym aṇa, iṇa
Variant aṇaṇa, ānaṇya
Sanskrit ānṛṇya

seyyathā'pi … āṇaṇyaṃ yathā ārogyaṃ yathā bandhanāmokkhaṃ yathā bhujissaṃ yathā khemantabhūmiṃ

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
āṇatta 1

pp. ordered; commanded [ā + √ñā + *āpe + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of āṇāpeti, caus
Meaning ordered; commanded
Root Family ā √ñā
Root √ñā･5 *āpe (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Base √ñā + āpe > ñāpe > ṇāpe (caus, irreg)
Construction ā + ṇāpe + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change ñ > ṇ
p > t
Sanskrit ājñapta, ājñāpita
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

acchindāpeyyā'ti aññaṃ āṇāpeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa. sakiṃ āṇatto bahukam'pi acchindati, nissaggiyaṃ hoti.

VIN 1.4.3.5 cīvarācchindanasikkhāpadaṃ

nikkaḍḍhāpeyyā'ti aññaṃ āṇāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa. sakiṃ āṇatto bahuke'pi dvāre atikkāmeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.2.7 anupakhajjasikkhāpadaṃ
āṇatta 2

pp. ordered [ā + √ñā] ✗
āṇatti

fem. order; command; instruction [ā + √ñā + *āpe + ti] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, from āṇāpeti, caus
Meaning order; command; instruction
Root Family ā √ñā
Root √ñā･5 *āpe (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Base √ñā + āpe > ñāpe > ṇāpe (caus, irreg)
Construction ā + ṇāpe + ti
Derivative kita (ti)
Phonetic Change ñ > ṇ
āpe + ti > atti (contraction)
Synonym āṇā, āṇāti
Sanskrit ājñapti, āṇatti (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)
āṇattisahagatasikkhāpada

nt. training rules associated with ordering [āṇatti + sahagata + sikkhāpada] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning training rules associated with ordering
Construction āṇatti + sahagata + sikkhāpada
āṇā

fem. order; command; instruction [ā + √ñā + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, from ājānāti
Meaning order; command; instruction
Root Family ā √ñā
Root √ñā･5 nā (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Construction ā + √ñā + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Synonym āṇāti, āṇatti
Sanskrit ājñā
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

so, bhariyaṃ me nissāya bhayena uppannena bhavitabban'ti cintetvā rañño āṇaṃ paṭibāhituṃ asakkonto gantvā rājānaṃ vanditvā aṭṭhāsi

DHPa 1.5.1 aññatarapurisa vatthu

seyyathā'pi saha bhaṇḍena gahitacoraṃ, vadhetha nan'ti rañño āṇāya rājapurisā bandhitvā catukke catukke pahārasatāni dentā āghātanaṃ nenti.

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā
āṇāpaka

masc. who gives an order; who passes on an order ✗
āṇāpita

pp. instructed; ordered; enjoined [ā + √ñā] ✗

pr. (+acc) commands; orders; directs; lit. causes to know [ā + √ñā + *āpe + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of ājānāti, trans (+acc)
Meaning commands; orders; directs; lit. causes to know
Root Family ā √ñā
Root √ñā･5 *āpe (know)
√ In Comps ññā
Base √ñā + āpe > ñāpe > ṇāpe (caus, irreg)
Construction ā + ṇāpe + ti
Phonetic Change ñ > ṇ
Sanskrit ājñāpayati
Sanskrit Root √jñā 9 (know)

dhovā'ti āṇāpeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa. dhotāni nissaggiyāni honti. rajā'ti āṇāpeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa. rattāni nissaggiyāni honti. vijaṭehī'ti āṇāpeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa. vijaṭitāni nissaggiyāni honti.

VIN 1.4.2.7 eḷakalomadhovāpanasikkhāpadaṃ

sādhu, devo, vāhanāgāresu ca dvāresu ca āṇāpetu, yena vāhanena jīvako icchati tena vāhanena gacchatu, yena dvārena icchati tena dvārena gacchatu, yaṃ kālaṃ icchati taṃ kālaṃ gacchatu, yaṃ kālaṃ icchati taṃ kālaṃ pavisatū'ti.

idh'eva nipako sato,

sikkhe nibbānam'attano.

ātāpita

pp. heated [ā + √tap] ✗

samādhinā dhammavinicchayena ca,
sampannavijjācaraṇā patissatā,
jahissatha dukkham'idaṃ anappakaṃ.

niddaṃ na bahulīkareyya,
jāgariyaṃ bhajeyya ātāpī,
tandiṃ māyaṃ hassaṃ khiḍḍaṃ,
methunaṃ vippajahe savibhūsaṃ.

tasmā't'iha te, gahapati, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, āturakāyassa me sato cittaṃ anāturaṃ bhavissatī'ti. evañ'hi te, gahapati, sikkhitabban'ti.

SN 35.236 paṭhamahatthapādopamasuttaṃ
ādānapaṭinissagga

masc. abandoning attachment, relinquishing what is grasped ✗
ādānappaṭinissagga

masc. giving up taking up; relinquishing of holding; abandoning of grasping [ādāna + paṭinissagga] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning giving up taking up; relinquishing of holding; abandoning of grasping
Construction ādāna + paṭinissagga
ādānasatta

adj. stuck to grasping; entangled in grasping [ādāna + satta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning stuck to grasping; entangled in grasping
Construction ādāna + satta
Compound sattamī tappurisa (ādāne + satta)
Commentary (SNPa) ādānasatte iti pekkhamāno, pajaṃ imaṃ maccudheyye visattan'ti ādātabb'aṭṭhena ādānesu rūp'ādīsu satte sabbaloke imaṃ pajaṃ maccudheyye laggaṃ pekkhamāno. ādānasatte vā ādān'ābhiniviṭṭhe puggale ādānasaṅgahetuñ'ca imaṃ pajaṃ maccudheyye laggaṃ tato vītikkamituṃ asamatthaṃ iti pekkhamāno kiñcanaṃ sabbaloke na uppādiyethā'ti.
Sanskrit ādāna + sajjita

tasmā pajānaṃ na upādiyetha,
bhikkhu sato kiñcanaṃ sabbaloke,
ādānasatte iti pekkhamāno,
pajaṃ imaṃ maccudheyye visattan'ti.

SNP 67 bhadrāvudha māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 12

ādāya 1

ger. (+acc) taking [√ādā + ya] ✓

Grammar ger of ādiyati, trans (+acc)
Meaning taking
Root Family √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Construction √ādā + ya
Antonym anādā
Sanskrit ādāya
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

seyyathā'pi, āvuso, bhikkhu paṃsukūliko rathiyāya nantakaṃ disvā vāmena pādena niggaṇhitvā dakkhiṇena pādena pattharitvā, yo tattha sāro taṃ paripātetvā ādāya pakkameyya.

AN 5.162 dutiyaāghātapaṭivinayasuttaṃ

na monena munī hoti,
mūḷharūpo aviddasu,
yo ca tulaṃva paggayha,
varam'ādāya paṇḍito.

paṇḍito uppāditadhanañ'ca, ābhatadhanañ'ca sabbaṃ tassā mātāpitūnaṃ datvā samassāsetvā sasure āpucchitvā taṃ ādāya nagar'ābhimukho agamāsi.

puriso nāgam'āruhi.

THI 32 dantikātherīgāthā

seyyathā'pi, aggivessana, allaṃ kaṭṭhaṃ sasnehaṃ udake nikkhittaṃ. atha puriso āgaccheyya uttar'āraṇiṃ ādāya, aggiṃ abhinibbattessāmi, tejo pātukarissāmī'ti.

ādippati

pr. blazing, burning; red-hot [ā + √dīp] ✗

nt. primary ethics; fundamental morality; higher holy life ✗
ādibrahmacariyaka

adj. fundamental to the holy life; essential to the spiritual path [ādi + brahma + cariya + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, from brahmacariya
Meaning fundamental to the holy life; essential to the spiritual path
Construction ādi + brahma + cariya + ka
ādi + brahmacariya + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Compound kammadhāraya (ādi + brahmacariyaka)
Antonym nādibrahmacariyaka
Variant ādibrahmacariyika
Commentary (ANa) ādibrahmacariyakānī'ti maggabrahmacariyassa ādibhūtāni cattāri mahāsīlasikkhāpadāni.
Sanskrit ādi + brahmacarya + ka

taṃ kissa hetu? esā, bhikkhave, kathā atthasaṃhitā, esā ādibrahmacariyakā, esā nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattati.

SN 56.9 viggāhikakathāsuttaṃ

yāni ca kho tāni sikkhāpadāni ādibrahmacariyakāni brahmacariyasāruppāni tattha dhuvasīlo ca hoti ṭhitasīlo ca, samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu.

AN 3.89 tatiyasikkhāsuttaṃ
ādibrahmacariyaṃ

ind. as regards a pure and holy life ✗
ādibrahmacariyika

adj. fundamental to the holy life; essential to the spiritual path [ādi + brahma + cariya + ika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, from ādibrahmacariya
Meaning fundamental to the holy life; essential to the spiritual path
Construction ādi + brahma + cariya + ika
ādibrahmacariya + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Compound kammadhāraya (ādi + brahmacariyika)
Variant ādibrahmacariyaka
Commentary (SNa) ādibrahmacariyikā'ti maggabrahmacariyassa ādibhūtā pubbapadhānabhūtā.
Sanskrit ādi + brahmacarya + ka

aṭṭh'ime, bhikkhave, hetū aṭṭha paccayā ādibrahmacariyikāya paññāya appaṭiladdhāya paṭilābhāya, paṭiladdhāya bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya bhāvanāya pāripūriyā saṃvattanti. katame aṭṭha?

AN 8.2 paññāsuttaṃ

uggaṇhātha, bhikkhave, tāyanagāthā. pariyāpuṇātha, bhikkhave, tāyanagāthā. dhāretha, bhikkhave, tāyanagāthā. atthasaṃhitā, bhikkhave, tāyanagāthā ādibrahmacariyikā'ti.

SN 2.8 tāyanasuttaṃ
ādima

adj. first, original, foremost ✗
ādimeva

sandhi. (+loc) very beginning; (of) the very starting point (of) [ādiṃ + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, nt + ind (+loc)
Meaning very beginning; (of) the very starting point (of)
Construction ādiṃ + eva
Sanskrit ādi + eva

tasmā't'iha tvaṃ, bhikkhu, ādim'eva visodhehi kusalesu dhammesu. ko c'ādi kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ? idha tvaṃ, bhikkhu, pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvuto viharāhi ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhassu sikkhāpadesu.

SN 47.46 pātimokkhasaṃvarasuttaṃ

yā imā, bhante, anekavihitā diṭṭhiyo loke uppajjanti, attavādapaṭisaṃyuttā vā lokavādapaṭisaṃyuttā vā, ādim'eva nu kho, bhante, bhikkhuno manasikaroto evam'etāsaṃ diṭṭhīnaṃ pahānaṃ hoti, evam'etāsaṃ diṭṭhīnaṃ paṭinissaggo hotī'ti?

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ
ādiya 1.1

ger. (+acc) taking up [√ādā + ya] ✓

Grammar ger of ādiyati, trans (+acc)
Meaning taking up
Root Family √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Construction √ādā > ādi + ya
Phonetic Change ā > i (Kacc 502, 493)
Antonym anādiya
Sanskrit ādā
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

tam'enaṃ hatthidamako uttari kāraṇaṃ kāreti, ādiya, bho, nikkhipa, bho'ti.

MN 125 dantabhūmisuttaṃ
ādiya 2.1

adj. blameworthy; reproachable; lit. to be pointed out [ā + √dis + ya] ✓

Grammar adj, ptp of ādisati
Meaning blameworthy; reproachable; lit. to be pointed out
Root Family ā √dis
Root √dis･1 a (point out, explain)
Construction ā + √dis + ya
Derivative kicca (ya)
Phonetic Change y > s
Antonym anādiya
Variant ādissa
Commentary (MNa) tumhe'pi tena ādiyā bhaveyyāthā'ti tumhe'pi tena āmisadāy'ādabhāvena no dhammadāy'ādabhāvena ādiyā bhaveyyātha. apadisitabbā visuṃ kātabbā vavatthapetabbā, viññūhi gārayhā bhaveyyāthā'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit ādṛśya
Sanskrit Root √diś 3, 4, 6 (point)

tumhe ca me bhikkhave āmisadāy'ādā bhaveyyātha no dhammadāy'ādā, tumhe'pi tena ādiyā bhaveyyātha, āmisadāy'ādā satthusāvakā viharanti, no dhammadāy'ādā'ti

MN 3 dhammadāyādasuttaṃ
ādiyati 1

pr. (+acc) takes; grasps; embraces [√ādā + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning takes; grasps; embraces
Root Family √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Base √ādā + ya > ādāya > ādiya (irreg)
Construction ādiya + ti
Phonetic Change ā > i (Kacc 502, 493)
Synonym ādīyatī
Variant ādīyati
Sanskrit ādatte
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

saddhāya sīlena ca yā'dha vaḍḍhati,
paññāya cāgena sutena c'ūbhayaṃ,
sā t'ādisī sīlavatī upāsikā,
ādīyati sāram'idh'eva attano'ti.

SN 37.34 vaḍḍhīsuttaṃ

diṭṭhīnivesā na hi svātivattā,
dhammesu niccheyya samuggahītaṃ,
tasmā naro tesu nivesanesu,
nirassatī ādiyatī ca dhammaṃ.

SNP 41 duṭṭhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 3
ādiyati 2

pr. (+acc) steals; takes [√ādā + ya + ti] ✓

Meaning steals; takes
Root Family √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Base √ādā + ya > ādāya > ādiya (irreg)
Construction ādiya + ti
Phonetic Change ā > i (Kacc 502, 493)
Antonym nādiyati
Commentary (VIN 1.1.2) ādiyeyyā'ti ādiyeyya hareyya avahareyya iriyāpathaṃ vikopeyya ṭhānā cāveyya saṅketaṃ vītināmeyya.
Sanskrit ādatte
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

yo pāṇam'atipāteti,
musāvādañ'ca bhāsati,
loke adinnam'ādiyati,
paradārañ'ca gacchati.

DHP 246 malavaggo

sace musā na bhaṇasi,
sace pāṇaṃ na hiṃsasi,
sace adinnaṃ n'ādiyasi,
saddahāno amaccharī,
kiṃ kāhasi gayaṃ gantvā,
udapāno'pi te gayā'ti.

aor. (+acc) stole [√ādā + ya + i] ✓

Grammar aor of ādiyati, trans (+acc)
Meaning stole
Root Family √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)

Construction ādiya + i
Phonetic Change ā > i (Kacc 502, 493)
Sanskrit ādā
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

adhanānaṃ dhane ananuppadiyamāne dāliddiyaṃ vepullam'agamāsi. dāliddiye vepullaṃ gate aññataro puriso paresaṃ adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyi. tam'enaṃ aggahesuṃ.

DN 26.6 cakkavattisuttaṃ
ādiyi 3

aor. (+acc) accepted; approved; lit. took [√ādā] ✗
ādiyituṃ

inf. to grasp, to take; to seize [√ādā] ✗
ādiyitvā

Sanskrit ādāya
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)

kadā nu paññāmayam'uggatejaṃ,
satthaṃ isīnaṃ sahas'ādiyitvā,
māraṃ sasenaṃ sahasā bhañjissaṃ,
sīh'āsane taṃ nu kadā bhavissati.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

pārājiko hotī'ti seyyathā'pi nāma paṇḍupalāso bandhanā pavutto abhabbo haritatthāya, evam'eva bhikkhu pādaṃ vā pād'ārahaṃ vā atirekapādaṃ vā adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyitvā assamaṇo hoti asakyaputtiyo.

rattiṃ na bhuñjeyya vikālabhojanaṃ.

etam'ādīnaṃ ñatvā,
bhaven'amhi anatthiko,
nissaṭo sabbakāmehi,
patto me āsavakkhayo'ti.

TH 121 uttarattheragāthā
ādīna 2

adj. wretched [ā + √dī] ✗
ādīnava 1

masc. (+gen or +loc) danger (in); problem (in) [ā + √dī + na + vant + a] ✓

Meaning danger (in); problem (in)
Root Family ā √dī
Root √dī×3 ya (be afflicted)
Construction ā + √dī + na + vant + a
ādīnavant + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Commentary (ANa) ādīnavan'ti amadhurabhāvaṃ dosaṃ.
Notes (MW) misfortune, want of luck in dice
Sanskrit ādīnava
Sanskrit Root √dī 4 (decay)

na tāva, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno idh'ekacce ādīnavā saṃvijjanti yāva na ñatt'ajjhāpanno hoti yasappatto. yato ca kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ñatt'ajjhāpanno hoti yasappatto, ath'assa idh'ekacce ādīnavā saṃvijjanti.

MN 47 vīmaṃsakasuttaṃ
ādīnava 2

ādīnavant + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Antonym assāda, ānisaṃsa
Commentary (ANa) ādīnavan'ti amadhurabhāvaṃ dosaṃ.
Notes (MW) misfortune, want of luck in dice
Sanskrit ādīnava
Sanskrit Root √dī 4 (decay)

yato kho, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako imesaṃ pañcannaṃ upādānakkhandhānaṃ samudayañ'ca atthaṅ'gamañ'ca assādañ'ca ādīnavañ'ca nissaraṇañ'ca yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti

SN 22.109 sotāpannasuttaṃ

etam'ādīnavaṃ ñatvā,
muni pubb'āpare idha,
ekacariyaṃ daḷhaṃ kayirā,
na nisevetha methunaṃ.

SNP 45 tissametteyyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 7
ādīnavadassanahetu

ind. due to seeing the disadvantage [ādīnava + dassana + hetu] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning due to seeing the disadvantage
Construction ādīnava + dassana + hetu
Compound abyayībhāva (ādīnavadassana + hetu)
Sanskrit ādīnava + darśana + hetu

tadabhiññāya bhagavā assādam'addasa ādīnavam'addasa nissaraṇam'addasa magg'āmaggañāṇadassanam'addasa. tassa assādadassanahetu ādīnavadassanahetu nissaraṇadassanahetu magg'āmaggañāṇadassanahetu atthassa patti hadayassa santi viditā hoti.

AN 10.26 kāḷīsuttaṃ
ādīnavadassāvī

adj. (+gen or +loc) seeing the danger (in); seeing the disadvantage (of) [ādīnava + dassāvī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+gen or +loc)
Meaning seeing the danger (in); seeing the disadvantage (of)
Construction ādīnava + dassāvī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (ādīnavaṃ + dassāvī)
Antonym nissaraṇapañña, anādīnavadassāvī
Sanskrit ādīnava + darśivas

tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ ... aladdhā ca cīvaraṃ na ca paritassissāma, laddhā ca cīvaraṃ agadhitā amucchitā anajjhāpannā ādīnavadassāvino nissaraṇapaññā paribhuñjissāma.

SN 16.1 santuṭṭhasuttaṃ

tesaṃ gihī pasann'ākāraṃ karonti. te taṃ lābhaṃ agadhitā amucchitā anajjhopannā ādīnavadassāvino nissaraṇapaññā paribhuñjanti.

SN 20.9 nāgasuttaṃ
ādīnavapariyesanā

fem. (+gen) search for the disadvantage (of); quest for the inadequacy (of) [ādīnava + pariyesanā] ~

Grammar fem, act, comp (+gen)
Meaning search for the disadvantage (of); quest for the inadequacy (of)
Construction ādīnava + pariyesanā
ādīnavamaddasa

aor. saw the disadvantage (of); perceived the drawback (of) [ādīnavaṃ + addasa] ~

Grammar aor, comp vb
Meaning saw the disadvantage (of); perceived the drawback (of)
Construction ādīnavaṃ + addasa
ādīnavasaññā

fem. recognition of the disadvantage; perception of unsatisfactoriness [ādīnava + saññā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning recognition of the disadvantage; perception of unsatisfactoriness
Construction ādīnava + saññā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ādīnavassa + saññā)
Commentary (DNa) ādīnav'ānupassanāñāṇe saññā ādīnavasaññā nāma.
Notes ten peceptions 1. aniccasaññā, 2. anattasaññā, 3. asubhasaññā, 4. ādīnavasaññā, 5. pahānasaññā, 6. virāgasaññā, 7. nirodhasaññā, 8. sabbaloke anabhiratasaññā, 9. sabbasaṅkhāresu anicchāsaññā, 10. ānāpānassati.
Sanskrit ādīnava + saṃjñā

katamā c'ānanda, ādīnavasaññā? idh'ānanda, bhikkhu araññagato vā rukkhamūlagato vā suññ'āgāragato vā iti paṭisañcikkhati, bahudukkho kho ayaṃ kāyo bahuādīnavo.

AN 10.60 girimānandasuttaṃ

pañc'imā, bhikkhave, saññā bhāvitā bahulīkatā mahapphalā honti mah'ānisaṃsā amat'ogadhā amatapariyosānā. katamā pañca? asubhasaññā, maraṇasaññā, ādīnavasaññā, āhāre paṭikūlasaññā, sabbaloke anabhiratasaññā.

CPa 3.15 paṭhamasaññāsuttaṃ
ādīnavasaññāparicita

aniccasaññāparicitañ'ca no cittaṃ bhavissati, anattasaññāparicitañ'ca no cittaṃ bhavissati, asubhasaññāparicitañ'ca no cittaṃ bhavissati, ādīnavasaññāparicitañ'ca no cittaṃ bhavissati
