AN 10.60 girimānandasuttaṃ
ādīpita

pp. in flames, ablaze [ā + √dīp] ✗
ādīyati

pr. (+instr) is taken; is grasped; is embraced [√ādā] ✗
ādīyatī

pr. (+acc) takes; grasps; embraces [√ādā + ya + ti] ~

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning takes; grasps; embraces
Root Family √ādā
Root √ādā･3 ya (take, seize)
Base √ādā + ya > ādāya > ādīya (irreg)
Construction ādīya + ti > tī
Phonetic Change ā > i (Kacc 502, 493)
with metrically lengthened ī
Synonym ādiyati
Sanskrit ādatte
Sanskrit Root √dā 1, 2, 3, 4 (give)
ādu

ind. (second part of a question) or?; or rather? [udāhu] ✓

Grammar ind, interr
Meaning (second part of a question) or?; or rather?
Construction udāhu > ādu
Phonetic Change udāhu > ādu (contraction)
Sanskrit utāho

yadatthikaṃ, brahmacariyaṃ acarī,
kappāyano kacci'ssa taṃ amoghaṃ,
nibbāyi so ādu saupādiseso,
yathā vimutto ahu taṃ suṇoma.

katibhi parisujjhatī'ti.

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, udakamaṇiko ritto tuccho ādhāre ṭhapito. atha puriso āgaccheyya udakabhāraṃ ādāya. taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, api nu so puriso labhetha udakassa nikkhepanan'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

Construction √an > ān + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Commentary (VINa) ānan'ti assāso, no passāso. apānan'ti passāso, no assāso.
Sanskrit prāṇa
Sanskrit Root √an 1, 2, 6 (breathe)

yañ'hi taṃ, bhikkhave, sammā vadamāno vadeyya, ariyavihāro iti'pi, brahmavihāro iti'pi, tathāgatavihāro iti'pi, ānāpānassatisamādhiṃ sammā vadamāno vadeyya, ariyavihāro iti'pi, brahmavihāro iti'pi, tathāgatavihāro iti'pī'ti.

SN 54.11 icchānaṅgalasuttaṃ

ayam'pi kho, bhikkhave, ānāpānassatisamādhi bhāvito bahulīkato santo c'eva paṇīto ca asecanako ca sukho ca vihāro uppann'uppanne ca pāpake akusale dhamme ṭhānaso antaradhāpeti vūpasameti.

SN 54.9 vesālīsuttaṃ
ānaka

masc. kettle drum; timpani ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning kettle drum; timpani
Synonym mudiṅga
Variant āṇaka
Commentary (SNa) ānako'ti evaṃladdhanāmo mudiṅgo. himavante kira mahākuḷīradaho ahosi.
Sanskrit ānaka

bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, dasārahānaṃ ānako nāma mudiṅgo ahosi. tassa dasārahā ānake ghaṭite aññaṃ āṇiṃ odahiṃsu.

SN 20.7 āṇisuttaṃ
ānaṇyaka

ānaṇya + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change i > a
Variant aṇaṇa, anaṇaka
Sanskrit anṛṇa +

nt. best freedom from debt [ānaṇyaṃ + uttama] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning best freedom from debt
Construction ānaṇyaṃ + uttama
ānaṇyasukha

nt. pleasure of being debt-free; happiness of being out of debt [ānaṇya + sukha] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning pleasure of being debt-free; happiness of being out of debt
Construction ānaṇya + sukha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ānaṇyassa + sukha)
Variant aṇaṇasukha
Commentary (ANa) anaṇo'smī'ti uppajjanakasukhaṃ ānaṇyasukhaṃ nāma.
Sanskrit ānṛṇya + sukha

cattār'imāni, gahapati, sukhāni adhigamanīyāni gihinā kāmabhoginā kālena kālaṃ samayena samayaṃ upādāya. katamāni cattāri? atthisukhaṃ, bhogasukhaṃ, ānaṇyasukhaṃ, anavajjasukhaṃ.

AN 4.62 ānaṇyasuttaṃ
ānaṇyasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.62 (AN4.62) ✗
ānantarika 1

adj. immediate; without delay; with no interval; with immediate results [na + anta + ra + *ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from na antara, neg
Meaning immediate; without delay; with no interval; with immediate results
Construction na > an > ān + anta + ra + *ika
anantara + *ika
Derivative taddhita (*ika)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Compound kammadhāraya (na + antarika)
Synonym ānantariya
Commentary (DNa) ānantariko cetosamādhī'ti aññattha magg'ānantaraṃ phalaṃ ānantariko cetosamādhi nāma. idha pana vipassan'ānantaro maggo vipassanāya vā anantarattā attano vā anantaraṃ phaladāyakattā ānantariko cetosamādhī'ti adhippeto
Sanskrit na + antarikṣa

yaṃ buddhaseṭṭho parivaṇṇayī suciṃ,
samādhim'ānantarikañ'ñam'āhu,
samādhinā tena samo na vijjati,
idam'pi dhamme ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ,
etena saccena suvatthi hotu.

SNP 13 ratanasuttaṃ,
cūḷavaggo 1

ānanda 1

masc. happiness; joy [ā + √nand + a] ✓

Grammar masc, abstr, from ānandati
Meaning happiness; joy
Root Family ā √nand
Root √nand･1 a (delight, enjoy)
Construction ā + √nand + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym hāsa
Commentary (MNa) ānando'ti ānandapīti.
Sanskrit ānanda
Sanskrit Root √nand 1 (rejoice)

ko nu hāso kim'ānando,
niccaṃ pajjalite sati,
andhakārena onaddhā,
padīpaṃ na gavesatha.

DHP 146 jarāvaggo

tatra ce, bhikkhave, pare tathāgataṃ sakkaronti garuṃ karonti mānenti pūjenti, tatra, bhikkhave, tathāgatassa na hoti ānando na somanassaṃ na cetaso uppilāvitattaṃ.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
ānanda 2

masc. name of the Buddha's attendant; great disciple of the Buddha; foremost disciple in great learning, remembrance, conduct, resoluteness and service; lit. happiness [ā + √nand + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ānandati
Meaning name of the Buddha's attendant; great disciple of the Buddha; foremost disciple in great learning, remembrance, conduct, resoluteness and service; lit. happiness
Root Family ā √nand
Root √nand･1 a (delight, enjoy)
Construction ā + √nand + a
Derivative kita (a)
Commentary (AN 1.219) etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, mama sāvakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ bahussutānaṃ ... satimantānaṃ ... gatimantānaṃ ... dhitimantānaṃ ... upaṭṭhākānaṃ yadidaṃ ānando
Sanskrit ānanda
Sanskrit Root √nand 1 (rejoice)

yāyaṃ, bhante ānanda, samādhi na c'ābhinato na c'āpanato na ca sasaṅkhāraniggayhavāritagato, vimuttattā ṭhito, ṭhitattā santusito, santusitattā no paritassati. ayaṃ, bhante ānanda, samādhi kiṃphalo vutto bhagavatā'ti?

AN 9.37 ānandasuttaṃ

evañ'ca vadehi, sādhu kira, bhante, ayyo ānando yena bhikkhun'upassayo yena sā bhikkhunī ten'upasaṅkamatu anukampaṃ upādāyā'ti.

ānāpānasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 46.66 (SN46.66) ✗
ānāpānassati

fem. mindfulness while breathing in and out; mindfulness during inhalation and exhalation [ānāpāna + sati] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning mindfulness while breathing in and out; mindfulness during inhalation and exhalation
Construction ānāpāna + sati
Compound kammadhāraya (ānāpāna + sati)
Variant ānāpānasati
Notes ten peceptions 1. aniccasaññā, 2. anattasaññā, 3. asubhasaññā, 4. ādīnavasaññā, 5. pahānasaññā, 6. virāgasaññā, 7. nirodhasaññā, 8. sabbaloke anabhiratasaññā, 9. sabbasaṅkhāresu anicchāsaññā, 10. ānāpānassati.
Sanskrit prāṇāpāna + smṛti

yañ'hi taṃ, bhikkhave, sammā vadamāno vadeyya, ariyavihāro iti'pi, brahmavihāro iti'pi, tathāgatavihāro iti'pi, ānāpānassatisamādhiṃ sammā vadamāno vadeyya, ariyavihāro iti'pi, brahmavihāro iti'pi, tathāgatavihāro iti'pī'ti.

SN 54.11 icchānaṅgalasuttaṃ

disvāna āyasmantaṃ rāhulaṃ āmantesi, ānāpānassatiṃ, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvehi. ānāpānassati, rāhula, bhāvanā bhāvitā bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mah'ānisaṃsā'ti.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ
ānāpānassatibhāvanānuyogamanuyutta

adj. devoted to the development of mindfulness while breathing in and out; engaged in the cultivation of mindfulness during inhalation and exhalation [ānāpāna + sati + bhāvanā + anuyogaṃ + anuyutta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning devoted to the development of mindfulness while breathing in and out; engaged in the cultivation of mindfulness during inhalation and exhalation
Construction ānāpāna + sati + bhāvanā + anuyogaṃ + anuyutta
Compound alutta dutiyā tappurisa (ānāpānassatibhāvanānuyogaṃ + anuyutta)
Sanskrit prāṇāpāna + smṛti + bhāvanā + anuyoga + anuyukta

santi, bhikkhave, bhikkhū imasmiṃ bhikkhusaṅghe ānāpānassatibhāvan'ānuyogam'anuyuttā viharanti. ānāpānassati, bhikkhave, bhāvitā bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mah'ānisaṃsā.

MN 118 ānāpānassatisuttaṃ

Sanskrit anuśaṃsa (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √śaṃs √śaṅs 1 (praise)

pakappitā saṅkhatā yassa dhammā,
purakkhatā santi avīvadātā,
yadattani passati ānisaṃsaṃ,
taṃ nissito kuppapaṭicca santiṃ.

SNP 41 duṭṭhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 3

pañc'ime, bhikkhave, ānisaṃsā dhammassavane. katame pañca? assutaṃ suṇāti, sutaṃ pariyodāpeti, kaṅkhaṃ vitarati, diṭṭhiṃ ujuṃ karoti, cittam'assa pasīdati.

atha kho, bhante, so brāhmaṇo tassā māṇavikāya sāratto paṭibaddhacitto āpaṇā makkaṭacchāpakaṃ kiṇitvā ānetvā taṃ māṇavikaṃ etadavoca, ayaṃ te, bhoti, āpaṇā makkaṭacchāpako kiṇitvā ānīto, yo te kumārakassa kīḷāpanako bhavissatī'ti.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, vadhukā yaññad'eva rattiṃ vā divaṃ vā ānītā hoti, tāva'd'ev'assā tibbaṃ hir'ottappaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti sassuyā'pi sasure'pi sāmike'pi antamaso dāsakammakaraporisesu.

Meaning being led (by); being brought (by)

Construction ā + nīya + māna

Sanskrit ānīyamāna
Sanskrit Root √nī 1, 2 (lead)

yam'pi so pāṇo galappaveṭhakena ānīyamāno dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti, iminā dutiyena ṭhānena bahuṃ apuññaṃ pasavati.

MN 55 jīvakasuttaṃ
ānutappa

ptp. regrettable; lamentable; lit. to be regretted [anu + √tapp + *ya] ~

Grammar ptp of anutappati
Meaning regrettable; lamentable; lit. to be regretted
Root Family anu √tapp
Root √tapp･1 a (regret)
Construction anu > ānu + √tapp + *ya
Derivative kicca (*ya)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Variant anutappa
Commentary (ANa) anutappā hotī'ti anutāpakarā hoti. tattha cakkavattirañño kālakiriyā ekacakkavāḷe devamanussānaṃ anutāpakarā hoti. buddhānaṃ kālakiriyā dasasahassacakkavāḷesu devamanussānaṃ anutāpakarā hoti. tena vuttaṃ, bahuno janassa anutappā hotī'ti.
Sanskrit anutapya
Sanskrit Root √trap 1 (be abashed)
ānupubba

nt. order, regular order, succession [pubba] ✗
ānupubbikathā

fem. talk that develops progressively; graduated instruction; systematic talk [ānupubbī + kathā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning talk that develops progressively; graduated instruction; systematic talk
Construction ānupubbī + kathā
Compound kammadhāraya (ānupubbī + kathā)
Variant ānupubbīkathā, anupubbikathā, anupubbiṃ kathaṃ
Commentary (ANa) dānānantaraṃ sīlaṃ, sīlānantaraṃ saggan'ti evaṃ desan'ānupubbiṃ kathaṃ vā, yaṃ yaṃ suttapadaṃ vā gāthāpadaṃ vā nikkhittaṃ hoti, tassa tassa anurūpakathaṃ kathessāmī'ti cittaṃ upaṭṭhapetvā paresaṃ dhammo desetabbo.
Sanskrit anupūrvam + kathā

ānupubbikathaṃ kathessāmī'ti paresaṃ dhammo desetabbo.

AN 5.159 udāyīsuttaṃ
ānupubbī

fem. regular order; progression; succession [anu + pubba + *ī] ✓

Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit ānupūrva

ānupubbikathaṃ kathessāmī'ti paresaṃ dhammo desetabbo.

AN 5.159 udāyīsuttaṃ
ānupubbīkathā

fem. talk that develops progressively; graduated instruction; systematic talk [ānupubbī + kathā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning talk that develops progressively; graduated instruction; systematic talk
Construction ānupubbī + kathā
Compound kammadhāraya (ānupubbī + kathā)
Variant ānupubbikathā, anupubbikathā, anupubbiṃ kathaṃ
Commentary (ANa) dānānantaraṃ sīlaṃ, sīlānantaraṃ saggan'ti evaṃ desan'ānupubbiṃ kathaṃ vā, yaṃ yaṃ suttapadaṃ vā gāthāpadaṃ vā nikkhittaṃ hoti, tassa tassa anurūpakathaṃ kathessāmī'ti cittaṃ upaṭṭhapetvā paresaṃ dhammo desetabbo.
Sanskrit anupūrvam + kathā

atha kho bhagavā upālissa gahapatissa ānupubbīkathaṃ kathesi, seyyath'idaṃ, dānakathaṃ sīlakathaṃ saggakathaṃ, kāmānaṃ ādīnavaṃ okāraṃ saṃkilesaṃ, nekkhamme ānisaṃsaṃ pakāsesi.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ

ū > āv

MN 106 āneñjasappāyasuttaṃ

so evaṃ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigat'ūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte pubbenivās'ānussatiñāṇāya cittaṃ abhininnāmeti

āneñja 2

adj. static, imperturbable [√iñj] ✗

atītayobbano poso,
āneti timbarutthaniṃ,
tassā issā na supati,
taṃ parābhavato mukhaṃ.

sīghaṃ dāruādīni āharathā'ti gahapatike vatvā gāmamajjhe vuttapakāraṃ gehaṃ kārāpetvā gāmasatato paṇṇākāraṃ āharāpetvā janapadaseṭṭhino santikā dhītaraṃ ānetvā maṅgalaṃ katvā seṭṭhissa sāsanaṃ pahiṇi, idañ'c'idañ'ca mayā katan'ti.

tassa saṃvarāya paṭipajjatha, rakkhatha cakkhu'ndriyaṃ, cakkhu'ndriye saṃvaraṃ āpajjatha.

VIN PAT PC 79 kammappaṭibāhanasikkhāpadaṃ

yo pana bhikkhu nimantito sabhatto samāno santaṃ bhikkhuṃ anāpucchā purebhattaṃ vā pacchābhattaṃ vā kulesu cārittaṃ āpajjeyya aññatra samayā, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 46 cārittasikkhāpadaṃ

Sanskrit āpadyate
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

maraṇañ'h'etaṃ, sunakkhatta, ariyassa vinaye yo sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya hīnāy'āvattati, maraṇamattañ'h'etaṃ, sunakkhatta, dukkhaṃ yaṃ aññataraṃ saṃkiliṭṭhaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ

maraṇamattañ'h'etaṃ, bhikkhave, dukkhaṃ yadidaṃ aññataraṃ saṃkiliṭṭhaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati. yathārūpāya āpattiyā vuṭṭhānaṃ paññāyati.

SN 20.10 biḷārasuttaṃ
āpajjati 5

pr. (+acc) causes; effects [ā + √pad + ya + ti] ✓

Meaning causes; effects

Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)

Construction ā + pajja + ti
Phonetic Change dy > jj
Antonym nāpajjati
Commentary (VIN 1.4.1.8) cīvare vikappaṃ āpajjeyyā'ti āyataṃ vā hotu vitthataṃ vā appitaṃ vā saṇhaṃ vā.
Sanskrit āpadyate
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

tatra ce so bhikkhu pubbe appavārito upasaṅkamitvā cīvare vikappaṃ āpajjeyya, sādhu vata maṃ āyasmā iminā cīvaracetāpannena evarūpaṃ vā evarūpaṃ vā cīvaraṃ cetāpetvā acchādehī'ti

atha kho vassakāro brāhmaṇo magadhamahāmatto anattamano ahosi, kathañ'hi nāma devo devagahadārūni nagarapaṭisaṅkhārikāni āpad'atthāya nikkhittāni dhaniyassa kumbhakāraputtassa dassatī'ti!

āpadāsu kho, mahārāja, thāmo veditabbo. so ca kho dīghena addhunā na ittaraṃ, manasikarotā no amanasikarotā, paññavatā no duppaññena

SN 3.11 sattajaṭilasuttaṃ

anāpatti asañcicca, assatiyā, ajānantassa, gilānassa, āpadāsu, ummattakassa, ādikammikassā'ti.

VIN 2.7.1 parimaṇḍalavaggo
āpanna 1

pp. (+acc) fallen into; entered into; met with [ā + √pad + na] ✓

Grammar pp of āpajjati (+acc)
Meaning fallen into; entered into; met with
Root Family ā √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Construction ā + √pad + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change d > n
Sanskrit āpanna
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

kicchaṃ vat'āyaṃ loko āpanno, jāyati ca jīyati ca mīyati ca cavati ca upapajjati ca, atha ca panimassa dukkhassa nissaraṇaṃ nappajānāti jarāmaraṇassa.

DN 14.11 mahāpadānasuttaṃ

kicchaṃ vat'āyaṃ satto āpanno, app'eva nāma imamhā dukkhā mucceyyā'ti karuṇā pavattetabbā.

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā

idha cunda ekacco pāṇ'ātipātaṃ pahāya pāṇ'ātipātā paṭivirato hoti nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho lajjī dayā-āpanno sabbapāṇabhūtahit'ānukampī viharati

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ
āpanna 3

Meaning (of an offence) committed; fallen into
Root Family ā √pad
Root √pad･3 ya (go, step)
Construction ā + √pad + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change d > n
Sanskrit āpanna
Sanskrit Root √pad 4 (go)

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhikkhuṃ āpattiyā codenti. so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi āpattiyā codiyamāno codakass'eva paccāropeti, tvaṃ kho'si itthan'nāmaṃ āpattiṃ āpanno, tvaṃ tāva paṭhamaṃ paṭikarohī'ti.

AN 8.14 assakhaḷuṅkasuttaṃ

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhikkhuṃ āpattiyā codenti. so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi āpattiyā codiyamāno codakass'eva paccāropeti, tvaṃ kho'si itthan'nāmaṃ āpattiṃ āpanno, tvaṃ tāva paṭhamaṃ paṭikarohī'ti.

VIN PAT PA 4 uttarimanussadhammasikkhāpadaṃ
āpannasattā

fem. pregnant woman ✗
āpannomhi

sandhi. I committed (an offence); I did it [āpanno + amhi] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pp + pr
Meaning I committed (an offence); I did it
Construction āpanno + amhi
Sanskrit āpanna + asmi

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhikkhuṃ āpattiyā codenti. so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi āpattiyā codiyamāno, n'ev'āhaṃ āpanno'mhi, na pan'āhaṃ āpanno'mhī'ti so tuṇhībhāvena saṅghaṃ viheṭheti.

ye pana, bhikkhu, tayā pubbe samaṇabrāhmaṇā lokasmiṃ pathavīpasaṃsakā pathav'ābhinandino, āpapasaṃsakā āp'ābhinandino, tejapasaṃsakā tej'ābhinandino, vāyapasaṃsakā vāy'ābhinandino ... te kāyassa bhedā pāṇupacchedā paṇīte kāye patiṭṭhitā.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
āpas

masc. water; liquid [√āp + as] ✓

Grammar masc, mano group
Meaning water; liquid
Root Family √āp
Root √āp×4 uṇā (be wet)
Construction √āp + as
Derivative kita (as)
Notes āpo in comps
Sanskrit āpas
Sanskrit Root ap - (water)

kattha āpo ca pathavī,
tejo vāyo na gādhati,
kattha dīghañ'ca rassañ'ca,
aṇuṃ thūlaṃ subh'āsubhaṃ,
kattha nāmañ'ca rūpañ'ca,
asesaṃ uparujjhatī'ti?

DN 16.11 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ

yaṃ ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ āpo āpogataṃ upādinnaṃ … yaṃ vā pan'aññam'pi kiñci ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ āpo āpogataṃ upādinnaṃ, ayaṃ vuccati, rāhula, ajjhattikā āpodhātu.

evaṃ sammā vimuttacittassa, bhante, bhikkhuno bhusā ce'pi cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā cakkhussa āpāthaṃ āgacchanti, n'ev'assa cittaṃ pariyādiyanti.

AN 6.55 soṇasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, cakkhumā puriso āpāthagatānaṃ rūpānaṃ adassanakāmo assa, so nimīleyya vā aññena vā apalokeyya.

āpucchati

pr. (+acc and +acc) asks (about); asks permission [ā + √pucch + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, ditrans (+acc and +acc)

Root Family ā √pucch

Base √pucch + a > puccha
Construction ā + puccha + ti
Sanskrit āpṛcchate
Sanskrit Root √prach 6 (ask)

na ca me hiṃsati kiñci,
na ca'haṃ isidāsiyā saha vacchaṃ,
dessāva me alaṃ me,
āpucch'āhaṃ gamissāmi.

THI 72 isidāsītherīgāthā

dukkhassa ve maṃ pabhavaṃ apucchasi,
taṃ te pavakkhāmi yathā pajānaṃ,
upadhinidānā pabhavanti dukkhā,
ye keci lokasmim'anekarūpā.

SNP 59 mettagū māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 4
āpucchā

abs. (+acc and +acc) having asked permission; having taken leave; having informed [ā + √pucch + tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of āpucchati, irreg, ditrans (+acc and +acc)
Meaning having asked permission; having taken leave; having informed
Root Family ā √pucch
Root √pucch･1 a (ask, question)
Construction ā + √pucch + tvā > pucchā
Phonetic Change tvā > ā (contraction)
Antonym anāpucchā
Notes see SDM 17 laddhā'ti labhitvā. laddhānā'ti labhitvāna. diṭṭhā'ti disvā
Sanskrit āpṛcchya, āpṛṣṭvā
Sanskrit Root √prach 6 (ask)

santaṃ nāma bhikkhuṃ sakkā hoti āpucchā pavisituṃ. asantaṃ nāma bhikkhuṃ na sakkā hoti āpucchā pavisituṃ.

VIN 2.5.5.6 cārittasikkhāpadaṃ

tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā saṅkhā'pi so puggalo āpucchā pakkamitabbaṃ, n'ānubandhitabbo.

JAa 542 umaṅga jātakavaṇṇanā

bhante, idaṃ udakaṃ dārakassa sīse āsiñcāmā'ti āpucchitvā, tena hi āsiñcathā'ti vutte tathā akāsi. sā devatā tāva'd'eva taṃ muñcitvā gantvā leṇadvāre aṭṭhāsi.

āpūrati

AN 10.26 kāḷīsuttaṃ
āpokāya

masc. mass of water; lit. water body [āpo + kāya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning mass of water; lit. water body
Construction āpo + kāya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (āpaso + kāya)
Commentary (MNa) pathavīkāyo'tiādīsu pathavī'y'eva pathavīkāyo, pathavīsamūho vā.
Sanskrit āpas + kāya

katame satta? pathavīkāyo āpokāyo tejokāyo vāyokāyo sukhe dukkhe jīve sattame, ime sattakāyā akaṭā akaṭavidhā animmitā animmātā vañjhā kūṭaṭṭhā esikaṭṭhāyiṭṭhitā.

MN 76 sandakasuttaṃ
āpogata

adj. watery; liquid; lit. water state [āpo + gata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning watery; liquid; lit. water state
Construction āpo + gata
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (āpaṃ + gata)
Sanskrit āpas + gata

yaṃ ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ āpo āpogataṃ upādinnaṃ … yaṃ vā pan'aññam'pi kiñci ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ āpo āpogataṃ upādinnaṃ, ayaṃ vuccati, rāhula, ajjhattikā āpodhātu.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ
āpodhātu 1

fem. liquids; liquid state; lit. water state [āpo + dhātu] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning liquids; liquid state; lit. water state
Construction āpo + dhātu
Compound kammadhāraya (āpo + dhātu)
Commentary (DNa) āpodhātū'ti ābandhanadhātu.
Sanskrit āpas + dhātu

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu imam'eva kāyaṃ yathāṭhitaṃ yathāpaṇihitaṃ dhātuso paccavekkhati atthi imasmiṃ kāye pathavīdhātu āpodhātu tejodhātu vāyodhātū'ti

DN 22.6 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

yaṃ ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ āpo āpogataṃ upādinnaṃ … yaṃ vā pan'aññam'pi kiñci ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ āpo āpogataṃ upādinnaṃ, ayaṃ vuccati, rāhula, ajjhattikā āpodhātu.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ
āpodhātu 2

fem. liquid; moisture; lit. water state [āpo + dhātu] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning liquid; moisture; lit. water state
Construction āpo + dhātu
Compound kammadhāraya (āpo + dhātu)
Commentary (SNa) āpo'ti uparisnehanaāpo.
Sanskrit āpas + dhātu

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, pathavīdhātu, evaṃ catasso viññāṇaṭṭhitiyo daṭṭhabbā. seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, āpodhātu, evaṃ nandirāgo daṭṭhabbo. seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, pañca bījajātāni, evaṃ viññāṇaṃ s'āhāraṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ.

SN 22.54 bījasuttaṃ
āporasa

masc. nutrients in the water [āpo + rasa] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning nutrients in the water
Construction āpo + rasa
Commentary (VISMa) rukkhagacchalat'ādīnaṃ paccayabhūto sasambhārapathaviyā raso pathavīraso. āporase'pi es'eva nayo.
āposaññā

fem. (+loc) recognition of water (in); perception of liquid (in) [āpo + saññā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp (+loc)
Meaning recognition of water (in); perception of liquid (in)
Construction āpo + saññā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (āpaso + saññā)
Sanskrit āpas + saṃjñā

idha, sandha, bhadrassa puris'ājānīyassa pathaviyaṃ pathavisaññā vibhūtā hoti, āpasmiṃ āposaññā vibhūtā hoti, tejasmiṃ tejosaññā vibhūtā hoti, vāyasmiṃ vāyosaññā vibhūtā hoti

AN 11.9 saddhasuttaṃ
āposaññī

adj. (+loc) aware of water (in); percipient of liquid (in) [āpo + saññī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning aware of water (in); percipient of liquid (in)
Construction āpo + saññī
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (āpaso + saññī)
Sanskrit āpas + saṃjñin

siyā nu kho, bhante, bhikkhuno tathārūpo samādhipaṭilābho yathā n'eva pathaviyaṃ pathavisaññī assa, na āpasmiṃ āposaññī assa, na tejasmiṃ tejosaññī assa, na vāyasmiṃ vāyosaññī assa, na ākāsānañc'āyatane ākāsānañc'āyatanasaññī assa

AN 10.6 samādhisuttaṃ
āposama

adj. like water [āpo + sama] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like water
Construction āpo + sama
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (āpasā + sama)
Sanskrit āpas + sama

āposamaṃ, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvehi. āposamañ'hi te, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvayato uppannā manāp'āmanāpā phassā cittaṃ na pariyādāya ṭhassanti.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhante, āpasmiṃ sucim'pi ... dhovanti, na ca tena āpo aṭṭīyati vā harāyati vā jigucchati vā. evam'evaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, āposamena cetasā viharāmi vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena.

AN 9.11 sīhanādasuttaṃ
ābādha

masc. disease; sickness; illness; affliction [ā + √bādh + a] ✓

Grammar masc, abstr
Meaning disease; sickness; illness; affliction
Root Family ā √bādh
Root √bādh･1 a (press, oppress)
Construction ā + √bādh + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit ābādha
Sanskrit Root √bādh 1 (oppress)

so aparena samayena tamhā ābādhā mucceyya

DN 2.19 sāmaññaphalasuttaṃ

saṅkhārā ca h'idaṃ, bhikkhave, attā abhavissaṃsu, na'y'idaṃ saṅkhārā ābādhāya saṃvatteyyuṃ, labbhetha ca saṅkhāresu, evaṃ me saṅkhārā hontu, evaṃ me saṅkhārā mā ahesun'ti.

SN 22.59 anattalakkhaṇasuttaṃ
ābādhati

pr. (+acc) afflicts; troubles; oppresses [ā + √bādh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning afflicts; troubles; oppresses
Root Family ā √bādh
Root √bādh･1 a (press, oppress)
Base √bādh + a > bādha
Construction ā + bādha + ti
Sanskrit ābādhate
Sanskrit Root √bādh 1 (oppress)

evaṃ vutte, māgaṇḍiyo paribbājako sakān'eva sudaṃ gattāni pāṇinā anomajjati, idan'taṃ, bho gotama, ārogyaṃ, idan'taṃ nibbānaṃ. ahañ'hi, bho gotama, etarahi arogo sukhī, na maṃ kiñci ābādhatī'ti.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
ābādhato

ind. as disease; as sickness; as illness; as affliction; as oppressive [ā + √bādh + a + to] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, abl sg of ābādha
Meaning as disease; as sickness; as illness; as affliction; as oppressive
Root Family ā √bādh
Root √bādh･1 a (press, oppress)
Construction ā + √bādh + a + to
ābādha + to
Derivative taddhita (to)
Commentary (MNa) rog'aṭṭhena ābādhato (ANa) ābādhan'aṭṭhena ābādhato
Sanskrit ābādhāt
Sanskrit Root √bādh 1 (oppress)

so yadeva tattha hoti rūpagataṃ vedanāgataṃ saññāgataṃ saṅkhāragataṃ viññāṇagataṃ, te dhamme aniccato dukkhato rogato gaṇḍato sallato aghato ābādhato parato palokato suññato anattato samanupassati.

Meaning due to illness; because of sickness
Construction ābādha + paccayā

ābādhabhūta

adj. like a disease; like an affliction; lit. become oppression [ābādha + bhūta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like a disease; like an affliction; lit. become oppression
Construction ābādha + bhūta

Commentary (MNa) rogo'va bhūto'ti rogabhūto. sesapadesu'pi es'eva nayo.
Sanskrit ābādha + bhūta

ayaṃ kho pana, māgaṇḍiya, kāyo rogabhūto gaṇḍabhūto sallabhūto aghabhūto ābādhabhūto, so tvaṃ imaṃ kāyaṃ rogabhūtaṃ gaṇḍabhūtaṃ sallabhūtaṃ aghabhūtaṃ ābādhabhūtaṃ, idan'taṃ, bho gotama, ārogyaṃ, idan'taṃ nibbānan'ti vadesi.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
ābādhayati

pr. (+acc) oppresses; afflicts [√bādh] ✗
ābādhayi

Construction ā + bādhaya + i
Sanskrit ābādh
Sanskrit Root √bādh 1 (oppress)
ābādhika

adj. sick; ill; lit. oppressed [ā + √bādh + a + ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from ābādha
Meaning sick; ill; lit. oppressed
Root Family ā √bādh
Root √bādh･1 a (press, oppress)
Construction ā + √bādh + a + ika
ābādha + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Synonym akallaka
Commentary (DNa) ābādhikan'ti iriyāpathabhañjanakena visabhāgabādhena ābādhikaṃ. (MNa) visabhāgavedan'uppattiyā kakacen'eva catuiriyāpathaṃ chindanto ābādhatī'ti ābādho, sv'āssa atthī'ti ābādhiko.
Sanskrit ābādha + ika
Sanskrit Root √bādh 1 (oppress)

ahaṃ kho pubbe ābādhiko ahosiṃ dukkhito bāḷhagilāno, bhattañ'ca me nacchādesi, na ca me āsi kāye balamattā

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

ambho purisa, na tvaṃ addasa manussesu itthiṃ vā purisaṃ vā ābādhikaṃ dukkhitaṃ bāḷhagilānaṃ, sake muttakarīse palipannaṃ semānaṃ, aññehi vuṭṭhāpiyamānaṃ, aññehi saṃvesiyamānan'ti?

AN 3.36 devadūtasuttaṃ
ābādhikinī

ābādhika + inī

Sanskrit ābādha + ika
Sanskrit Root √bādh 1 (oppress)

ehi tvaṃ, ambho purisa, yen'ayyo ānando ten'upasaṅkama, upasaṅkamitvā mama vacanena ayyassa ānandassa pāde sirasā vanda, itthan'nāmā, bhante, bhikkhunī ābādhikinī dukkhitā bāḷhagilānā.

ābādhita

pp. afflicted, oppressed [ā + √bādh] ✗
ābādheti

ābha

adj. radiant; lustrous; luminous; epithet of a class of devas; lit. having light [ā + √bhā + ā + a] ✓

ābhā + a

Commentary (MNa) ābhānaṃ devānan'ti ābhā nāma visuṃ n'atthi, paritt'ābhāppamāṇābhā-abhassarānam'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
Sanskrit ābha
Sanskrit Root √bhā 2 (shine)

ākaṅkheyya ce, gahapatayo, dhammacārī samacārī, aho vat'āhaṃ kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā ābhānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjeyyan'ti, ṭhānaṃ kho pan'etaṃ vijjati, yaṃ so kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā ābhānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjeyya.

MN 41 sāleyyakasuttaṃ
ābhata

pp. (+abl) brought (from); carried here (from) [ā + √bhar + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of ābharati (+abl)
Meaning brought (from); carried here (from)

Root √bhar･1 a (carry, support)

Phonetic Change rt > t
Commentary (VINa) ābhatan'ti ānītaṃ.
Sanskrit ābhṛta
Sanskrit Root √bhṛ 1 (bear)

seyyathā'pi, āvuso, kaṃsapāti ābhatā āpaṇā vā kammārakulā vā rajena ca malena ca pariyonaddhā. tam'enaṃ sāmikā na c'eva paribhuñjeyyuṃ na ca pariyodapeyyuṃ, rajāpathe ca naṃ nikkhipeyyuṃ.

MN 5 anaṅgaṇasuttaṃ

so ce dūto taṃ bhikkhuṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeyya, idaṃ kho, bhante, āyasmantaṃ uddissa cīvaracetāpannaṃ ābhataṃ, paṭiggaṇhātu āyasmā cīvaracetāpannan'ti.

VIN PAT NP 10 rājasikkhāpadaṃ
ābharaṇa

nt. jewellery; adornment; finery; lit. wearing [ā + √bhar + aṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, from ābharati
Meaning jewellery; adornment; finery; lit. wearing

Sanskrit ābharaṇa
Sanskrit Root √bhṛ 1 (bear)

vicittavatth'ābharaṇā,
āmuttamaṇikuṇḍalā,
kusalā naccagītassa,
sakkassa paricārikā.

JA 545 tittha jātakaṃ

kāsikasukhumāni dhāraya,
abhiropehi ca mālavaṇṇakaṃ,
kañcanamaṇimuttakaṃ bahuṃ,
vividhaṃ ābharaṇaṃ karomi te.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
ābhassara

adj. radiant; shining; belonging to the radiant heaven; epithet of a class of devas [ā + √bhās + ara] ✓

Grammar adj, from ābhāsati
Meaning radiant; shining; belonging to the radiant heaven; epithet of a class of devas
Root Family ā √bhās
Root √bhās･1 a (shine)
Construction ā + √bhās > bhass + ara
Derivative kita (ara)
Phonetic Change ās > ass
Commentary (DNa) ābhassarā'ti daṇḍaukkāya acci viya etesaṃ sarīrato ābhā chijjitvā chijjitvā patantī viya sarati vissaratī'ti ābhassarā.
Sanskrit ābhāsvara
Sanskrit Root √bhās 1 (shine)

susukhaṃ vata jīvāma,
yesaṃ no n'atthi kiñcanaṃ,
pītibhakkhā bhavissāma,
devā ābhassarā yathā.

DHP 200 sukhavaggo

ākaṅkheyya ce, gahapatayo, dhammacārī samacārī, aho vat'āhaṃ kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā ābhassarānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjeyyan'ti, ṭhānaṃ kho pan'etaṃ vijjati, yaṃ so kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā ābhassarānaṃ devānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjeyya.

ābhassara + ā
Phonetic Change ās > ass
Commentary (DNa) paṇītaṃ bhāvetvā upapannā ābhassarā nāma honti, tesaṃ aṭṭha kappā āyuppamāṇaṃ.
Sanskrit ābhāsvara
Sanskrit Root √bhās 1 (shine)

ābhassare ābhassarato sañjānāti, ābhassare ābhassarato saññatvā ābhassare maññati, ābhassaresu maññati, ābhassarato maññati, ābhassare me'ti maññati, ābhassare abhinandati. taṃ kissa hetu? apariññātaṃ tassā'ti vadāmi.

MN 1 mūlapariyāyasuttaṃ

atthi kho, brahme, añño kāyo, taṃ tvaṃ na jānāsi na passasi, tam'ahaṃ jānāmi passāmi. atthi kho, brahme, ābhassarā nāma kāyo yato tvaṃ cuto idh'ūpapanno.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
ābhassarūpaga

adj. living in the radiant; experiencing the shining [ābhassara + upaga] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning living in the radiant; experiencing the shining
Construction ābhassara + upaga
Compound kammadhāraya (ābhassara + upaga)
Commentary (ITIa) ābhassar'ūpago'ti tattha paṭisandhiggahaṇavasena ābhassarabrahmalokaṃ upagacchāmī'ti ābhassar'ūpago homi.
Sanskrit ābhāsvara + upaga

satta vassāni mettaṃ cittaṃ bhāvesiṃ. satta vassāni mettaṃ cittaṃ bhāvetvā satta saṃvaṭṭavivaṭṭakappe na'y'imaṃ lokaṃ punāgamāsiṃ. saṃvaṭṭamāne sud'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, loke ābhassar'ūpago homi, vivaṭṭamāne loke suññaṃ brahmavimānaṃ upapajjāmi.

AN 7.62 mettasuttaṃ
ābhā

fem. radiance; lustre; luminosity [ā + √bhā + ā] ✓

Meaning radiance; lustre; luminosity

Root √bhā･1 a (shine, speak)

Commentary (MNa) ābhā ... āloko nāma
Sanskrit ābhā
Sanskrit Root √bhā 2 (shine)

seyyathā'pi, āvuso, telappadīpassa jhāyato acciṃ paṭicca ābhā paññāyati, ābhaṃ paṭicca acci paññāyati, evam'eva kho, āvuso, āyu usmaṃ paṭicca tiṭṭhati, usmā āyuṃ paṭicca tiṭṭhatī'ti.

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ

atthi, bhikkhave, lok'antarikā aghā asaṃvutā andhakārā andhakāratimisā, yattham'imesaṃ candimasūriyānaṃ evaṃmah'iddhikānaṃ evaṃ mah'ānubhāvānaṃ ābhāya n'ānubhontī'ti.

SN 56.46 andhakārasuttaṃ
ābhāti

pr. shines; radiates; glows [ā + √bhā + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning shines; radiates; glows
Root Family ā √bhā
Root √bhā･1 a (shine, speak)
Base √bhā + a > bhā
Construction ā + bhā + ti
Sanskrit ābhāti
Sanskrit Root √bhā 2 (shine)

divā tapati ādicco,
rattim'ābhāti candimā,
sannaddho khattiyo tapati,
jhāyī tapati brāhmaṇo,
atha sabbam'ahorattiṃ,
buddho tapati tejasā.

DHP 387 brāhmaṇavaggo

cattāro loke pajjotā,
pañcam'ettha na vijjati,
divā tapati ādicco,
rattim'ābhāti candimā.

SN 1.26 pajjotasuttaṃ
ābhādhātu

ābhāvagga

masc. Chapter 15 of Catukkanipāta, Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.141-150 ✗
ābhāsati

pr. shines; radiates [ā + √bhās] ✗
ābhāsutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.141 (AN4.141) ✗
ābhicetasika

masc. higher state of consciousness; higher state of mind [abhi + √cit + *as + *ika] ✓

Grammar masc, from abhicetas
Meaning higher state of consciousness; higher state of mind
Root Family abhi √cit
Root √cit･8 *aya (think, intend)
Construction abhi > ābhi + √cit > cet + *as + *ika
abhicetas + *ika
Derivative taddhita (*ika)
Phonetic Change a > ā
i > e
Variant abhicetasika
Commentary (MNa) ābhicetasikānan'ti abhiceto'ti abhikkantaṃ visuddhacittaṃ vuccati, adhicittaṃ vā, abhicetasi jātāni ābhicetasikāni, abhiceto sannissitānī'ti vā ābhicetasikāni.
Sanskrit adhicittaśikṣā
Sanskrit Root √cit √cint 1, 2, 3 (perceive, know, appear)

imesañ'ca catunnaṃ jhānānaṃ ābhicetasikānaṃ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṃ nikāmalābhī bhavissasi akicchalābhī akasiralābhī

AN 8.30 anuruddha mahāvitakkasuttaṃ

yato ca kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu … catunnañ'ca jhānānaṃ ābhicetasikānaṃ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṃ nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī ... evaṃ so ten'aṅgena paripūro hoti.

tena kho pana samayena āyasmā cūḷapanthako bhagavato avidūre nisinno hoti pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā.

UD 50 cūḷapanthakasuttaṃ

ayya sumedhatāpasa, porāṇakabodhisattānaṃ pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā, pāramiyo vicinissāmā'ti nisinnakāle yāni pubbanimittāni nāma paññāyanti, tāni sabbāni'pi ajja pātubhūtāni

JAa 1.N.1 sumedha kathā
ābhoga

masc. ideation, thought, concern ✗
āma 1

ind. yes; certainly ✓

Grammar ind, excl
Meaning yes; certainly
Sanskrit āma

tena vattabbo, passasī'ti. āma passāmī'ti. āyatiṃ saṃvareyyāsī'ti

VIN 4.4.125 āpattipaṭikamma vidhi

iti puṭṭho, no'ti vadeyya. tam'enaṃ evaṃ vadeyyuṃ, ambho purisa, yaṃ tvaṃ na jānāsi na passasi, tassa tvaṃ pāsādassa ārohaṇāya nisseṇiṃ karosī'ti? iti puṭṭho, āmā'ti vadeyya.

adj. raw; uncooked; undigested ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning raw; uncooked; undigested

bhagavā etadavoca, dhammadāy'ādā me, bhikkhave, bhavatha, mā āmisadāy'ādā

MN 3 dhammadāyādasuttaṃ

tattha katamāni cha gehasitāni somanassāni? cakkhuviññeyyānaṃ rūpānaṃ iṭṭhānaṃ kantānaṃ manāpānaṃ manoramānaṃ loka-āmisapaṭisaṃyuttānaṃ paṭilābhaṃ vā paṭilābhato samanupassato

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
āmisa 2

nt. worldly gain; profit; material benefit [āma + isa] ✓

Grammar nt, from āma
Meaning worldly gain; profit; material benefit
Construction āma + isa
Derivative taddhita (isa)
Antonym nirāmisa
Sanskrit āmiṣa

yo pana bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya, āmisahetu therā bhikkhū bhikkhuniyo ovadantī'ti, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 24 āmisasikkhāpadaṃ
āmisa 3

nt. worldly thing; physical item; material stuff [āma + isa] ✓

Grammar nt, from āma
Meaning worldly thing; physical item; material stuff
Construction āma + isa
Derivative taddhita (isa)
Antonym nirāmisa, dhamma
Sanskrit āmiṣa

āmisasambhogo nāma āmisaṃ deti vā paṭiggaṇhāti vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.7.9 ukkhittasambhogasikkhāpadaṃ

dve'me, bhikkhave, saṃvibhāgā āmisasaṃvibhāgo ca dhammasaṃvibhāgo ca. etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ saṃvibhāgānaṃ yadidaṃ dhammasaṃvibhāgo.

ITI 100 brāhmaṇadhammayāgasuttaṃ
āmisa 4

nt. meat; bait [āma + isa] ✓

Grammar nt, from āma
Meaning meat; bait
Construction āma + isa
Derivative taddhita (isa)
Antonym nirāmisa
Commentary (SNa) āmisaṃ'va macchānaṃ vadhāya khittā'ti yathā macchānaṃ vadhatthāya baḷisalaggaṃ āmisaṃ khipati, evaṃ tayā pasaṃsamānena ete rūpā sattānaṃ vadhāya khittā'ti vadati.
Sanskrit āmiṣa

ye keci rūpā idha vā huraṃ vā,
ye c'antalikkhasmiṃ pabhāsavaṇṇā,
sabb'eva te te namucippasatthā,
āmisaṃ'va macchānaṃ vadhāya khittā'ti.

SN 2.30 nānātitthiyasāvakasuttaṃ

Meaning food
Construction āma + isa
Derivative taddhita (isa)
Sanskrit āmiṣa
āmisakiñcikkhahetu

ind. for the sake of some small worldly benefit [āmisa + kiñcikkha + hetu] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning for the sake of some small worldly benefit
Construction āmisa + kiñcikkha + hetu
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (āmisakiñcikkhassa + hetu)
Commentary (ANa) āmisakiñcikkhahetu vā'ti ettha āmisan'ti lañjo adhippeto. kiñcikkhan'ti yaṃ vā taṃ vā appamattakaṃ antamaso tittiriya-vaṭṭaka-sappi-piṇḍa-navanīta-piṇḍ'ādi-mattakassa lañjassa hetū'ti attho.
Sanskrit āmiṣa + kiṃcid + ka + hetu

iti attahetu vā parahetu vā āmisakiñcikkhahetu vā sampajānamusā bhāsitā hoti. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, puggalo gūthabhāṇī.

āmisakhāra

Meaning baited; lit. gone into meat

Meaning one of the material things
Construction āmisa + aññatara
Compound kammadhāraya (āmisa + aññatara)
Commentary (MNa) āmis'aññataran'ti catunnaṃ paccay'āmisānaṃ aññataraṃ, ekan'ti attho.
Sanskrit āmiṣa + anyatara

āmis'aññataraṃ kho pan'etaṃ, yadidaṃ piṇḍapāto. yaṃnūn'āhaṃ imaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ abhuñjitvā iminā'va jighacchādubbalyena evaṃ imaṃ rattin'divaṃ vītināmeyyan'ti.

Sanskrit āyata
Sanskrit Root √yā 2 (go)

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, imasmiṃ dhammavinaye anupubbasikkhā anupubbakiriyā anupubbapaṭipadā, na āyataken'eva aññāpaṭivedho

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ
āyataka 2.1

adj. long; prolonged; drawn out; lit. stretched [ā + √yat + a + ka] ~

Grammar adj, from āyata
Meaning long; prolonged; drawn out; lit. stretched
Root Family ā √yat
Root √yat･1 a (stretch, strive)
Construction ā + √yat + a + ka
āyata + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Commentary (ANa) āyatakenā'ti dīghena, paripuṇṇapadabyañjanakaṃ gāthāvattañ'ca vināsetvā pavattena.
Sanskrit āyata
Sanskrit Root √yat 1, 10 (stretch)
āyatakena

ind. suddenly; quickly; abruptly; immediately [ā + √yā + ta + ka + ena] ~

Grammar ind, adv, instr of āyataka
Meaning suddenly; quickly; abruptly; immediately
Root Family ā √yā
Root √yā･1 a (go)
Construction ā + √yā + ta + ka + ena
āyataka + ena
Sanskrit āyatam
Sanskrit Root √yā 2 (go)
āyatagga 1.1

adj. vast and great; extensive and best [āyata + agga] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning vast and great; extensive and best
Construction āyata + agga
Compound kammadhāraya (āyata + agga)
Commentary (ITIa) āyat'aggan'ti vipulaphalatāya uḷāraphalatāya āyat'aggaṃ
Notes see āyatagga 2, 3
Sanskrit āyata + agra

puññam'eva so sikkheyya,
āyat'aggaṃ sukh'udrayaṃ,
dānañ'ca samacariyañ'ca,
mettacittañ'ca bhāvaye.

ITI 22 mettasuttaṃ
āyatagga 2.1

adj. with great future [āyati + agga] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with great future
Construction āyati + agga
Compound kammadhāraya (āyati + agga)
Commentary (ITIa) āyat'aggan'ti piyamanāpaphalatāya vā āyatiṃ uttaman'ti āyat'aggaṃ
Notes see āyatagga 1, 3
Sanskrit āyati + agra

puññam'eva so sikkheyya,
āyat'aggaṃ sukh'udrayaṃ,
dānañ'ca samacariyañ'ca,
mettacittañ'ca bhāvaye.

āyatagga 3.1

adj. with the highest income; having the greatest profit [āya + agga] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with the highest income; having the greatest profit
Construction āya + [t] + agga
Phonetic Change +t
Compound kammadhāraya (āya + agga)
Commentary (ITIa) āyat'aggan'ti ... āyena vā yonisomanasikār'ādippaccayena uḷāratamena aggan'ti āya't'aggaṃ. takāro padasandhikaro.

Sanskrit āya + agra

puññam'eva so sikkheyya,
āya't'aggaṃ sukh'udrayaṃ,
dānañ'ca samacariyañ'ca,
mettacittañ'ca bhāvaye.

ITI 22 mettasuttaṃ
āyatati

pr. ranges over [ā + √yat] ✗
āyatana 1

nt. sense base; internal sense organ; lit. stretching out [ā + √yat + ana] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning sense base; internal sense organ; lit. stretching out
Root Family ā √yat
Root √yat･1 a (stretch, strive)
Construction ā + √yat + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Commentary (SNa) se āyatane veditabbe, taṃ kāraṇaṃ jānitabban'ti attho.
Notes see SCPN §10 (Eastern Forms)
Sanskrit āyatana
Sanskrit Root √yat 1, 10 (stretch)

kathañ'ca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammesu dhamm'ānupassī viharati chasu ajjhattikabāhiresu āyatanesu?

DN 22.12 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

evaṃ vutte aññataro bhikkhu there bhikkhū etadavoca, cha kho, āvuso, ajjhattikāni āyatanāni eko anto, cha bāhirāni āyatanāni dutiyo anto, viññāṇaṃ majjhe, taṇhā sibbinī.

AN 6.61 majjhesuttaṃ
āyatana 3

nt. realm; sphere; dimension; range; lit. stretching out [ā + √yat + ana] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning realm; sphere; dimension; range; lit. stretching out
Root Family ā √yat
Root √yat･1 a (stretch, strive)
Construction ā + √yat + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Antonym anāyatana
Sanskrit āyatana
Sanskrit Root √yat 1, 10 (stretch)

atthi, bhikkhave, tadāyatanaṃ, yattha n'eva pathavī, na āpo, na tejo, na vāyo, na ākās'ānañc'āyatanaṃ, na viññāṇ'añc'āyatanaṃ, na ākiñcaññ'āyatanaṃ, na n'evasaññān'āsaññ'āyatanaṃ, n'āyaṃ loko, na paraloko, na ubho candimasūriyā.

UD 71 paṭhamanibbānapaṭisaṃyuttasuttaṃ
āyatana 4

Meaning support; basis; grounds; lit. stretching out

Root √yat･1 a (stretch, strive)
Construction ā + √yat + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Commentary (SNa) khettaṃ taṃ na hotī'tiādīsu'pi viruhan'aṭṭhena taṃ khettaṃ na hoti, patiṭṭhān'aṭṭhena vatthu na hoti, paccay'aṭṭhena āyatanaṃ na hoti, kāraṇ'aṭṭhena adhikaraṇaṃ na hoti.
Sanskrit āyatana
Sanskrit Root √yat 1, 10 (stretch)

yassa kassaci ca abhiññāsacchikaraṇīyassa dhammassa cittaṃ abhininnāmeti abhiññāsacchikiriyāya tatra tatr'eva sakkhibhabbataṃ pāpuṇāti sati sati āyatane.

AN 5.23 upakkilesasuttaṃ

vatthu taṃ na hoti yaṃpaccay'āssa taṃ uppajjati ajjhattaṃ sukhadukkhaṃ. āyatanaṃ taṃ na hoti yaṃpaccay'āssa taṃ uppajjati ajjhattaṃ sukhadukkhaṃ.

maggo c'anek'āyatanappavutto,
pucchāmi taṃ gotama bhūripañña,
kismiṃ ṭhito paralokaṃ na bhāye'ti.

SN 22.57 sattaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning arising of the sense fields; coming into being of sense experience
Construction āyatana + uppāda

Commentary (THa) disvā āyatanuppādan'ti cakkh'ādīnaṃ āyatanānaṃ yathāsakapaccayehi khaṇe khaṇe uppādaṃ, tappaṭipakkhato nirodhañ'ca vipassanāpaññāsahitāya maggapaññāya disvā dassanahetu

taṇhakkhay'ādhimuttassa,
asammohañ'ca cetaso,
disvā āyatan'uppādaṃ,
sammā cittaṃ vimuccati.

Sanskrit āyati +
Sanskrit Root √yat 1, 10 (stretch)

khīṇaṃ purāṇaṃ nava n'atthi sambhavaṃ,
virattacitt'āyatike bhavasmiṃ,
te khīṇabījā avirūḷhichandā,
nibbanti dhīrā yath'āyaṃ padīpo,
idam'pi saṅghe ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ,
etena saccena suvatthi hotu.

cūḷavaggo 1

Sanskrit āyus
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

no ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu parisuddhakāyasamācāro hoti parisuddhena kāyasamācārena samannāgato acchiddena appaṭimaṃsena, tassa bhavanti vattāro, iṅgha tāva āyasmā kāyikaṃ sikkhassū'ti, iti'ssa bhavanti vattāro

AN 10.44 kusinārasuttaṃ

ty'āhaṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadāmi, saccaṃ kira tumhe āyasmanto evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, ek'antasukhī attā hoti arogo paraṃ maraṇā'ti?

DN 9.6 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ
āyasa

adj. made of iron; metal [ayas + *a] ✓

Grammar adj, from ayas
Meaning made of iron; metal
Construction ayas > āyas + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit āyasa

na taṃ daḷhaṃ bandhanam'āhu dhīrā,
yadāyasaṃ dārujapabbajañ'ca,
sārattarattā maṇikuṇḍalesu,
puttesu dāresu ca yā apekkhā.

DHP 345 taṇhāvaggo

tena kho pana samayena vajirapāṇi yakkho āyasaṃ vajiraṃ ādāya ādittaṃ sampajjalitaṃ sajotibhūtaṃ saccakassa nigaṇṭhaputtassa uparivehāsaṃ ṭhito hoti, sac'āyaṃ saccako nigaṇṭhaputto bhagavatā yāvatatiyaṃ sahadhammikaṃ pañhaṃ puṭṭho na byākarissati etth'ev'assa sattadhā muddhaṃ phālessāmī'ti.

MN 35 cūḷasaccakasuttaṃ
āyasakya

nt. disgrace; dishonour; ill-repute; infamy [na + yasas + ka + *ya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from na yasas, neg
Meaning disgrace; dishonour; ill-repute; infamy
Construction na > a > ā + yasas + ka + *ya
ayasaka + *ya
Derivative taddhita (*ya)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym yasas
Sanskrit ayaśas

kodhasammadasammatto,
āyasakyaṃ nigacchati,
ñātimittā suhajjā ca,
parivajjanti kodhanaṃ.

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ
āyasampanna

adj. with a (water) inlet; lit. income succeeded [āya + sampanna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with a (water) inlet; lit. income succeeded
Construction āya + sampanna
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (āyena + sampanna)
Antonym apāyasampanna
Commentary (ANa) na āyasampannan'ti na udak'āgamanasampannaṃ.
Sanskrit āya + sampanna

idha, bhikkhave, khettaṃ unnāmaninnāmi ca hoti, pāsāṇasakkharikañ'ca hoti, ūsarañ'ca hoti, na ca gambhīrasitaṃ hoti, na āyasampannaṃ hoti, na apāyasampannaṃ hoti, na mātikāsampannaṃ hoti, na mariyādasampannaṃ hoti.

Sanskrit āyuṣmat
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco bhikkhu gāmagato vā araññagato vā labhati vattāraṃ, ayañ'ca kho āyasmā evaṃkārī evaṃsamācāro asucigāmakaṇṭako'ti.

Construction ā + √i > ay + *as + mant + ā
āyas + mā
Phonetic Change i > ay
Sanskrit āyuṣmān
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

no ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu parisuddhakāyasamācāro hoti parisuddhena kāyasamācārena samannāgato acchiddena appaṭimaṃsena, tassa bhavanti vattāro, iṅgha tāva āyasmā kāyikaṃ sikkhassū'ti, iti'ssa bhavanti vattāro

AN 10.44 kusinārasuttaṃ

imassa nu kho, sāriputta, saṃkhittena bhāsitassa kathaṃ vitthārena attho daṭṭhabbo'ti? evaṃ vutte, āyasmā sāriputto tuṇhī ahosi.

SN 12.31 bhūtasuttaṃ
āyasmāpi

sandhi. and then venerable; venerable also [āyasmā + api] ✓

Grammar sandhi, masc + ind
Meaning and then venerable; venerable also
Construction āyasmā + api
Sanskrit āyuṣmān + api

nisīdi bhagavā paññatte āsane. āyasmā'pi kho soṇo bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi. ekam'antaṃ nisinnaṃ kho āyasmantaṃ soṇaṃ bhagavā etadavoca.

AN 6.55 soṇasuttaṃ

atha kho āyasmā puṇṇo mantāṇiputto andhavanaṃ ajjhogāhetvā aññatarasmiṃ rukkhamūle divāvihāraṃ nisīdi. āyasmā'pi kho sāriputto andhavanaṃ ajjhogāhetvā aññatarasmiṃ rukkhamūle divāvihāraṃ nisīdi.

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ
āyāga

masc. gift; sacrifice; religious offering [ā + √yaj + *a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning gift; sacrifice; religious offering
Root Family ā √yaj
Root √yaj･1 a (honour, sacrifice)
Construction ā + √yaj > yag > yāg + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
j > g
Sanskrit āyāga
Sanskrit Root √yaj 1, 2 (offer)

kāye visaṃ na kamati,
satthāni na ca hanti me
udake'haṃ na miyyāmi,
āyāgassa idaṃ phalaṃ.

APA 40 āyāgadāyaka therāpadānaṃ
āyāgaseṭṭha

masc. greatest of offerings ✗
āyācati

tam'enaṃ mahā janakāyo saṅgamma samāgamma āyāceyya thomeyya pañjaliko anuparisakkeyya, ayaṃ puriso kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjatū'ti.

AN 6.61 majjhesuttaṃ

ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati gijjhakūṭe pabbate. atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, āyāma, bhikkhave, yena paṭibhānakūṭo ten'upasaṅkamissāma divāvihārāyā'ti.

Construction ā + √yūh > yuh + i
Phonetic Change ū > u
Sanskrit Root √ūh 1 (remove)
āyūhati 1

pr. (+instr) strives (with); strains (with); makes an effort (with); lit. carries here [ā + √yūh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+instr)
Meaning strives (with); strains (with); makes an effort (with); lit. carries here
Root Family ā √yūh
Root √yūh･1 a (carry, bring)
Base √yūh + a > yūha
Construction ā + yūha + ti
Antonym nāyūhati
Sanskrit āyūhati (bsk), āvyūhati (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √ūh 1 (remove)

yadākhv'āhaṃ, āvuso, santiṭṭhāmi tadāssu saṃsīdāmi, yadākhv'āhaṃ, āvuso, āyūhāmi tadāssu nibbuyhāmi. evaṃ khv'āhaṃ, āvuso, appatiṭṭhaṃ anāyūhaṃ ogham'atarin'ti.

SN 1.1 oghataraṇasuttaṃ

n'atthi kiccaṃ brāhmaṇassa,
katakicco hi brāhmaṇo,
yāva na gādhaṃ labhati nadīsu,
āyūhati sabbagattebhi jantu,
gādhañ'ca laddhāna thale ṭhito yo,
n'āyūhatī pāragato hi so'va.

SN 2.5 dāmalisuttaṃ
āyūhati 2

pr. accumulates [ā + √yūh] ✗
āyūhati 3

pr. swims [ā + √yūh] ✗

Root √yuj･2 *e (yoke, join)
Base √yuj + *e > yoje (caus)
Construction ā + yoje > yoge + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change u > o
j > g
Sanskrit āyoga
Sanskrit Root √yuj 2, 7 (join)

anūpavādo anūpaghāto,
pātimokkhe ca saṃvaro,
mattaññutā ca bhattasmiṃ,
pantañ'ca sayan'āsanaṃ,
adhicitte ca āyogo,
etaṃ buddhāna sāsanaṃ.

DHP 185 buddhavaggo

dujjānaṃ kho etaṃ, poṭṭhapāda, tayā aññadiṭṭhikena aññakhantikena aññarucikena aññatr'āyogena aññatr'ācariyakena, saññā purisassa attā'ti vā, aññā'va saññā añño attā'ti vā'ti.

Construction āra + ka + ā
āraka + ā

Commentary (MNa) ārakā ahaṃ, bhante'ti pathavito nabhaṃ viya samuddassa orimatīrato paratīraṃ viya ca suvidūr'avidūre ahaṃ.
Sanskrit ārāt, ārakāt

tapanīyāni kammāni,
yāni dhammehi ārakā,
tāni ārocayissāmi,
taṃ suṇātha yathā tathaṃ.

yathā jānāmi taṃ ahaṃ,
ārakā parivajjeyya,
gūthaṭṭhānaṃ'va pāvuse.

TH 263 mahāmoggallānattheragāthā
ārakkha 1

masc. guard; watchman; protector [ā + √rakkh + a] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from ārakkhati
Meaning guard; watchman; protector
Root Family ā √rakkh
Root √rakkh･1 a (protect)
Construction ā + √rakkh + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym ārakkhaka
Sanskrit ārakṣa
Sanskrit Root √rakṣ 1 (protect)

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, kiṭṭhaṃ sampannaṃ. kiṭṭh'ārakkho ca pamatto, goṇo ca kiṭṭh'ādo aduṃ kiṭṭhaṃ otaritvā yāva'd'atthaṃ madaṃ āpajjeyya pamādaṃ āpajjeyya.

SN 35.246 vīṇopamasuttaṃ

tassa heṭṭhā kumārassa sayanaṃ paññapetvā upari suvaṇṇatārakakhacitaṃ vitānaṃ bandhāpetvā sāṇipākārena parikkhipāpetvā ārakkhaṃ ṭhapetvā rājā sabb'ālaṅkāraṃ alaṅkaritvā amaccagaṇaparivuto naṅgalakaraṇaṭṭhānaṃ agamāsi.

MNa 36 mahāsaccakasutavaṇṇanā
ārakkha 2

Construction ā + √rakkh + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit ārakṣa
Sanskrit Root √rakṣ 1 (protect)

tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhave, etadahosi, ye'me pañca kāmaguṇā cetaso samphuṭṭhapubbā atītā niruddhā vipariṇatā, tatra me attarūpena appamādo sati cetaso ārakkho karaṇīyo.

SN 35.117 kāmaguṇasuttaṃ

idha, visākhe, mātugāmo yaṃ bhattā āharati dhanaṃ vā dhaññaṃ vā rajataṃ vā jātarūpaṃ vā taṃ ārakkhena guttiyā sampādeti, tattha ca hoti adhuttī athenī asoṇḍī avināsikā.

AN 8.49 paṭhamaidhalokikasuttaṃ
ārakkhati

pr. (+acc) guards; watches over; protects [ā + √rakkh + a + ti] ~

Commentary (ANa) na ārakkhatī'ti na rakkhati.
Sanskrit ārakṣati
Sanskrit Root √rakṣ 1 (protect)
ārakkhanirodha

masc. ending of safeguarding; cessation of safekeeping ✗
ārakkhanta

Root √rakkh･1 a (protect)
Base √rakkh + a > rakkha
Construction ā + rakkha + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Sanskrit ārakṣat
Sanskrit Root √rakṣ 1 (protect)

tassa evaṃ ārakkhato gopayato te bhoge rājāno vā haranti, corā vā haranti, aggi vā dahati, udakaṃ vā vahati, appiyā vā dāy'ādā haranti. so socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṃ kandati, sammohaṃ āpajjati, yam'pi me ahosi tam'pi no n'atthī'ti.

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ

fem. (of wealth) successfully protecting; accomplishment in preservation [ārakkha + sampadā] ✓

Meaning (of wealth) successfully protecting; accomplishment in preservation
Construction ārakkha + sampadā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ārakkhassa + sampadā)
Sanskrit ārakṣa + sampradā

te ārakkhena guttiyā sampādeti, kin'ti me ime bhoge n'eva rājāno hareyyuṃ, na corā hareyyuṃ, na aggi ḍaheyya, na udakaṃ vaheyya, na appiyā dāyādā hareyyun'ti! ayaṃ vuccati, byagghapajja, ārakkhasampadā.

AN 8.54 dīghajāṇusuttaṃ

Meaning having a bodyguard; with protection
Construction ārakkha + sampanna

Sanskrit ārakṣa + sampanna

seyyathā'pi, āvuso yamaka, gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā aḍḍho mahaddhano mahābhogo, so ca ārakkhasampanno. tassa koci'd'eva puriso uppajjeyya anatthakāmo ahitakāmo ayogakkhemakāmo jīvitā voropetu'kāmo.

so tam'anugacchati. tam'anugacchanto passati nāgavane mahantaṃ hatthipadaṃ, dīghato ca āyataṃ, tiriyañ'ca vitthataṃ, uccā ca nisevitaṃ, uccā ca dantehi ārañjitāni.

AN 5.114 andhakavindasuttaṃ

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, asappuriso āraññiko hoti. so iti paṭisañcikkhati, ahaṃ kho'mhi āraññiko ime pan'aññe bhikkhū na āraññikā'ti. so tena āraññikattena attān'ukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti.

so paṭipadaṃ'y'eva antaraṃ karitvā tena āraññikattena n'ev'attān'ukkaṃseti, na paraṃ vambheti. ayam'pi, bhikkhave, sappurisadhammo.

Sanskrit Root √rabh 1 (take hold)

yasmiṃ samaye, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tathā vūpakaṭṭho viharanto taṃ dhammaṃ anussarati anuvitakketi, satisambojjh'aṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno āraddho hoti, satisambojjh'aṅgaṃ tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhu bhāveti, satisambojjh'aṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchati.

SN 46.3 sīlasuttaṃ

āraddhaṃ kho pana me, brāhmaṇa, vīriyaṃ ahosi asallīnaṃ, upaṭṭhitā sati asammuṭṭhā, passaddho kāyo asāraddho, samāhitaṃ cittaṃ ekaggaṃ

Sanskrit rāddha

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
āraddhaviriya

adj. (+dat) strenuous ✗

Meaning energetic (in); with energy aroused (to); applying energy (to); making an effort (to)

Compound kammadhāraya (āraddha + vīriya)
Antonym kusīta, hīnavīriya
Variant āraddhaviriya
Commentary (SNa) āraddhavīriyo'ti paggahitavīriyo paripuṇṇavīriyo.
Sanskrit ārabdha + vīrya

sabbadā sīlasampanno,
paññavā susamāhito,
āraddhavīriyo pahit'atto,
oghaṃ tarati duttaraṃ.

SN 2.15 candanasuttaṃ

vīriyasambojjh'aṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchati. āraddhavīriyassa uppajjati pīti nirāmisā.

SN 46.3 sīlasuttaṃ
āraddhavīriyatā

fem. fact of being energetic; fact of having aroused energy; fact of making an effort [āraddha + vīriya + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp, from āraddhavīriya
Meaning fact of being energetic; fact of having aroused energy; fact of making an effort
Construction āraddha + vīriya + tā
āraddhavīriya + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Sanskrit ārabdha + vīrya +

etam'ahaṃ, brāhmaṇa, āraddhavīriyataṃ attani sampassamāno bhiyyo pallomam'āpādiṃ araññe vihārāya.

MN 4 bhayabheravasuttaṃ
āraddhavīriyasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 37.22 (SN37.22) ✗
āraddhā

abs. having begun or started [ā + √rabh] ✗

Phonetic Change bhy > bbh

Sanskrit Root √rabh 1 (take hold)

okkhittacakkhu na ca pādalolo,
jhān'ānuyutto bahujāgarassa,
upekkham'ārabbha samāhit'atto,
takk'āsayaṃ kukkucciy'ūpachinde.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16

ujugatam'ev'assa tasmiṃ samaye cittaṃ hoti sīlaṃ ārabbha.

SN 6.14 aruṇavatīsuttaṃ

kammaṃ kho pana me karontassa kāyo kilamissati. hand'āhaṃ nipajjāmī'ti. so nipajjati, na vīriyaṃ ārabhati appattassa pattiyā anadhigatassa adhigamāya asacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya.

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ

yam'pi so evam'āha, gacchatha imaṃ pāṇaṃ ārabhathā'ti, iminā tatiyena ṭhānena bahuṃ apuññaṃ pasavati.

vīriyam'ārabhato daḷhaṃ.

DHP 112 sahassavaggo

tañ'ca pana ārabhantena paṭhamaṃ piyapuggal'ādīsu na ārabhitabbā. piyo hi piyaṭṭhāne'y'eva tiṭṭhati. atippiyasahāyako atippiyasahāyakaṭṭhāne'y'eva.

yaṃ kiñci dukkhaṃ sambhoti,
sabbaṃ ārambhapaccayā,
ārambhānaṃ nirodhena,
n'atthi dukkhassa sambhavo.

anissitaṃ sabbabhavesu hehisi.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

akammaṃ h'etaṃ, mahārāja, jinaputtānaṃ yadidaṃ pūjā, sammasanaṃ saṅkhārānaṃ, yoniso manasikāro, satipaṭṭhān'ānupassanā, ārammaṇasāraggāho, kilesayuddhaṃ, sadattham'anuyuñjanā, etaṃ jinaputtānaṃ karaṇīyaṃ, avasesānaṃ devamanussānaṃ pūjā karaṇīyā.

DHP 253 malavaggo

kathābāhulle sati uddhaccaṃ, uddhatassa asaṃvaro, asaṃvutassa ārā cittaṃ samādhimhā

AN 7.61 pacalāyamānasuttaṃ
ārā 2.1

fem. awl; needle ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning awl; needle
Sanskrit ārā

vāri pokkharapatt'eva,
ār'agge'riva sāsapo,
yo na limpati kāmesu,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 401 brāhmaṇavaggo

yassa rāgo ca doso ca,
māno makkho ca pātito,
sāsapo'r'iva ār'aggā,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 407 brāhmaṇavaggo
ārācārī

adj. (+abl) keeping far away (from); staying well away (from) [ārā + cārī] ✓

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ
ārādhaka 1

adj. successful; accomplished [ā + √rādh + *e + aka] ✓

Grammar adj, from ārādheti, caus
Meaning successful; accomplished
Root Family ā √rādh
Root √rādh･3 *e (succeed, please)
Base √rādh + e > rādhe (caus)
Construction ā + rādhe + aka
Derivative kita (aka)
Antonym nārādhaka, anārādhaka
Synonym ārādhika, saṃrādhaka
Sanskrit ārādhaka (worshipping)
Sanskrit Root √rādh 4, 5 (succeed)

sace hi, bho gotama, imaṃ dhammaṃ bhavaṃ'y'eva gotamo ārādhako abhavissa, no ca kho bhikkhū ārādhakā abhavissaṃsu, evam'idaṃ brahmacariyaṃ aparipūraṃ abhavissa ten'aṅgena.

evaṃ yajitvā sammā yācayogo,

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning become a monastery worker
Construction ārāmika + bhūta
ārāmikavevacana

nt. synonym for a monastery attendant [ārāmika + vevacana] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning synonym for a monastery attendant
Construction ārāmika + vevacana
Commentary (VINa) buddhavevacanāni vā'ti buddhassa vā pariyāyanāmāni ... asakyaputtiyassa vā. tattha vaṇṇapaṭṭhāne āgataṃ nāmasahassaṃ upāligāthāsu (ma ni 2.76) nāmasataṃ aññāni ca guṇato labbhamānāni nāmāni buddhavevacanānī'ti veditabbāni. sabbāni'pi dhammassa nāmāni dhammavevacanānī'ti veditabbāni. esa nayo sabbattha.

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning one hundred monastery workers
Construction ārāmika + sata

masc. monastery workers and novices [ārāmika + samaṇuddesa + ā] ✓

Compound dvanda (ārāmika ca samaṇuddesa ca)
Sanskrit ārāmika + śramaṇa + uddeśya

evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco bhikkhu yaññad'eva rattiṃ vā divaṃ vā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito hoti, tāva'd'ev'assa tibbaṃ hir'ottappaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti bhikkhūsu bhikkhunīsu upāsakesu upāsikāsu antamaso ārāmikasamaṇuddesesu.

ārāmikini

āruppa 1

nt. formless existence; immaterial state [na + √rūp + a + *ya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from na rūpa, neg

Root Family √rūp
Root √rūp･8 *e (form, produce)
Construction na > a > ā + √rūp + a + *ya
arūpa + *ya
Derivative taddhita (*ya)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym ruppa
Commentary (MNa) āruppā'ti arūpabrahmaloko nāma
Sanskrit ārūpya (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √rūp 10 (form)

ye ca rūp'ūpagā sattā,
ye ca āruppavāsino,
nirodhaṃ appajānantā,
āgantāro punabbhavaṃ.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

santi, gahapatayo, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, n'atthi sabbaso āruppā'ti. tesaṃ'y'eva kho, gahapatayo, samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā ujuvipaccanīkavādā. te evam'āhaṃsu, atthi sabbaso āruppā'ti.

āruyha 1

Grammar ger of āruhati, trans (+acc)

Root √ruh･1 a (ascend, grow)

Phonetic Change hy > yh (metathesis)
Variant ārūyha
Sanskrit āruhya
Sanskrit Root √ruh 1 (ascend)

gattāni parimajjitvā,
puna'p'āruyha caṅkamaṃ,
caṅkame caṅkamiṃ so'haṃ,
ajjhattaṃ susamāhito.

TH 187 bhaguttheragāthā

pamādaṃ appamādena,
yadā nudati paṇḍito,
paññāpāsādam'āruyha,
asoko sokiniṃ pajaṃ,
pabbataṭṭho'va bhūmaṭṭhe,
dhīro bāle avekkhati.

vissāsaparamā ñāti,
nibbānaṃ paramaṃ sukhaṃ.

yo hi, gahapati, imaṃ kāyaṃ pariharanto muhuttam'pi ārogyaṃ paṭijāneyya, kimaññatra bālyā?

Construction ā + roce + tuṃ
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit ārocayitum
Sanskrit Root √ruc 1 (shine)

evaṃ vutte, bhāradvājagotto brāhmaṇo saṃviggo lomahaṭṭhajāto bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, etadeva kho pana mayaṃ bhoto gotamassa ārocetu'kāmā.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
ālaya 1

masc. roost; perch; nest; lair; home; abode [ā + √lī + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from allīyati
Meaning roost; perch; nest; lair; home; abode
Root Family ā √lī
Root √lī･3 ya (stick, hide)
√ In Comps llī
Construction ā + √lī > lay + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change ī > ay
Notes see ālaya 2
Sanskrit ālaya
Sanskrit Root √lī 1, 4, 9 (cling)

yadā balākā sucipaṇḍaracchadā,
kāḷassa meghassa bhayena tajjitā,
palehiti ālayam'ālay'esinī,
tadā nadī ajakaraṇī rameti maṃ.

TH 196 sappakattheragāthā
ālaya 2

masc. (+loc) attachment (to); clinging (to); (comm) craving [ā + √lī + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from allīyati (+loc)
Meaning attachment (to); clinging (to); (comm) craving
Root Family ā √lī
Root √lī･3 ya (stick, hide)
√ In Comps llī
Construction ā + √lī > lay + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change ī > ay
Antonym anālaya
Commentary (DHPa) ālayā'ti taṇhā
Notes see ālaya 1
Sanskrit ālaya
Sanskrit Root √lī 1, 4, 9 (cling)

yo imesu pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu chando ālayo anunayo ajjhosānaṃ so dukkhasamudayo. yo imesu pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu chandarāgavinayo chandarāgappahānaṃ, so dukkhanirodho'ti. ettāvatā'pi kho, āvuso, bhikkhuno bahukataṃ hoti.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ

yass'ālayā na vijjanti,
aññāya akathaṃkathī,
amat'ogadham'anuppattaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 411 brāhmaṇavaggo
ālaya 3

masc. pretence [ā + √lī] ✗
ālaya 4

masc. reliance, thing relied on [ā + √lī] ✗
ālayati

pr. settles down on; is attached to; clings, has longings [ā + √lī] ✗
ālayarata

adj. delighting in attachment; taking pleasure in clinging [ālaya + rata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning delighting in attachment; taking pleasure in clinging
Construction ālaya + rata
Compound sattamī tappurisa (ālayesu + rata)
Commentary (MNa) ālayarāmā'ti sattā pañcasu kāmaguṇesu allīyanti. tasmā te ālayā'ti vuccanti. aṭṭhasatataṇhāvicaritāni ālayanti, tasmā ālayā'ti vuccanti. tehi ālayehi ramantī'ti ālayarāmā. ālayesu ratā'ti ālayaratā. ālayesu suṭṭhu muditā'ti ālayasammuditā.
Sanskrit ālaya + rata

ālayarāmā kho pan'āyaṃ pajā ālayaratā ālayasammuditā. ālayarāmā kho pan'āyaṃ pajā ālayaratāya ālayasammuditāya duddasaṃ idaṃ ṭhānaṃ yadidaṃ, idappaccayatā paṭiccasamuppādo.

paññāya maggaṃ alaso na vindati.

DHP 280 maggavaggo
ālasya

Meaning laziness; idleness

Root √las･1 a (shine, be active)

alasa + *ya

Antonym anālasya
Variant ālasiya
Commentary (SNa) ālasyan'ti ālasiyaṃ, yena ṭhitaṭṭhāne ṭhito'va, nisinnaṭṭhāne nisinno'va hoti, tele'pi uttarante ṭhitiṃ na karoti. (ANa) ālasye'ti ālasiyabhāve.
Sanskrit ālasya
Sanskrit Root √las 1 (be lively)

cha kho'me, gahapatiputta, ādīnavā ālasya-anuyoge.

DN 31.11 siṅgālasuttaṃ

cha lokasmiṃ chiddāni,
yattha vittaṃ na tiṭṭhati,
ālasyañ'ca pamādo ca,
anuṭṭhānaṃ asaṃyamo,
niddā tandī ca te chidde,
sabbaso taṃ vivajjaye'ti.

Construction ā + limpe + ti
Phonetic Change d > l
Variant āḷimpeti
Commentary (ANa) ālimpeyyā'ti tattha aṅgāre pakkhipitvā aggiṃ datvā nāḷikāya dhamanto aggiṃ gāhāpeyya. (VISMa) ālimpetī'ti ādīpeti jāleti.

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, suvaṇṇakāro vā suvaṇṇakār'antevāsī vā ukkaṃ bandheyya, ukkaṃ bandhitvā ukkāmukhaṃ ālimpeyya, ukkāmukhaṃ ālimpetvā saṇḍāsena jātarūpaṃ gahetvā ukkāmukhe pakkhipeyya

SN 46.55 saṅgāravasuttaṃ

yathā kho, mārisā, nimittāni dissanti, uḷāro āloko sañjāyati, obhāso pātubhavati, brahmā pātubhavissati

Sanskrit lokayat
Sanskrit Root √lok 10 (look)

sace, bhikkhave, nandassa puratthimā disā āloketabbā hoti, sabbaṃ cetasā samannāharitvā nando puratthimaṃ disaṃ āloketi, evaṃ me puratthimaṃ disaṃ ālokayato n'ābhijjhādomanassā pāpakā akusalā dhammā anvāssavissantī'ti. itiha tattha sampajāno hoti.

no ce te evaṃ viharato taṃ middhaṃ pahīyetha tato tvaṃ, moggallāna, ālokasaññaṃ manasi kareyyāsi divāsaññaṃ adhiṭṭhaheyyāsi yathā divā tathā rattiṃ yathā rattiṃ tathā divā

AN 7.61 pacalāyamānasuttaṃ
ālokasaññī

adj. perceptive of light; conscious of brightness [āloka + saññī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning perceptive of light; conscious of brightness
Construction āloka + saññī
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ālokassa + saññī)
Sanskrit āloka + saṃjñin

thinamiddhaṃ pahāya vigatathinamiddho viharati ālokasaññī sato sampajāno thinamiddhā cittaṃ parisodheti

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
ālokasandhi

masc. window; window-shutters; lit. breach for light [āloka + sandhi] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning window; window-shutters; lit. breach for light
Construction āloka + sandhi
Compound catutthī tappurisa (ālokassa + sandhi)
Synonym vātapāna
Commentary (VINa) ālokasandhī'ti vātapānakavāṭakā vuccanti
Sanskrit āloka + saṃdhi

mahallakaṃ pana bhikkhunā vihāraṃ kārayamānena yāva dvārakosā aggaḷaṭṭhapanāya ālokasandhiparikammāya dvatticchadanassa pariyāyaṃ appaharite ṭhitena adhiṭṭhātabbaṃ

VIN PAT PC 19 mahallakavihārasikkhāpadaṃ
ālokasandhiparikamma

nt. preparation of the windows; decoration of the windows [āloka + sandhi + parikamma] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning preparation of the windows; decoration of the windows
Construction āloka + sandhi + parikamma
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (ālokasandhiyā + parikamma)
Synonym vātapānaparikamma
Commentary (VIN 2.5.2.9) ālokasandhiparikammāyā'ti vātapānaparikammāya
Sanskrit āloka + saṃdhi + parikarman

mahallakaṃ pana bhikkhunā vihāraṃ kārayamānena yāva dvārakosā aggaḷaṭṭhapanāya ālokasandhiparikammāya dvatticchadanassa pariyāyaṃ appaharite ṭhitena adhiṭṭhātabbaṃ

VIN PAT PC 19 mahallakavihārasikkhāpadaṃ
ālokasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.143 (AN4.143) ✗
ālokita 1

nt. looking ahead; looking forward; lit. looked here [ā + √lok + ita] ✓

Grammar nt, pp of āloketi
Meaning looking ahead; looking forward; lit. looked here
Root Family ā √lok
Root √lok･8 *e (look)
Construction ā + √lok + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Antonym vilokita
Commentary (MNa) ālokitaṃ nāma purato pekkhanaṃ.
Sanskrit ālokita
Sanskrit Root √lok 10 (look)

so abhikkante paṭikkante sampajānakārī ahosiṃ, ālokite vilokite sampajānakārī ahosiṃ, samiñjite pasārite sampajānakārī ahosiṃ, saṅghāṭipattacīvaradhāraṇe sampajānakārī ahosiṃ

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ
ālokita 2

pp. looked at or before [ā + √lok] ✗
ālokitabba

ptp. should be looked at [ā + √lok] ✗
āloketabba

ptp. should be looked ahead; should be looked forward; lit. to be looked at [ā + √lok + *e + tabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of āloketi
Meaning should be looked ahead; should be looked forward; lit. to be looked at
Root Family ā √lok
Root √lok･8 *e (look)
Base √lok + e > loke
Construction ā + loke + tabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Antonym viloketabba
Sanskrit ālokayitavya
Sanskrit Root √lok 10 (look)

evaṃ te abhikkamitabbaṃ, evaṃ te paṭikkamitabbaṃ, evaṃ te āloketabbaṃ, evaṃ te viloketabbaṃ, evaṃ te samiñjitabbaṃ, evaṃ te pasāritabbaṃ, evaṃ te saṅghāṭipattacīvaraṃ dhāretabban'ti.

AN 4.122 ūmibhayasuttaṃ
āloketi

pr. looks at or before [ā + √lok] ✗
ālopa 1

masc. (of food) morsel; lump; bit; lit. breaking off [ā + √lup + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from ālumpati
Meaning (of food) morsel; lump; bit; lit. breaking off
Root Family ā √lup
Root √lup･2 ṃa (cut off, rob)
Construction ā + √lup > lop + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit ālopa
Sanskrit Root √lup 6 (break)

cattāro pañca ālope,
abhutvā udakaṃ pive,
alaṃ phāsuvihārāya,
pahit'attassa bhikkhuno.

TH 259 sāriputtattheragāthā

byañjanaṃ kho pana bhavaṃ gotamo byañjanamattāya āhāreti, na ca byañjanena ālopaṃ atināmeti.

tulākūṭa kaṃsakūṭa mānakūṭa ukkoṭana vañcana nikati sāciyoga chedana vadha bandhana viparāmosa ālopa sāhasākārā paṭivirato ahosi.

āvaṭa 2

AN 4.122 ūmibhayasuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, sace tumhe'pi ... na āvaṭṭaggāho gahessati, na antopūtī bhavissatha, evaṃ tumhe, bhikkhave, nibbānaninnā bhavissatha nibbānapoṇā nibbānapabbhārā.

SN 35.241 paṭhamadārukkhandhopamasuttaṃ
āvaṭṭa 2

Sanskrit Root √vṛt 1 (turn)

uddh'aggalomo kho pana so bhavaṃ gotamo, uddh'aggāni lomāni jātāni nīlāni añjanavaṇṇāni kuṇḍal'āvaṭṭāni dakkhiṇ'āvaṭṭakajātāni, idam'pi tassa bhoto gotamassa mahāpurisassa mahāpurisalakkhaṇaṃ bhavati.

Sanskrit āvartate
Sanskrit Root √vṛt 1 (turn)

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, māgaṇḍiya, api nu so devaputto nandane vane accharāsaṅghaparivuto dibbehi pañcahi kāmaguṇehi samappito ... amussa gahapatissa vā gahapatiputtassa vā piheyya, mānusakānaṃ vā pañcannaṃ kāmaguṇānaṃ mānusakehi vā kāmehi āvaṭṭeyyā'ti?

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
āvaṭṭati 2

pr. bends forward and back; rocks back and forth [ā + √vaṭṭ + a + ti] ✓

Meaning bends forward and back; rocks back and forth
Root Family ā √vaṭṭ
Root √vaṭṭ･1 a (turn)
Base √vaṭṭ + a > vaṭṭa
Construction ā + vaṭṭa + ti
Commentary (UDa) āvaṭṭatī'ti ekasmiṃ'y'eva ṭhāne anipajjitvā attano sarīraṃ ito c'ito ākaḍḍhanto āvaṭṭati. parivaṭṭatī'ti ekasmiṃ padese nipanno'pi aṅgapaccaṅgāni parito khipanto vaṭṭati, abhimukhaṃ vā vaṭṭanto āvaṭṭati, samantato vaṭṭanto parivaṭṭati.
Sanskrit āvartate
Sanskrit Root √vṛt 1 (turn)

atha kho so paribbājako rañño pasenadissa kosalassa koṭṭhāgāraṃ gantvā telassa yāva'd'atthaṃ pivitvā gharaṃ āgantvā n'eva sakkoti uddhaṃ kātuṃ, na pana adho. so dukkhāhi tibbāhi kharāhi kaṭukāhi vedanāhi phuṭṭho āvaṭṭati parivaṭṭati.

UD16 gabbhinīsuttaṃ

ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu āvaṭṭabhayassa bhīto sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya hīnāy'āvatto. āvaṭṭabhayan'ti kho, bhikkhave, pañcann'etaṃ kāmaguṇānaṃ adhivacanaṃ.

AN 4.122 ūmibhayasuttaṃ

UD16 gabbhinīsuttaṃ
āvaṭṭi

AN 4.193 bhaddiyasuttaṃ

bhaddikā, bhante, āvaṭṭanī māyā, kalyāṇī, bhante, āvaṭṭanī māyā, piyā me, bhante, ñātisālohitā imāya āvaṭṭaniyā āvaṭṭeyyuṃ, piyānam'pi me assa ñātisālohitānaṃ dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāya.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
āvaṭṭeti 2

pr. (+acc) turns round [ā + √vaṭṭ] ✗

āvatta 1

pp. (+dat) reverted (to); returned (to); gone back (to) [ā + √vatt + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of āvattati (+dat)
Meaning reverted (to); returned (to); gone back (to)
Root Family ā √vatt
Root √vatt･1 a (be, proceed)
Construction ā + √vatt + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Commentary (MNa) āvatto bāhullāyā'ti rasagiddho hutvā paṇītapiṇḍapāt'ādīnaṃ atthāya āvatto.
Sanskrit āvṛtta
Sanskrit Root √vṛt 1 (turn)

ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ūmibhayassa bhīto sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya hīnāy'āvatto. ūmibhayan'ti kho, bhikkhave, kodh'ūpāyāsass'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, ūmibhayaṃ.

AN 4.122 ūmibhayasuttaṃ

yato kho ahaṃ, aggivessana, oḷārikaṃ āhāraṃ āhāresiṃ odanakummāsaṃ, atha me te pañca bhikkhū nibbijja pakkamiṃsu, bāhulliko samaṇo gotamo, padhānavibbhanto, āvatto bāhullāyā'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
āvatta 2

nt. winding, turn, bent [ā + √vatt] ✗

pr. (+dat) reverts (to); returns (to); retreats (to); goes back (to) [√vatt + a + ti] ✓

Sanskrit āvartate
Sanskrit Root √vṛt 1 (turn)

maraṇañ'h'etaṃ, sunakkhatta, ariyassa vinaye yo sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya hīnāy'āvattati, maraṇamattañ'h'etaṃ, sunakkhatta, dukkhaṃ yaṃ aññataraṃ saṃkiliṭṭhaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ

so kupito anattamano sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya hīnāy'āvattati. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ūmibhayassa bhīto sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya hīnāy'āvatto.

AN 4.122 ūmibhayasuttaṃ
āvatti

aor. (+dat) reverted (to); returned (to); went back (to) [ā + √vatt + i] ~

Meaning reverted (to); returned (to); went back (to)

Root √vatt･1 a (be, proceed)
Construction ā + √vatt + i

Meaning returning; coming back

Root √vatt･1 a (be, proceed)

āvatteti

pr. (+acc) causes to turn; makes bend [ā + √vaṭṭ] ✗
āvamati

pr. swallows back; swallows what one has vomited or ejected [ā + √vam] ✗
āvamituṃ

inf. (+acc) to re-swallow what was vomited; i.e. to return to worldly life [ā + √vam + ituṃ] ✓

Grammar inf of āvamati, trans (+acc)
Meaning to re-swallow what was vomited; i.e. to return to worldly life
Root Family ā √vam
Root √vam･1 a (eject, vomit)
Construction ā + √vam + ituṃ
Variant āgamituṃ
Commentary (THa) vante ahaṃ āvamituṃ na ussahe'ti evaṃ te chaḍḍite puna paccāvamituṃ ahaṃ na sakkomi, pariccattā eva hontī'ti vadati.
English Cognate vomit
Sanskrit āvamitum
Sanskrit Root √vam 1, 2 (vomit)

taṇhā avijjā ca piy'āpiyañ'ca,
subhāni rūpāni sukhā ca vedanā,
manāpiyā kāmaguṇā ca vantā,
vante ahaṃ āvamituṃ na ussahe.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
āvaraṇa 1

adj. obstructed; blocked; impeded [ā + √var + aṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from āvareti
Meaning obstructed; blocked; impeded
Root Family ā √var
Root √var･1 a (cover, dress, restrain)
Construction ā + √var + aṇa
Derivative kita (aṇa)
Sanskrit āvaraṇa
Sanskrit Root √vṛ 1, 5, 9 (cover)

ajjhattañ'ca na jānāti,
bahiddhā ca na passati,
samant'āvaraṇo bālo,
sa ve ghosena vuyhati.

AN 4.65 rūpasuttaṃ

AN 4.122 ūmibhayasuttaṃ

uddhaccakukkuccaṃ, bhikkhave, āvaraṇaṃ nīvaraṇaṃ cetaso ajjhāruhaṃ paññāya dubbalīkaraṇaṃ.

gāmakathāya āvaraye sotaṃ,

na ca mamāyetha kiñci lokasmiṃ.

SNP 50 cūḷabyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 12

saddh'īdha vittaṃ purisassa seṭṭhaṃ,
dhammo suciṇṇo sukham'āvahati,
saccaṃ have sādutaraṃ rasānaṃ,
paññājīviṃ jīvitam'āhu seṭṭhan'ti.

āvahana

Sanskrit Root √vah 1 (carry)

kiṃ su suciṇṇaṃ sukham'āvahāti,
kiṃ su have sādutaraṃ rasānaṃ,
kathaṃ jīviṃ jīvitam'āhu seṭṭhaṃ.

āvi

ind. openly; in full view; face to face ✓

Grammar ind, adv
Meaning openly; in full view; face to face

Commentary (ANa) āvi c'eva raho cā'ti sammukhā ca parammukhā ca.

m'ākāsi pāpakaṃ kammaṃ,
āvi vā yadi vā raho.

SN 10.5 sānusuttaṃ

cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, dhammā sāraṇīyā. katame cha? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno mettaṃ kāyakammaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti sabrahmacārīsu āvi c'eva raho ca, ayam'pi dhammo sāraṇīyo.

AN 6.11 paṭhamasāraṇīyasuttaṃ

Variant āvikatvā
Sanskrit āviṣkṛta

sampajānamusāvādo kho pan'āyasmanto antarāyiko dhammo vutto bhagavatā, tasmā saramānena bhikkhunā āpannena visuddh'āpekkhena santī āpatti āvikātabbā, āvikatā hi'ssa phāsu hoti.

VIN PAT NID nidānuddeso
āvikattar

masc. (+acc and +loc) who reveals (to); who divulges (to); lit. who makes open [āvi + kattar] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, comp, from āvikaroti (+acc and +loc)
Meaning who reveals (to); who divulges (to); lit. who makes open
Construction āvi + kattar
Phonetic Change r > t
Commentary (MNa) yathābhūtaṃ attānaṃ āvikattā'ti yathābhūtaṃ attano aguṇaṃ pakāsetā.
Sanskrit āviṣkartṛ

yāni kho pan'assa honti sāṭheyyāni kūṭeyyāni jimheyyāni vaṅkeyyāni, tāni yathābhūtaṃ sārathissa āvikattā hoti. tesam'assa sārathi abhinimmadanāya vāyamati.

AN 8.13 assājānīyasuttaṃ

yāni kho pan'assa honti sāṭheyyāni kūṭeyyāni jimheyyāni vaṅkeyyāni, tāni yathābhūtaṃ āvikattā hoti satthari vā viññūsu vā sabrahmacārīsu.

AN 8.13 assājānīyasuttaṃ
āvikatvā

abs. (+acc) having openly revealed; lit. makes made open [āvi + katvā] ~

Grammar abs of āvikaroti, comp vb, trans (+acc)
Meaning having openly revealed; lit. makes made open
Construction āvi + katvā
Compound comp verb (āvi + katvā)
Sanskrit āviṣkṛtvā

nt. explaining; clarifying; openly revealing; lit. making open [āvi + karaṇa] ~

Grammar nt, act, comp, from āvikaroti
Meaning explaining; clarifying; openly revealing; lit. making open
Construction āvi + karaṇa

Construction āvi + karoti

Variant āvīkaroti
Sanskrit āviṣkaroti

caturo samaṇā na pañcam'atthi,
te te āvikaromi sakkhipuṭṭho,
maggajino maggadesako ca,
magge jīvati yo ca maggadūsī.

uragavaggo 5

Meaning pulls (towards); tugs (to)

Root √añch･1 a (extend, draw along)

Construction ā + vi + añcha + ti
Antonym nāviñchati
Variant āviñjati
Notes possibly corruption of āvañchati "wanders towards"
Sanskrit āvañcati
Sanskrit Root √āñch 1 (tear)

daḷhāya rajjuyā bandhitvā majjhe gaṇṭhiṃ karitvā ossajjeyya. atha kho, te, bhikkhave, chappāṇakā nānāvisayā nānāgocarā sakaṃ sakaṃ gocaravisayaṃ āviñcheyyuṃ

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ

mano āviñchati manāpiyesu dhammesu, amanāpiyā dhammā paṭikūlā honti. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, asaṃvaro hoti.

Phonetic Change v > b
Antonym accha
Commentary (ANa) āvilo'ti appasanno.
Sanskrit āvila
Sanskrit Root √bil 6, 10 (split)

SN 46.55 saṅgāravasuttaṃ

sarajo vītarajaṃ anaṅgaṇaṃ,
sabbattha vimuttamānasaṃ,
kiṃ maṃ ovariyāna tiṭṭhasi.

eke ca pabbajjam'arocayiṃsu.

TH 248 adhimuttattheragāthā

nagar'ūpamaṃ cittam'idaṃ ṭhapetvā.
yodhetha māraṃ paññā-āvudhena,
jitañ'ca rakkhe anivesano siyā.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ

app'ekacce maṃ paccuggantvā pattacīvaraṃ paṭiggahesuṃ, app'ekacce āsanaṃ paññapesuṃ, app'ekacce pād'odakaṃ upaṭṭhapesuṃ. api ca kho maṃ nāmena ca āvusovādena ca samudācaranti.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ

Sanskrit aveṇi, āveṇika
Sanskrit Root √ve 1 (weave)

te imehi dasahi vatthūhi avakassanti apakassanti āveṇi kammāni karonti āveṇi pātimokkhaṃ uddisanti. ettāvatā kho, upāli, saṅgho bhinno hotī'ti.

SN 37.3 āveṇikadukkhasuttaṃ
āveṇikadukkhasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 37.3 (SN37.3) ✗
āveni

ind. autonomously; individualy; separately; lit. not woven [a + √ve + i] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, from na veṇi
Meaning autonomously; individualy; separately; lit. not woven
Root Family √ve
Root √ve･1 a (weave)
Construction a > ā + √ve + [n] + i
Derivative kita (i)
Phonetic Change +n
Variant āveṇi, āveniṃ, āveṇikaṃ
Commentary (VINa) āvenin'ti visuṃ.
Sanskrit aveṇi, āveṇika
Sanskrit Root √ve 1 (weave)

te imehi dasahi vatthūhi avakassanti apakassanti āveni kammāni karonti āveni pātimokkhaṃ uddisanti. ettāvatā kho, upāli, saṅgho bhinno hotī'ti.

AN 10.37 saṅghabhedasuttaṃ
āveniṃ

ind. separately, apart; or not united, separate ✗

nt. workshop; lit. entering here [ā + √vis + *ana] ✓

Root √vis･1 a (enter)
Construction ā + √vis > ves + *ana
Derivative kita (*ana)
Phonetic Change i > e
Variant nivesana
Sanskrit āveśana
Sanskrit Root √viś 6 (enter)

sace te, bhaggava, agaru viharemu āvesane ekarattan'ti. na kho me, bhante, garu. atthi c'ettha pabbajito paṭhamaṃ vās'ūpagato. sace so anujānāti, viharatha, bhante, yathāsukhan'ti.

APA 47 pañcahatthiya therāpadānaṃ

Construction √as > ās + *a

Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit āsa (bow)
Sanskrit Root √as 4 (throw)

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, issāso vā issās'antevāsī vā tiṇapurisarūpake vā mattikāpuñje vā yoggaṃ karitvā, so aparena samayena dūrepātī ca hoti akkhaṇavedhī ca mahato ca kāyassa padāletā.

bāhir'āsassa bhikkhuno,

pāripūriṃ na gacchati.

AN 3.68 kathāvatthusuttaṃ

mayam'eva, bho gotama, dhaṃsī, mayaṃ pagabbā, ye mayaṃ bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ vādena vādaṃ āsādetabbaṃ amaññimha. siyā hi, bho gotama, hatthiṃ pabhinnaṃ āsajja purisassa sotthibhāvo, na tv'eva bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ āsajja siyā purisassa sotthibhāvo.

masc. discharge; suppuration; outflow; effluent [ā + √su + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from āsavati
Meaning discharge; suppuration; outflow; effluent
Root Family ā √su
Root √su･1 a (flow)
√ In Comps ssu
Construction ā + √su > sav + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > av
Antonym anāsava
Commentary (ANa) āsavā'ti kilesā.
Notes 3 āsavā: 1. kāmāsava, 2. bhavāsava, 3. avijjāsava. 4. āsavā 1. kāmāsava, 2. bhavāsava, 3. diṭṭhāsava, 4 avijjāsava. The list of four appears for the first time in Khuddakanikāya, then becomes the standard.
Sanskrit āsrava
Sanskrit Root √sru 1 (flow)

sadā jāgaramānānaṃ,
ahoratt'ānusikkhinaṃ,
nibbānaṃ adhimuttānaṃ,
atthaṃ gacchanti āsavā.

DHP 226 kodhavaggo

katame ca, bhikkhave, dhammā paññāya sacchikaraṇīyā? āsavānaṃ khayo, bhikkhave, paññāya sacchikaraṇīyo.

AN 4.189 sacchikaraṇīyasuttaṃ
āsava 3

nt. discharge; suppuration; outflow; effluent [ā + √su + *a] ✓

Meaning discharge; suppuration; outflow; effluent
Root Family ā √su
Root √su･1 a (flow)
√ In Comps ssu

Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > av
Antonym anāsava

chetvā āsavāni ālayāni,
vidvā so na upeti gabbhaseyyaṃ,
saññaṃ tividhaṃ panujja paṅkaṃ,
kappaṃ n'eti tam'āhu ariyo'ti.

VIN 2.5.6.1 surāpānasikkhāpadaṃ
āsavakkhaya

masc. wearing away of the effluents; slow destruction of the defilements [āsava + khaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning wearing away of the effluents; slow destruction of the defilements
Construction āsava + khaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (āsavassa + khaya)
Sanskrit āsrava + kṣaya

paravajj'ānupassissa,
niccaṃ ujjhānasaññino,
āsavā tassa vaḍḍhanti,
ārā so āsavakkhayā.

DHP 253 malavaggo

etam'ādīnaṃ ñatvā,
bhaven'amhi anatthiko,
nissaṭo sabbakāmehi,
patto me āsavakkhayo'ti.

akiñcanaṃ kāmabhave asattan'ti.

accantasuddhī'ti na te vadanti,

SNP 42 suddhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 4
āsāṭikā 1

fem. insect's egg; nit; (comm) bluebottle egg ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning insect's egg; nit; (comm) bluebottle egg
Commentary (ANa) na āsāṭikaṃ hāretā'ti gunnaṃ khāṇukaṇṭak'ādīhi pahaṭaṭṭhānesu vaṇo hoti. tattha nīlamakkhikā aṇḍakāni ṭhapenti, tesaṃ āsāṭikā'ti nāmaṃ.
Non IA āsāḍī (Mārāṭhi)

idha, bhikkhave, gopālako na rūpaññū hoti, na lakkhaṇakusalo hoti, na āsāṭikaṃ hāretā hoti, na vaṇaṃ paṭicchādetā hoti, na dhūmaṃ kattā hoti, na titthaṃ jānāti, na pītaṃ jānāti, na vīthiṃ jānāti, na gocarakusalo hoti

AN 11.17 gopālasuttaṃ
āsāṭikā 2

fem. (comm) thought of sensuality, ill-will or harming; lit. insect's egg ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning (comm) thought of sensuality, ill-will or harming; lit. insect's egg
Commentary (ANa) na āsāṭikaṃ hāretā hotī'ti uppannaṃ kāmavitakkan'ti evaṃ vutte kāmavitakk'ādayo na vinodeti.
Non IA āsāḍī (Mārāṭhi)

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na āsāṭikaṃ hāretā hoti? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu uppannaṃ kāmavitakkaṃ adhivāseti nappajahati na vinodeti na byantīkaroti na anabhāvaṃ gameti

AN 11.17 gopālasuttaṃ
āsādana 1

nt. (+gen) approaching; encountering; meeting (of) [ā + √sad + *e + ana] ~

Grammar nt, act, from āsādeti, caus (+gen)
Meaning approaching; encountering; meeting (of)
Root Family ā √sad
Root √sad･1 *e (sink, sit, settle)
Base √sad + *e > sāde (caus)
Construction ā + sāde + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Sanskrit āsādana
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)
āsādana 2

nt. (+gen) insulting; assaulting; attacking (of) [ā + √sad + *e + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from āsādeti, caus (+gen)
Meaning insulting; assaulting; attacking (of)
Root Family ā √sad
Root √sad･1 *e (sink, sit, settle)
Base √sad + *e > sāde (caus)
Construction ā + sāde + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Commentary (DNa) āsādanā'ti ahaṃ buddhena saddhiṃ pāṭihāriyaṃ karissāmī'ti ghaṭṭanā. (VIN 2.5.4.6) āsādan'āpekkho'ti iminā imaṃ codessāmi sāressāmi paṭicodessāmi paṭisāressāmi maṅku karissāmī'ti
Sanskrit āsādana
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ bhuttāviṃ pavāritaṃ anatirittena khādanīyena vā bhojanīyena vā abhihaṭṭhuṃ pavāreyya, handa bhikkhu khāda vā bhuñja vā'ti jānaṃ āsādan'āpekkho, bhuttasmiṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 36 dutiyapavāraṇāsikkhāpadaṃ

evam'eva kho tvaṃ, āvuso pāthikaputta, sugat'āpadānesu jīvamāno sugat'ātirittāni bhuñjamāno tathāgate arahante sammāsambuddhe āsādetabbaṃ maññasi. ke ca chave pāthikaputte, kā ca tathāgatānaṃ arahantānaṃ sammāsambuddhānaṃ āsādanā'ti.

DN 24.5 pāthikasuttaṃ
āsādanāpekkha

Grammar adj, comp

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ bhuttāviṃ pavāritaṃ anatirittena khādanīyena vā bhojanīyena vā abhihaṭṭhuṃ pavāreyya, handa bhikkhu khāda vā bhuñja vā'ti jānaṃ āsādan'āpekkho, bhuttasmiṃ pācittiyaṃ.

evam'etaṃ tadā āsi,
yathā bhāsasi bhaggava,
kumbhakāro pure āsi,

kassapassa upāsako.
