Root √as･1 a (be)
Construction a + √as + iṃ
Synonym ahosiṃ
Sanskrit āsam
Sanskrit Root √as 2 (be)

kumbhakāro pure āsiṃ,
vekaḷiṅge ghaṭīkaro,
mātāpettibharo āsiṃ,
kassapassa upāsako.

SN 1.50 ghaṭīkārasuttaṃ

vanacārī pure āsiṃ,
satataṃ vanakammiko,
patth'odanaṃ gahetvāna,
kamm'antaṃ agamās'ahaṃ.

APA 421 patth'odanadāyaka therāpadānaṃ
āsiṃsati

pr. (+acc) wishes to get; hopes to get; expects [ā + √siṃs + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning wishes to get; hopes to get; expects
Root Family ā √siṃs
Root √siṃs･1 a (hope, wish)
Base √siṃs + a > siṃsa
Construction ā + siṃsa + ti
Antonym nāsiṃsatī
Variant āsīsati
Sanskrit āśaṃsati
Sanskrit Root √śaṃs 1 (praise)

tasmā have lokavidū sumedho,
lok'antagū vusitabrahmacariyo,
lokassa antaṃ samitāvi ñatvā,
na-āsiṃsatī lokam'imaṃ parañ'cā'ti.

AN 4.45 rohitassasuttaṃ

parato āsiṃsare bālā,
tam'pi tesaṃ na labbhati,
diṭṭhe dhamm'esa vipāko,
samparāye ca duggatī'ti.

SN 1.49 maccharisuttaṃ
āsī 1.1

fem. snake's fang ✓

Grammar fem, in comps
Meaning snake's fang
Sanskrit āśis

āsādiya edisaṃ janaṃ,
aggiṃ pajjalitaṃ va liṅgiya,
gaṇhiya āsīvisaṃ viya,
api nu sotthi siyā khamehi no.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā

seyyathā'pi, sunakkhatta, āsīviso ghoraviso. atha puriso āgaccheyya jīvitukāmo amaritukāmo sukhakāmo dukkhapaṭikūlo.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
āsī 2.1

fem. blessing [ā + √is] ✗
āsītika 1

masc. liana; box bean plant; Entada scandens; lit. eighty years old [āsīti + ka] ✓

Grammar masc, from asīti
Meaning liana; box bean plant; Entada scandens; lit. eighty years old
Construction āsīti + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Commentary (MNa) āsītikapabbāni vā kāḷapabbāni vā'ti yathā āsītikavalliyā vā kāḷavalliyā vā sandhiṭṭhānesu milāyitvā majjhe unnatunnatāni honti, evaṃ mayhaṃ aṅgapaccaṅgāni hontī'ti dasseti.
Web Link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Entada
Sanskrit āsītakī

seyyathā'pi nāma āsītikapabbāni vā kāḷapabbāni vā, evam'ev'assu me aṅgapaccaṅgāni bhavanti tāy'ev'app'āhāratāya. seyyathā'pi nāma oṭṭhapadaṃ, evam'ev'assu me ānisadaṃ hoti tāy'ev'app'āhāratāya.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
āsītika 2

adj. eighty years old [āsīti + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from asīti
Meaning eighty years old
Construction āsīti + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Sanskrit aśītika

yato ca kho ayaṃ bhavaṃ puriso jiṇṇo hoti vuddho mahallako addhagato vayoanuppatto, āsītiko vā nāvutiko vā vassasatiko vā jātiyā, atha tamhā paññāveyyattiyā, parihāyatī'ti.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, tam'eva bhaginiṃ passeyya aparena samayena āsītikaṃ vā nāvutikaṃ vā vassasatikaṃ vā jātiyā, jiṇṇaṃ gopānasivaṅkaṃ bhoggaṃ daṇḍaparāyanaṃ pavedhamānaṃ gacchantiṃ āturaṃ gatayobbanaṃ khaṇḍadantaṃ palitakesaṃ, vilūnaṃ khalitasiraṃ valinaṃ tilak'āhatagattaṃ.

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
āsītikapabba

nt. joint of a liana; knot of a box bean plant; lit. eighty years old limb [āsītika + pabba] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning joint of a liana; knot of a box bean plant; lit. eighty years old limb
Construction āsītika + pabba
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (āsītikassa + pabba)
Commentary (MNa) āsītikapabbāni vā kāḷapabbāni vā'ti yathā āsītikavalliyā vā kāḷavalliyā vā sandhiṭṭhānesu milāyitvā majjhe unnatunnatāni honti, evaṃ mayhaṃ aṅgapaccaṅgāni hontī'ti dasseti.
Sanskrit āsītakī + parvan

seyyathā'pi nāma āsītikapabbāni vā kāḷapabbāni vā, evam'ev'assu me aṅgapaccaṅgāni bhavanti tāy'ev'app'āhāratāya. seyyathā'pi nāma oṭṭhapadaṃ, evam'ev'assu me ānisadaṃ hoti tāy'ev'app'āhāratāya.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
āsīdati

pr. approaches; meets with, encounters; approaches with (physical or verbal) violence; strikes against, hits; offends, insults [ā + √sad] ✗
āsīditvā

Root Family ā √sad
Root √sad･1 a (sink, sit, settle)

Construction ā + sīda + itvā
Sanskrit āsattvā
Sanskrit Root √sad 1, 6 (sit)
āsīna 1

pp. seated; sitting [√ās + na] ✓

Grammar pp of āsati, in comps
Meaning seated; sitting
Root Family √ās
Root √ās･1 a (sit)
Construction √ās + [ī] + na
Derivative kita (na)
Phonetic Change +ī
Sanskrit āsīna
Sanskrit Root √ās 2 (sit)

porāṇam'etaṃ atula,
n'etaṃ ajjatanām'iva,
nindanti tuṇhim'āsīnaṃ,
nindanti bahubhāṇinaṃ,
mitabhāṇim'pi nindanti,
n'atthi loke anindito.

DHP 227 kodhavaggo

jhāyiṃ virajam'āsīnaṃ,
katakiccaṃ anāsavaṃ,
pāraguṃ sabbadhammānaṃ,
atthi pañhena āgamaṃ,
aññāvimokkhaṃ pabrūhi,
avijjāya pabhedanaṃ.

pārāyanavaggo 13

te yājayogā bhavarāgarattā,
n'ātariṃsu jātijaran'ti brūmi.

vimalānaṃ samāgame.

BV 18 siddhattha buddhavaṃsa

aparimeyyito kappe,
caturo āsuṃ vināyakā,
taṇhaṅkaro medhaṅkaro,
atho'pi saraṇaṅkaro,
dīpaṅkaro ca sambuddho,
ekakappamhi te jinā.

BV 28 buddha pakiṇṇaka kaṇḍaṃ
āsevati 1

pr. (+acc) applies oneself (to); engages (with); practices; pursues [ā + √sev + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning applies oneself (to); engages (with); practices; pursues
Root Family ā √sev
Root √sev･1 a (serve, associate)
Base √sev + a > seva
Construction ā + seva + ti
Sanskrit āśrayati
Sanskrit Root √sev 1 (attend upon)

evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco bhikkhu bālo abyatto akhettaññū akusalo … paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati, so taṃ nimittaṃ na āsevati na bhāveti na bahulīkaroti na svādhiṭṭhitaṃ adhiṭṭhāti.

AN 9.35 gāvīupamāsuttaṃ

so taṃ maggaṃ āsevati bhāveti bahulīkaroti. tassa taṃ maggaṃ āsevato bhāvayato bahulīkaroto saṃyojanāni sabbaso pahīyanti anusayā byantīhonti.

AN 5.57 abhiṇhapaccavekkhitabbaṭhānasuttaṃ
āsevati 2

pr. associates, frequents [ā + √sev] ✗
āsevana

nt. succession, repetition; lit. close association [ā + √sev] ✗
āsevanā

fem. (+gen) diligent practising (of); applying oneself (to); cultivating (of); lit. close association [ā + √sev + anā] ✓

Grammar fem, act, from āsevati (+gen)
Meaning diligent practising (of); applying oneself (to); cultivating (of); lit. close association
Root Family ā √sev
Root √sev･1 a (serve, associate)
Construction ā + √sev + anā
Derivative kita (anā)
Commentary (SNa) āsevanāyā'ti kammaṭṭhān'āsevanāya.
Sanskrit āsevana
Sanskrit Root √sev 1 (attend upon)

yā tesaṃ'y'eva dhammānaṃ āsevanā bhāvanā bahulīkammaṃ, ayaṃ ettha samādhibhāvanā'ti.

MN 44 cūḷavedallasuttaṃ

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, attānaṃ rakkhanto paraṃ rakkhati? āsevanāya, bhāvanāya, bahulīkammena, evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, attānaṃ rakkhanto paraṃ rakkhati.

Base √sev + a > seva
Construction ā + seva + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Sanskrit āsevat
Sanskrit Root √sev 1 (attend upon)

so taṃ maggaṃ āsevati bhāveti bahulīkaroti. tassa taṃ maggaṃ āsevato bhāvayato bahulīkaroto saṃyojanāni sabbaso pahīyanti anusayā byantīhonti.

taṃ nimittaṃ āsevantena bhāventena bahulīkarontena mettāya vuttanayen'eva tikacatukkajjhānavasena appanā vaḍḍhetabbā.

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā
āsevi

aor. (+acc) applied oneself (to); practiced; pursued [ā + √sev + i] ✓

Root Family ā √sev
Root √sev･1 a (serve, associate)
Construction ā + √sev + i
Sanskrit āsev
Sanskrit Root √sev 1 (attend upon)

so kho ahaṃ, ānanda, aparena samayena kāmesu ādīnavaṃ disvā taṃ bahulamakāsiṃ, nekkhamme ānisaṃsaṃ adhigamma tam'āseviṃ. tassa mayhaṃ, ānanda, nekkhamme cittaṃ pakkhandati pasīdati santiṭṭhati vimuccati etaṃ santan'ti passato.

AN 9.41 tapussasuttaṃ

Sanskrit āsevita
Sanskrit Root √sev 1 (attend upon)

mettāya, bhikkhave, cetovimuttiyā āsevitāya bhāvitāya bahulīkatāya yānīkatāya vatthukatāya anuṭṭhitāya paricitāya susamāraddhāya ekādasānisaṃsā pāṭikaṅkhā.

AN 11.15 mettāsuttaṃ

amataṃ tesaṃ, bhikkhave, anāsevitaṃ yesaṃ kāyagatāsati anāsevitā. amataṃ tesaṃ, bhikkhave, āsevitaṃ yesaṃ kāyagatāsati āsevitā'ti.

AN 1.606 amatavaggo

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

katamo ca, bhikkhave, āsevitabbo dhammo? sammādiṭṭhi, ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, āsevitabbo dhammo'ti.

AN 10.194 āsevitabbadhammasuttaṃ
āsevitabbadhammasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.194 (AN10.194) ✗
āsevitabbasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.150 (AN10.150) ✗
āha

perf. (+acc) said [√ah + a + a] ✓

Grammar perf of √ah, trans (+acc)
Meaning said
Root Family √ah
Root √ah･1 a (speak)
Base √ah + a > aha
Construction a + aha + a
Notes Kacc 475, 565. brū bhūnam'āha bhūvā parokkhāyaṃ.
Sanskrit āha
Sanskrit Root √ah - (say)

eh'ambho purisa, yaṃ jānāsi taṃ vadehī'ti. so ajānaṃ vā āha, jānāmī'ti, jānaṃ vā āha, na jānāmī'ti, apassaṃ vā āha, passāmī'ti, passaṃ vā āha, na passāmī'ti.

AN 3.28 gūthabhāṇīsuttaṃ

na brāhmaṇo aññato suddhim'āha,
diṭṭhe sute sīlavate mute vā,
puññe ca pāpe ca anūpalitto,
attañjaho na'y'idha pakubbamāno.

SNP 42 suddhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 4
āhacca 1.1

ger. (+acc) pressing against; forcing against [ā + √han + tya] ✓

Grammar ger of āhanati, trans (+acc)
Meaning pressing against; forcing against
Root Family ā √han
Root √han･1 a (strike, kill)
Construction ā + √han + tya
Phonetic Change ty > cc
Notes (CPD) In some cases the etymology is clear, in others not. Probably two homonyms have grown together into one word.
Sanskrit āhatya
Sanskrit Root √han 1, 2 (smite)

tassa mayhaṃ, aggivessana, etadahosi, yaṃnūn'āhaṃ dantebhi dantam'ādhāya, jivhāya tāluṃ āhacca, cetasā cittaṃ abhiniggaṇheyyaṃ abhinippīḷeyyaṃ abhisantāpeyyan'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

moneyyaṃ te upaññissaṃ,
khuradhār'ūpamo bhave,
jivhāya tālum'āhacca,
udare saññato siyā.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11
āhacca 2.1

adj. removable; detachable; lit. to be carried away [ā + √har + tya] ✓

Grammar adj, ptp of āharati
Meaning removable; detachable; lit. to be carried away
Root Family ā √har
Root √har･1 a (carry)
Construction ā + √har + tya
Derivative kicca (tya)
Phonetic Change ty > cc
Sanskrit āhṛtya (having fetched)
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)

yo pana bhikkhu saṅghike vihāre uparivehāsakuṭiyā āhaccapādakaṃ mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā abhinisīdeyya vā abhinipajjeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 18 vehāsakuṭisikkhāpadaṃ
āhaccapādaka

adj. with removable legs; with detachable feet [āhacca + pāda + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with removable legs; with detachable feet
Construction āhacca + pāda + ka
āhaccapāda + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Compound kammadhāraya (āhacca + pādaka)
Commentary (VIN 2.5.2.8) āhaccapādako nāma mañco ... pīṭhaṃ aṅge vijjhitvā ṭhitaṃ hoti. (VINa) āhaccapādako'ti ayaṃ pana āhaccapādako nāma mañco aṅge vijjhitvā kato hotī'ti evaṃ parato pāḷiyaṃ'y'eva vutto, tasmā aṭaniyo vijjhitvā tattha pādasikhaṃ pavesetvā upari āṇiṃ datvā katamañco, āhaccapādako'ti veditabbo.
Sanskrit āhṛtya (having fetched) + pādaka

yo pana bhikkhu saṅghike vihāre uparivehāsakuṭiyā āhaccapādakaṃ mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā abhinisīdeyya vā abhinipajjeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 18 vehāsakuṭisikkhāpadaṃ

mañco nāma cattāro mañcā, masārako, bundik'ābaddho, kuḷīrapādako, āhaccapādako.

VIN 2.5.2.4 paṭhamasenāsanasikkhāpadaṃ
āhañchati

fut. (+acc) (of a drum) will beat; will strike; will sound [ā + √han + a + ssa + ti] ✓

Grammar fut of āhanati, trans (+acc)
Meaning (of a drum) will beat; will strike; will sound
Root Family ā √han
Root √han･1 a (strike, kill)
Base √han + a + ssa > hañcha (fut, irreg)
Construction ā + hañcha + ti
Commentary (MNa) āhañchaṃ amatadundubhin'ti dhammacakkapaṭilābhāya amatabheriṃ paharissāmī'ti
Sanskrit āhaniṣyati
Sanskrit Root √han 1, 2 (smite)

dhammacakkaṃ pavattetuṃ,
gacchāmi kāsinaṃ puraṃ,
andhībhūtasmiṃ lokasmiṃ,
āhañchaṃ amatadundubhin'ti.

VIN 1.2.8 duṭṭhadosasikkhāpadaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, tam'eva bhaginiṃ passeyya aparena samayena āsītikaṃ vā nāvutikaṃ vā vassasatikaṃ vā jātiyā, jiṇṇaṃ gopānasivaṅkaṃ bhoggaṃ daṇḍaparāyanaṃ pavedhamānaṃ gacchantiṃ āturaṃ gatayobbanaṃ khaṇḍadantaṃ palitakesaṃ, vilūnaṃ khalitasiraṃ valinaṃ tilak'āhatagattaṃ.

DHPa 1.2.1 sāmāvatīvatthu

sīghaṃ dāruādīni āharathā'ti gahapatike vatvā gāmamajjhe vuttapakāraṃ gehaṃ kārāpetvā gāmasatato paṇṇākāraṃ āharāpetvā janapadaseṭṭhino santikā dhītaraṃ ānetvā maṅgalaṃ katvā seṭṭhissa sāsanaṃ pahiṇi, idañ'c'idañ'ca mayā katan'ti.

āharesi

aor. (+acc) took (the knife); committed (suicide) [ā + √har + *e + si] ✓

Grammar aor of āharati, caus, trans (+acc)

Root Family ā √har
Root √har･1 *e (carry)

Notes mā satthaṃ āharesi "don’t commit suicide"
Sanskrit āhṛ
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)

sace āyasmato channassa n'atthi patirūpā upaṭṭhākā, ahaṃ āyasmantaṃ channaṃ upaṭṭhahissāmi. mā āyasmā channo satthaṃ āharesi. yāpet'āyasmā channo, yāpentaṃ mayaṃ āyasmantaṃ channaṃ icchāmā'ti.

SN 35.87 channasuttaṃ
āhaṃsu

Root √ah･1 a (speak)
Base √ah + a > aha
Construction a + aha + aṃsu
Variant āhu
Sanskrit āhuḥ
Sanskrit Root √ah - (say)

saccaṃ kir'evam'āhaṃsu,
narā ekacciyā idha,
kaṭṭhaṃ niplavitaṃ seyyo,
na tv'ev'ekacciyo naro'ti.

JA 73 saccaṃkira jātakaṃ

bhante, sace ayyā imaṃ temāsaṃ idha vaseyyuṃ, mayaṃ saraṇesu patiṭṭhāya sīlāni gaṇheyyāmā'ti āhaṃsu

DHPa 1.1.1 cakkhupālattheravatthu
āhāra 1

masc. (+dat) food (for); fuel (for); sustenance (for); nutriment (for); (comm) condition [ā + √har + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from āharati (+dat)
Meaning food (for); fuel (for); sustenance (for); nutriment (for); (comm) condition
Root Family ā √har
Root √har･1 a (take, seize)
Construction ā + √har > hār + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym anāhāra
Commentary (VIN 2.5.4.10) āhāro nāma udakadantaponaṃ ṭhapetvā yaṃkiñci ajjhoharaṇīyaṃ, eso āhāro nāma.
Sanskrit āhāra
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)

yato kho, āvuso, ariyasāvako āhārañ'ca pajānāti

MN 9 sammādiṭṭhisuttaṃ

kāyagutto vacīgutto,
āhāre udare yato,
saccaṃ karomi niddānaṃ,
soraccaṃ me pamocanaṃ.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
āhāra 2

adj. (+acc) eating; taking; feeding on [ā + √har + *a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from āharati (+acc)
Meaning eating; taking; feeding on
Root Family ā √har
Root √har･1 a (take, seize)
Construction ā + √har > hār + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit āhāra
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)

so sākabhakkho'pi hoti sāmākabhakkho'pi hoti nīvārabhakkho'pi hoti daddulabhakkho'pi hoti haṭabhakkho'pi hoti kaṇabhakkho'pi hoti ācāmabhakkho'pi hoti piññākabhakkho'pi hoti tiṇabhakkho'pi hoti gomayabhakkho'pi hoti, vanamūlaphal'āhāro'pi yāpeti pavattaphalabhojī.

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ
āhāra 3

masc. quotation [ā + √har] ✗
āhāraṭṭhitika

adj. subsisting on food; dependent on fuel; lit. standing by food [āhāra + ṭhitika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning subsisting on food; dependent on fuel; lit. standing by food
Construction āhāra + ṭhitika
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (āhārena + ṭhitika)
Commentary (SNa) āhāraṭṭhitiko'ti paccayaṭṭhitiko. (ANa) āhāraṭṭhitikā'ti āhārato ṭhiti etesan'ti āhāraṭṭhitikā
Sanskrit āhāra + sthitika

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, ayaṃ kāyo āhāraṭṭhitiko, āhāraṃ paṭicca tiṭṭhati, anāhāro no tiṭṭhati, evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, pañca nīvaraṇā āhāraṭṭhitikā, āhāraṃ paṭicca tiṭṭhanti, anāhārā no tiṭṭhanti.

SN 46.2 kāyasuttaṃ

katamo eko dhammo abhiññeyyo? sabbe sattā āhāraṭṭhitikā. ayaṃ eko dhammo abhiññeyyo.

DN 34.2 dasuttarasuttaṃ
āhāratthāya

ind. for food; lit. for the sake of food [āhāra + attha + āya] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning for food; lit. for the sake of food
Construction āhāra + attha + āya
āhārattha + āya
āhāranirodha

masc. ending of sustenance; cessation of fuel [āhāra + nirodha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning ending of sustenance; cessation of fuel
Construction āhāra + nirodha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (āhārassa + nirodha)
Antonym āhārasamudaya, āhārasambhava
Commentary (SNa) tadāhāranirodhā'ti tesaṃ āhārānaṃ nirodhena.
Sanskrit āhāra + nirodha

āhārasamudayā rūpasamudayo, āhāranirodhā rūpanirodho.

SN 22.57 sattaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

tadāhāranirodhā yaṃ bhūtaṃ taṃ nirodhadhamman'ti yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya passati.

SN 12.31 bhūtasuttaṃ
āhāranirodhagāmī

adj. leading to the cessation of sustenance [āhāra + nirodha + gāmī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to the cessation of sustenance
Construction āhāra + nirodha + gāmī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (āhāranirodhaṃ + gāmī)
Sanskrit āhāra + nirodha + gāmin

siyā, āvuso. yato kho, āvuso, ariyasāvako āhārañ'ca pajānāti, āhārasamudayañ'ca pajānāti, āhāranirodhañ'ca pajānāti, āhāranirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadañ'ca pajānāti, ettāvatā'pi kho, āvuso, ariyasāvako sammādiṭṭhi hoti

MN 9 sammādiṭṭhisuttaṃ
āhāranettippabhava

adj. with source of nourishment and guide (of craving) ✗
āhārapaccaya

masc. condition for the four nutriments ✗
āhārapaccayā

ind. dependent on food; due to fuel; lit. from condition of fuel [āhāra + paccaya + ā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, abl sg of āhārapaccaya
Meaning dependent on food; due to fuel; lit. from condition of fuel
Construction āhāra + paccaya + ā
āhārapaccaya + ā
Sanskrit āhāra + pratyayāt

yaṃ kiñci dukkhaṃ sambhoti sabbaṃ āhārapaccayā

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

yaṃ kiñci dukkhaṃ sambhoti,
sabbaṃ āhārapaccayā,
āhārānaṃ nirodhena,
n'atthi dukkhassa sambhavo.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ
āhārayanta

prp. (+acc) eating; taking food; consuming [ā + √har + *aya + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of āhārayati, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning eating; taking food; consuming
Root Family ā √har
Root √har･1 *aya (take, seize)
Base √har + *aya > hāraya (caus)
Construction ā + hāraya + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Variant āhārenta, āharayamāna
Sanskrit āharayat
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)

tassa mayhaṃ, aggivessana, thokaṃ thokaṃ āhāraṃ āhārayato, pasataṃ pasataṃ, yadi vā muggayūsaṃ, yadi vā kulatthayūsaṃ, yadi vā kaḷāyayūsaṃ, yadi vā hareṇukayūsaṃ, adhimattakasimānaṃ patto kāyo hoti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

tassa mayhaṃ, sāriputta, ekaṃ'y'eva kolaṃ āhāraṃ āhārayato adhimattakasimānaṃ patto kāyo hoti.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
āhāravagga

masc. Chapter 2 of the Nidānasaṃyuttaṃ, Book 2 of the Saṃyutta Nikāya ✗

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning source of food; arising from sustenance

Commentary (SNa) āhārasamudayā kāyassa samudayo'ti āhārasamudayena kāyasamudayo.
Sanskrit āhāra + samudaya

SN 22.57 sattaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

ko ca, bhikkhave, kāyassa samudayo? āhārasamudayā kāyassa samudayo, āhāranirodhā kāyassa atthaṅgamo.

SN 47.42 samudayasuttaṃ
āhārasambhava

adj. (what is) produced by food; generated by sustenance; come into being because of fuel [āhāra + sambhava] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning (what is) produced by food; generated by sustenance; come into being because of fuel
Construction āhāra + sambhava

Antonym āhāranirodha
Sanskrit āhāra + sambhava

tadāhārasambhavan'ti yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya passati. tadāhārasambhavan'ti yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya disvā āhārasambhavassa nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipanno hoti.

SN 12.31 bhūtasuttaṃ
āhārasambhūta

adj. produced by food; proceeding from food [āhāra + sambhūta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp

Construction āhāra + sambhūta

Commentary (ANa) āhārasambhūto'ti āhārena sambhūto āhāraṃ nissāya vaḍḍhito.
Sanskrit āhāra + sambhūta

āhārasambhūto ayaṃ, bhagini, kāyo āhāraṃ nissāya āhāro pahātabbo. taṇhāsambhūto ayaṃ, bhagini, kāyo taṇhaṃ nissāya taṇhā pahātabbā.

AN 4.159 bhikkhunīsuttaṃ
āhārasutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 12.11 (SN12.11) ✗
āhārasutta 2

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 46.51 (SN46.51) ✗
āhāritar

masc. (+acc) eater; who consumes [ā + √har + *itar] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from āharati (+acc)
Meaning eater; who consumes
Root Family ā √har
Root √har･1 a (take, seize)
Construction ā + √har > hār + *itar
Derivative kita (*itar)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit āhartṛ
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)

abhijānāmi kho pan'āhaṃ, sāriputta, ekaṃ'y'eva kolaṃ āhāraṃ āhāritā. siyā kho pana te, sāriputta, evam'assa, mahā nūna tena samayena kolo ahosī'ti. na kho pan'etaṃ, sāriputta, evaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ. tadā'pi etaparamo'y'eva kolo ahosi seyyathā'pi etarahi.

āhāreti

pr. (+acc) eats; takes food; consumes [ā + √har + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of āharati, trans (+acc)
Meaning eats; takes food; consumes
Root Family ā √har

Base √har + *e > hāre (caus)
Construction ā + hāre + ti
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit āhārayati
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)

byañjanaṃ kho pana bhavaṃ gotamo byañjanamattāya āhāreti, na ca byañjanena ālopaṃ atināmeti.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

evaṃ vutte, āyasmā moḷiyaphagguno bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, ko nu kho, bhante, viññāṇ'āhāraṃ āhāretī'ti? no kallo pañho'ti bhagavā avoca, āhāretī'ti ahaṃ na vadāmi.

SN 12.12 moḷiyaphaggunasuttaṃ
āhāretvā

Meaning having eaten; having taken food

Root √har･1 *e (take, seize)
Base √har + *e > hāre (caus)
Construction ā + hāre + tvā
Sanskrit āhrayitvā
Sanskrit Root √hṛ 1 (take)

so kho ahaṃ, aggivessana, oḷārikaṃ āhāraṃ āhāretvā, balaṃ gahetvā, vivicc'eva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṃ savicāraṃ vivekajaṃ pītisukhaṃ paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja vihāsiṃ.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

yato kho ahaṃ, aggivessana, oḷārikaṃ āhāraṃ āhāresiṃ odanakummāsaṃ, atha me te pañca bhikkhū nibbijja pakkamiṃsu, bāhulliko samaṇo gotamo, padhānavibbhanto, āvatto bāhullāyā'ti.

āhāsi

āhita 1

Sanskrit āhita

pakk'odano duddhakhīro'ham'asmi,
anutīre mahiyā samānavāso,
channā kuṭi āhito gini,
atha ce patthayasī pavassa deva.

SNP 2 dhaniyasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 2
āhita 2

pp. put in, put up [ā + √dhā] ✗
āhu

perf. (+acc) they say; lit. they said [√ah + a + u] ✓

Grammar perf 3rd pl of āha, trans (+acc)

Root √ah･1 a (speak)
Base √ah + a > aha
Construction a + aha + u
Variant ahaṃsu
Commentary (SNa) āhū'ti kathenti.
Sanskrit āhuḥ
Sanskrit Root √ah - (say)

tiṭṭhaṃ caraṃ nisinno vā,
sayāno yāvatāssa vigatamiddho,
etaṃ satiṃ adhiṭṭheyya,
brahmam'etaṃ vihāram'idha'm'āhu.

KHP 9 karaṇīya mettasuttaṃ

idh'eva suddhi iti vādayanti,
n'āññesu dhammesu visuddhim'āhu,
yaṃ nissitā tattha subhaṃ vadānā,
paccekasaccesu puthū niviṭṭhā.

aṭṭhakavaggo 8

Grammar adj, from āhuna
Meaning worthy of offerings; lit. to be offered to

āhuna + eyya

Commentary (MNa) āhuneyyassā'ti āhutiṃ paṭiggahetuṃ yuttassa.
Notes see MW āhavanīya
Sanskrit āhavanīya
Sanskrit Root √hu 2, 3 (sacrifice)

āhuneyyā'ti, bhikkhave, mātāpitūnaṃ etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. taṃ kissa hetu? bahukārā, bhikkhave, mātāpitaro, puttānaṃ āpādakā posakā imassa lokassa dassetāro'ti.

AN 4.63 brahmasuttaṃ

evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu āhuneyyo hoti pāhuneyyo dakkhiṇeyyo añjalikaraṇīyo anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassa.

AN 8.13 assājānīyasuttaṃ
āhuneyyaggi

masc. fire (of hell for those harming) someone worthy of offerings; lit. fire for offerings [āhuneyya + aggi] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning fire (of hell for those harming) someone worthy of offerings; lit. fire for offerings
Construction āhuneyya + aggi
Commentary (DNa) āhuneyy'aggī'tiādīsu āhunaṃ vuccati sakkāro, āhunaṃ arahantī'ti āhuneyyā. mātāpitaro hi puttānaṃ bahūpakāratāya āhunaṃ arahanti. tesu vippaṭipajjamānā puttā niray'ādīsu nibbattanti. tasmā kiñ'c'āpi mātāpitaro n'ānudahanti, anudahanassa pana paccayā honti. iti anudahan'aṭṭhena āhuneyy'aggī'ti vuccanti.
Sanskrit āhavanīya + agni
āhuneyyavagga 1

masc. Chapter 1 of Chakkanipāta, Aṅguttara Nikāya 6.1-10 ✗
āhuneyyavagga 2

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 5.1 (SN5.1) ✗
āḷavī 1

Meaning name of a country

AN 3.35 hatthakasuttaṃ
āḷavī 2

fem. name of a town [aṭavī] ✗
āḷāra

masc. name of the Buddha's first teacher; Āḷāra Kālāma; lit. curved ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning name of the Buddha's first teacher; Āḷāra Kālāma; lit. curved
Commentary (MNa) yena āḷāro kālāmo'ti ettha āḷāro'ti tassa nāmaṃ, dīghapiṅgalo kir'eso. ten'assa āḷāro'ti nāmaṃ ahosi.
Sanskrit ārāḍa

so evaṃ pabbajito samāno kiṃkusalagavesī anuttaraṃ santivarapadaṃ pariyesamāno yena āḷāro kālāmo ten'upasaṅkamiṃ, upasaṅkamitvā āḷāraṃ kālāmaṃ etadavocaṃ, icchām'ahaṃ, āvuso kālāma, imasmiṃ dhammavinaye brahmacariyaṃ caritun'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

ayaṃ kho āḷāro kālāmo paṇḍito viyatto medhāvī dīgharattaṃ apparaj'akkhajātiko. yaṃnūn'āhaṃ āḷārassa kālāmassa paṭhamaṃ dhammaṃ deseyyaṃ.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
āḷārika

masc. cook ✗
āḷāhana

nt. ground for cremation [ā + √ḍah] ✗
āḷi

fem. dam wall; embankment ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning dam wall; embankment
Variant āli
Commentary (MNa) āḷibandhā'ti mariyādabaddhā.
Sanskrit āli

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, same bhūmibhāge caturassā pokkharaṇī assa āḷibandhā pūrā udakassa samatittikā kākapeyyā. tam'enaṃ balavā puriso yato yato āḷiṃ muñceyya āgaccheyya udakan'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

MN 119 kāyagatāsatisuttaṃ
āḷinda

masc. verandah; porch; terrace ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning verandah; porch; terrace
Synonym pamukha
Variant ālinda
Sanskrit alinda

atha kho ambaṭṭho māṇavo yena so vihāro saṃvutadvāro, tena appasaddo upasaṅkamitvā ataramāno āḷindaṃ pavisitvā ukkāsitvā aggaḷaṃ ākoṭesi. vivari bhagavā dvāraṃ.

DN 3.3 ambaṭṭhasuttaṃ
āḷippabheda

masc. breaking the banks; bursting through the damn wall [āḷi + pabheda] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning breaking the banks; bursting through the damn wall
Construction āḷi + pabheda
Commentary (ANa) na āḷippabhedo pāṭikaṅkho'ti na pāḷippabhedo pāṭikaṅkhitabbo. na hi tato udakaṃ uṭṭhāya pāḷiṃ bhinditvā kacavaraṃ gahetvā mahāsamuddaṃ pāpuṇāti.
āḷibandha

adj. contained within dam walls; held by embankments [āḷi + bandha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning contained within dam walls; held by embankments
Construction āḷi + bandha
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (āḷiyā + bandha)
Variant ālibaddha
Commentary (MNa) āḷibandhā'ti mariyādabaddhā.
Sanskrit āli + baddha

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, same bhūmibhāge caturassā pokkharaṇī assa āḷibandhā pūrā udakassa samatittikā kākapeyyā. tam'enaṃ balavā puriso yato yato āḷiṃ muñceyya āgaccheyya udakan'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

MN 119 kāyagatāsatisuttaṃ
āḷimpeti

pr. (+acc) sets fire to; ignites [ā + √dīp + *e + ti] ~

Grammar pr, caus of ādippati, trans (+acc)
Meaning sets fire to; ignites
Root Family ā √dīp
Root √dīp･3 *e (shine, blaze)
Base √dīp + e > dīpe > ḷīpe > ḷimpe (caus, irreg)
Construction ā + ḷimpe + ti
Phonetic Change d > ḷ
Variant ālimpeti
Commentary (ANa) ālimpeyyā'ti tattha aṅgāre pakkhipitvā aggiṃ datvā nāḷikāya dhamanto aggiṃ gāhāpeyya. (VISMa) ālimpetī'ti ādīpeti jāleti.
Sanskrit ādīpayati
Sanskrit Root √dīp 4 (shine)
āḷimpetuṃ

inf. (+acc) to set fire to; to ignite [ā + √dīp + *e + tuṃ] ~

Grammar inf of ālimpeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning to set fire to; to ignite
Root Family ā √dīp
Root √dīp･3 *e (shine, blaze)
Base √dīp + e > dīpe > līpe > limpe (caus, irreg)
Construction ā + limpe + tuṃ
Phonetic Change d > l
Sanskrit Root √dīp 4 (shine)
āḷimpesi

aor. (+acc) set fire to; ignited [√dīp + *e + si] ~

Grammar aor of āḷimpeti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning set fire to; ignited
Root Family √dīp
Root √dīp･3 *e (shine, blaze)
Base √dīp + e > dīpe > ḷīpe > ḷimpe (caus, irreg)
Construction ā + ḷimpe + si
Variant ālimpesi
Commentary (DNa) āḷimpessāmā'ti aggiṃ gāhāpessāma.
Sanskrit ādīp
Sanskrit Root √dīp 4 (shine)
āḷhaka 1

masc. measure of volume ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning measure of volume
Notes 1 āḷhaka = 4 kosala pattha 1 āḷhaka = 1 tumba
Sanskrit āḍhaka

ukkaṭṭho nāma patto aḍḍh'āḷhak'odanaṃ gaṇhāti catubhāgaṃ khādanaṃ tadupiyaṃ byañjanaṃ.

VIN 1.4.3.1 pattasikkhāpadaṃ
āḷhaka 2

nt. measure of volume ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning measure of volume
Notes 1 āḷhaka = 4 kosala pattha 1 āḷhaka = 1 tumba
Sanskrit āḍhaka

ukkaṭṭho nāma patto aḍḍh'āḷhak'odanaṃ gaṇhāti catubhāgaṃ khādanaṃ tadupiyaṃ byañjanaṃ.

VIN 1.4.3.1 pattasikkhāpadaṃ
